Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Doris Gilda

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de kantuta” desde hace cuatro años atrás, ubicado en la Provincia de Yunguyo y Departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucción superior completo, tiene tres  hijos, uno de 20 y dos de 18  años de edad (gemelos).
Gilda tiene su propio restaurant de comida desde hace ocho años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y ampliar su negocio.
Ahora solicitará  un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles  para comprar  vívereres.   
Su visión es tener un hotel. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Doris has been member for four years of the community bank “Flor de kantuta” (kantuta flower), it's located in the Province of Yunguyo, department of Puno, she is 50, married, finished high school and has three children ages 20 and eighteen (twins). Doris has had her own restaurant for eight years. With the first loan (500 new soles) requested to the Manuela Ramos movement she was able to increase working capital and expand her business. She now requests a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy groceries. She envisions having a hotel. What she likes the most about the community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and groceries to prepare food

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 49 years old and married. She has eight children and the younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Manuela operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Manuela has been engaged in her business for over 29 years.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Manuela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Estela Maribel

texts.es: Estela Maribel R. D. P., madre soltera D. dos hijos D. 10 y 12 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tortillería la cual está ubicada en el mercado D. la colonia El Matazano ubicado en el mismo municipio D. Soyapango. Ella cuenta con 6 años D. contar con este negocio el cual le permite brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales son la prioridad en su vida. Con el deseo D. poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus pequeños, Estela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una nueva cocina para hacer las tortillas, así mismo comprar cilindros D. gas propano y también comprar maíz y frijol por mayor. Estela desea salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Estela Maribel R. D. P. is a single mother of two children who are 10 and 12 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. Estela has a tortilla stand in the El Matazano market which is located in the municipality of Soyapango. She has been in this business for six years and it allows her to proviD. everything necessary to her two small children who are her priority.

With the desire to be able to proviD. her children with a better life, Estela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a new cooker to make the tortillas, as well as propane gas tanks and wholesale corn and beans. Estela wants to get ahead and this way, have a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn and beans.

loans.name: Nelly Margoth

texts.es:
Nelly Margoth C. C. tiene 21 años. Es soltera vive con un hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 
 
Nelly pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Nelly trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la comprar maiz arroz y frejol. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero para dar la educación al hijo.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Nelly Margoth C. C. is 21 years of age.  She is single and lives with her son in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She has one son. 
 
Nelly belongs to the Nueva Inspiración (New Inspiration) communal bank located in the Anchoveta precinct, which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group dedicated to farming crops with short growing cycles, mainly corn, rice and grandul beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  This group has 13 members.

Nelly works in agriculture.  She sows corn, rice and beans.  She buys her seed in Guayaquil and sells her crops in the in the area near her home and in the market of Ventanas. 

She requests the loan to buy corn and rice for sowing.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  Her dream is to buy supplies to continue sowing her crops and to have money to give an education to her son.  She likes to cook.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice and beans for sowing crops.

loans.name: Sonia Roxana

texts.es:
La Sra A. D. Q. Sonia Roxana cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio desD. el mes D. marzo del 2009 hasta la actualidad. Asímismo se dedica también a la venta D. cerveza y D. comida en las quincenas D. cada mes. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería y D. un exhibidor para mostrar los productos que ofrece en su negocio.
Tiene buenas referencias personales por parte D. los vecinos y tiene deseos D. superación para asi obtener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sonia Roxana A. D. Q. has had a small store in her home from March 2009 to the present. She also works selling beer and food every two weeks.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise and a showcase to show the products that she sells in her business.

She has good personal references from her neighbors, as well as professional references, and has the desire to succeed so that she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: La Señora Maria Isaura tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, vive en el municipio de santo tomas, en donde tiene una gran variedad de clientes. Tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad ambos estudian en colegios públicos. Con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos educación, casa, salud y vestimenta. Ella es comerciante de ropa la ofrece de manera ambulante todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años. Este crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir más su local. Ya que actualmente tiene ciertos pedidos por acercarse la época navideña y así ofrecer variedad.
texts.en: Maria Isaura has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time.  She lives in the town of Santo Tomas where she has a lot of customers.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children who are both studying in local schools.  Through work and effort, she and her husband have managed to provide their children with education, a house, healthcare and clothes.  Maria Isaura has a business selling clothes.  She sells her goods itinerantly every day without fixed hours.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She will invest this loan in buying more clothes to stock her business since she currently has some orders pending with the Christmas period approaching and she would like to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ma. Amparo

texts.en:
Ma. Amparo M. is from the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 39 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Amparo owns and operates a vulcanizing shop. The main source of income for the business comes from providing services in the local community. Ma. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Amparo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Ma. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ma. Amparo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Doria

texts.en:
Doria B. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Doria is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Doria owns & operates transportation business. Doria has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Doria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Doria is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better transportation services. This will be the first loan taken out by Doria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 59 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, es viuda,  vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos de los 9 que tiene. Siendo sola,  tuvo que trabajar duro y parejo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ocupándose así en  diversas actividades. De entre todas, lo que más le gustaba desarrollar, fue el servicio de lavado de ropa a domicilio. De esa amanera solo acumulaba algunas ganancias, con ello fue educando a sus hijos. Pero a medida que pasó el tiempo, quiso ganar más, así que se propuso comprar su lavadora y se compró uno de segundo uso, desde entonces su labor es más productiva y rentable. En adelante, quiere terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar  un lugar para desarrollando dicha actividad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará accesorios para mandar a reparar su lavadora.
texts.en: Ana is a very happy and hardworking 59-year-old mother.  She is widowed and lives in her own house with three of her nine children.  Being single, she had to work hard and consistently to get her children ahead, which is why she kept herself busy with various activities.  Of all of them, what she has liked most was the home clothes washing service.  She only earned some money through this, which she used for her children’s education.  As time passed, however, she wanted to earn more so she decided to purchase a used washing machine.  Since then, her work has been more productive and profitable.  In the future, she wants to finish building her house and set up a place to do her work.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is sure that this loan will be very beneficial to her business’ development.  With the loan requested, she will buy accessories to fix her washing machine.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and spare parts to fix her washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase all the necessities of her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 42 years old, is from the town of San Francisco. She is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 15 years old, while the youngest is only 3. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna works hard to sustain her children's education. She says that as their mother, it's her responsibility to give them proper education.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zyndel Marie

texts.en:
Zyndel Marie is a 21-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Puerto Princesa City,  Palawan. 

Zyndel Marie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Zyndel Marie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks for the store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of her business.

 Zyndel Marie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Jenis

texts.es:
Jenis O. Ramírez, tiene 33 años y vive en Barranquilla, ciudad donde comercializa mercancía variada, como bolsos, calzados, vestidos y productos de belleza; desde hace 18 años se inició en la actividad mercantil,  que fue su primera experiencia,  en el sector de alimentos,  vendía carnes frías  y con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y disciplina, logro reunir gradualmente sus capital de trabajo, incluyendo en su oferta una gran variedad   de productos que  incrementaron sus utilidades, impactando positivamente  los ingresos de su hogar. 
Su meta principal es el crecimiento de su negocio, para seguir apoyando a su esposo en las obligaciones familiares que comparten, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la educación de sus dos  hijos. Su mayor desafío se presento cuando bajaron las ventas por la ola invernal que se presentó a finales del año pasado,  pero el negocio de Jenis  gradualmente se ha ido recuperando y ha vuelto a la normalidad.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y justamente su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará vestuario y calzado, porque con esta venta ensanchará la cobertura de clientes, entre los que se encuentra   referidos  a los que quiere llegar y de los cuales tomó sus pedidos, esto  garantizaría la inversión exitosa de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jenis O. Ramírez is 33 years old and lives in Barranquilla where she sells various items such as purses, shoes, dresses, and beauty products. She has been a merchant for 18 years, beginning in the food sector. She sold fried meats and with much effort, dedication, and discipline, gradually increased her working capital, and added a variety of products. This greatly increased her income for her household.

Her main goal is to enlarge her business, to continue helping her husband with their shared family obligations, especially their children's education. Her greatest challenge came when sales decreased with the cold weather at the end of last year. But the business has gradually recuperated and is now back to normal. 

This is Jenis’ first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva. She will use the money to buy clothing and footwear. With this purchase, she will widen her client base, from past customers to referred customers and future customers. This would guarantee a successful investment of the loan.

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Nora Abrenilla's Group

texts.en:
Nora A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan,Isabela. She is 38 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa E. is married to a cleaner and they have six children. For the past 20 years, she has run two businesses to help support their family. She is a baker and also sells charcoal in the village of Ntranoa, near Elmina town. Her earnings help pay for the school fees. 

Adjowa wishes to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She plans to reinvest the additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, a 35-year-old married mother of five children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 10 years and earns additional income from vegetable farming and chicken-raising.

Mercy, who has received and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, biscuits, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rous' Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. Rous was born in 1964 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Doeuk who was born in 1963, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow vegetables. This is how they support their family. In order to improve the farming, Mrs. Rous would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crop.

This couple has four children: one is a police officer, two are seamstresses in the garment factories, and the last one is student.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crop.

loans.name: Rwengwe Tukore Group

texts.en:
Victor B. is a 43-year-old business man who subsists on his agriculture business. He mostly grows and sells tea leaves in Rwengwe-Kihihi. He has been in this business for the last nine years and he says he joined this business on sensing the ready tea market in most of Western Uganda.

His farming gardens are mostly full of growing tea. Hard work and determination have been the towers of strength for this happily married father of six. He says weekly his tea sales business profits are to the tune of 100,000 UGX. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase fertilizers for his tea gardens.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his tea crop.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients which earns her reasonably good profits. She learned about this art from her mother before her marriage. 

She is also a very good housewife and meets her household responsibilities very well. She is 29 years old and has a little child. She takes care of him well, bringing him up with good care and discipline. 

Her husband is 31 years old and is a carpet weaver. His products are in demand in the market and he earns a good amount of income from his business. 

Humaira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy thread and weaving tools for weaving carpets which will help him make a better income. 

She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his profits and allow her family to live a better life financially. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy thread and weaving tools for carpet weaving

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a single parent taking care of a child. She has received a senior high education. Kate sells fruits, plastic cups, trays and bowls at Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. She wants to increase the sale of plastic containers, so she needs a loan to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to save towards her child’s education and to reinvest back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more plastic cups, trays and bowls to sell

loans.name: Alianza Unida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Alianza Unida esta formado por 12 mujeres, quienes son muy amables, trabajadoras y luchadoras, cada una de nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades  que les permiten ayudar y mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias es la Señora. Wilma, ella vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana.
 
Tiene 39 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus dos hijos son casados e independientes y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
 
Doña Wilma labora como empleada privada, se encuentra en este trabajo hace 11 años y labora de lunes a viernes.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos detalles.

Las tres fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes en la reunión que se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" is comprised of 12 women who are kind, hard workers who struggle to get ahead.  Each one of our members works in a different activity which helps support and improve their household economy.  They live in different places around the city of Cuenca which is the third largest in the county.  Its architecture is a blend of colonial and modern and its people maintain the culture and traditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Wilma who lives in the center of Cuenca.  This is her first loan through the communal bank, which her sister invited her to join.  She is 39, married and has three children, ages 19, 18 and 13.  Two of her children are married and independent and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic and works in his own shop.  Together they have been able to build their own house.

Doña Wilma has been a private sector employee for 11 years and works Monday through Friday. She plans to use the loan to buy consumer goods for the household.  Her goal is to finish her home because some things are still missing.

The small photos are of the three members who could not be present for the group picture due to work obligations.

loans.use: To buy consumer goods.

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru:
Amil 29 let. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Amil uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov . Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda , v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren Kive i lenderam.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291
texts.en:
Amil is 29 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Amil is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and child.  Amil has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for eight years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  This is his second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200, and he is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the loan.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Celinda Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora. Celinda es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de Nabon,  esta comunidad  es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

Doña Celinda tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 9 y 2 años y un bebé de  9 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Celinda se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas. También se dedica a la cría de animales los que vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas.

Su sueño es estudiar en el colegio.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the communal bank "Neuvo Bankito La Ramada" and she lives by the community of Nabon. This community is of cold climate and its people work in agriculture and livestock farming. Much of the population works in the city. 

Celinda is 29 years old, a single mother, and she has conceived 3 children. They are 9, 2, and the baby is 9 months old. Her eldest son attends school in the city. The house in which she lives is her own property. 

Celinda is an agriculturist and she plants vegetables. She also raises livestock and she sells them in her community. 

She is on her fourth loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds. 

Her dream is to go to high school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 36 years old and lives in the community of Airport in Liberia. She is married and has two children (3 months and 11 years old), one of whom is in school. For the past seven years she has been selling plantains, eddoes, and potatoes. One of her business challenges is that she has more customers than she has inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, eddoes, and potatoes for her business. Her future plans include building a house and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase plantain, eddoes, potatoes for her business

loans.name: Reonel

texts.en:
"If there's no pain, there's no gain" is an inspiring quote of Reonel, a 20-year-old single man who has been engaged in rice farming for almost four years. Every harvest season he only earned PHP 20,000 net income. To improve his crop production, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice.

His plan is to have a plentiful harvest to increase his income, save for future emergencies and to help his parents send his younger brothers and sisters to school. He hopes that through hard work and strong determination, he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and pay for labor

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, su negocio es un Bar- Restaurante, el prñestamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, es socia de FINCA Peru hace 1 año y le gusta mucho por el apoyo que le brindan y además de todo lo que puede aprender aquí, ella empezó siendo ayudante de cocina, mecera, y así pudo aprender y ahorra para tener su propio Restaurante, ahora la meta que tiene es poder tener una Ferretería.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank “Paraiso” (Paradise). She is 38 years old and has two children. María owns a bar and restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and greatly enjoys the support that she has received. In addition, she has learned much since joining the organization. María started out as a kitchen assistant and waitress, but she was able to learn and save up money to have her own restaurant.

Now her goal is to open a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is 46 years old and married with five children. Four of them are attending school and living in his house in Masindi, Uganda. His family goal is for his children to obtain higher levels of education. Siraji is a taxi driver and has been in the transportation sector for eight years.
He started by driving in the Ministry of Defense, but later realized that he could make more money driving his own car. With his savings, he bought a small car (a Starlet) which works as a taxi. A hardships in the business is high traffic fees. His dream is to buy a mini bus. The purpose of the loan is to service and repair his vehicle which is in poor mechanical condition.

loans.use: To service and repair his vehicle which is in poor mechanical condition.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz con su esposo tiene un alquiler de lavadoras, sin embargo su economía no mejoraba y decidieron hacer helados para mejorar su calidad de vida, ella aprendió esta labor con unas amigas.

Sin embargo ella necesita comprar insumos para tener mas sabores de helados ya que una vecina también vende helados y le está quitando la clientela.

Ella debe levantase cada día a las 4:00 a.m para producir los helados.
texts.en:
Beatriz and her husband had a laundry mat, but as the economy did not improve they decided to make ice cream in order to improve their quality of life. She learned how to do this with some friends. 

However, she needs to buy supplies in order to have more flavors of ice cream because a neighbor also sells ice cream and she is stealing her customers. 

She gets up every morning at 4:00 AM to make ice cream.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Raghda wants to purchase new home furniture such as living room furniture, bedroom furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. When Raghda gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase the furniture she needs for her house, and this will offer better life conditions to her family. 

Raghda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling used clothes for the last year to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to run the business. Gladys is able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is 38 years old and has been in mixed farming for over eight years. Her produce of maize, milk, eggs and beans currently go to the local markets. She is married with six children between two and sixteen years old. She currently employs two farmhands.

Margaret has requested a loan for 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the boost in dairy farming will help her retain business and improve her family's living standards significantly.

She is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans are enabling farmers buy better breeds of dairy cows. She notes, however, that food shortages and animal diseases are major challenges.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vianus

texts.en:
Vainus is married and a father of six children, aged 21-5, living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He has dependents and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

For 11 years he has been running a spare parts business and he started as a small-scale farmer. He saved to start his current business. He is faced with a challenge of poor roads and bad debts but despite the challenges he is facing he believes business is doing well.

Vainus needs a loan to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vumilia Group in Western Kenya! Isabella is the facilitator of the Vumilia group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isabella takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Isabella had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isabella was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isabella and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isabella will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Isabella is pictured with her members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish constructing her house.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a café business, selling food to her neighbors and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes and kitchenware.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es: La señora Claudia a sus 24 años de edad se dedica al engorde y venta de pollos desde un pequeño galpón (lugar de vivienda de pollos) adecuado en el solar de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres con quienes vivió su infancia y adolescencia en una finca. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos y así la calidad de vida de sus dos hijos de 3 y un año de edad, la señora Claudia necesita de la compra de pollos para engorde y concentrado para su alimentación. El sueño de la señora Claudia es tener su propia finca y brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos quienes no cuentan con el apoyo de sus padre quien se separo de ellos apenas nacieron.
texts.en: Claudia is 24 years old and she engages in breeding and selling chickens in a small chicken shed (a place where the chickens live) located in the top story of her house. She has been trained in this activity from her parents, with whom she lived in a farm during her childhood and adolescence. Aiming at increasing her income and consequently her own standard of living as well as that of her two children aged 3 and one, Claudia needs to buy chickens to breed and concentrated feed to nourish them. Claudia dreams of having her own farm and to offer the best to her children, as they cannot count on their father’s support because he left her and them right after they were born.

loans.use: To buy chickens to breed and concentrated feed to nourish them.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old, married, and has five children. He has been operating a barber shop for the last four years earning a monthly income of 10,200 KES.

John is requesting his first loan with KADET for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase a shaving machine, detergents, hair combs, and after shave. With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business. His dream is to diversify into farming.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine, detergents, hair combs, and after shave.

loans.name: Main De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAIN DE DIEU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Brigitte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Ayaba Brigitte est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayaba Brigitte est mariée à un certain Boris. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Ayaba Brigitte vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Ayaba Brigitte vend depuis  dix ans, des perles et des colliers. Ayaba Brigitte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ayaba Brigitte ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAIN DE DIEU, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des colliers et des perles.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado ovino orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder pagar el alquiler de un terreno agrícola, en el cual planea sembrar cultivos orgánicos, con la venta de los cuales espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su pareja, y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para alquilar un terreno agrícola para sembrar cultivos orgánicos que pueda vender a un mayor precio para mejorar sus ingresos económicos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Dossou

texts.en:
Dossou H. was born on October 20, 1985 in Agbodrafo (in Lacs prefecture). He was orphaned very early on when his father died, so he had to leave school for an apprenticeship at his uncle’s place, where he learned how to cut hair. As a single man with no children, he lacks the means to open his own shop. This is because he works much like a laborer for his uncle, who exploits him.

To remedy the situation, he is hoping for a loan of $600, which will allow him to open a modern barber shop and to buy certain indispensable supplies to get his business going. The realization of his dream will help improve his life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur H. Dossou est né le 20 octobre 1985 à Agbodrafo dans la préfecture des Lacs. Très tôt orphelin de père, il a du abandonner ses études pour l’apprentissage de la coiffure chez son oncle. Célibataire sans enfant il manque de moyens pour ouvrir son propre atelier car il travail comme ouvrier chez son oncle qui l’exploite.

Il souhaite pour cela un appui financier de $600, qui va lui permettre d’ouvrir un atelier moderne et d’acheter certains matériels très indispensables pour le démarrage du métier. La réalisation de se rêve contribuera à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To open a modern barber shop and to acquire supplies and tools of the trade

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Alba sells cosmetics and costume jewelry-door-to door. Albita started her business with $200 dollars of savings. Initially she only sold cosmetics. Now she sells all types of costume jewelry and clothing. Alba apires to sell cosmetic-clothing combos. She will use this loan to invest in merchandise at volume wholesale prices to increase her profits. Alba is married, 37 years old, married with four children. She depends on this business to support her family and to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Alba se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería recorriendo puerta a puerta por sectores marginales. Albita empezó su negocio con unos ahorros de $200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía cosméticos. Ahora vende toda clase de bisutería y ropa. Alba aspira vender combos de cosméticos y ropa. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Alba esta casada. Ella tiene 37 años, esta casada, tiene 4 niños depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Mrs. Veng D. is 37 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has five children and makes her living by selling porridge to the people in her neighbourhood and she earns five dollars a day doing this. Her husband works in a small private company and earns up to  three dollars per day. Currently, Veng D. needs a motor-bike for her husband, so that he will no longer spend much money on his public transportion each day.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of five hundred dollars.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her husband, so that he will no longer spend much on his earnings on public transport each day.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru:
Azamjon A., 23 is married and has a high school education. He sells “a thousand little things” including hair pins, thread spools, wallets, etc. Azamjon A. learned the trade by helping his brother to sell. Then, he opened his own business. In 2005, he received his first loan of $100. Gradually increasing the assortment of goods, Azamjon A. bought a retail spot. He began to sell wholesale as well as retail. Now, his business assets grew up to $1300. Azamjon A. plans to purchase another retail spot.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоев Аъзамчон 23лет, женат, образование среднее. Аъзамчон занимается реализацией тысяча мелочей (заколки для волос, нитки, кошельки и т.д.). Помогая своему брату в торговле, он набрал опыт в этой деятельности и открыл свой бизнес. В 2005году он получил первый займ в размере 100$. Постепенно он увеличил ассортимент товара и приобрел своё место для торговли, стал реализовать товар оптом и в розницу. Сейчас его активы возросли до 1300$, и в будущем он планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another retail spot

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Mrs. Chao P., age 38, works with her husband selling vegetables  at a busy market, earning around $9 each day in revenue. They have three children: two who are students and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand at the market so they do not have to spend a great portion of their income each month to rent a stall. This will increase their income and help them finance their children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photos as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stall in the market to sell vegetables so they no longer have to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ni Wayan Karsini

texts.id:
At the moment Ni Wayan Karsini, a housewife and a mother of two, is having a business of pig farming. She has 3 piglets at the moment which are farmed under a simple bamboo hut behind her house.

She has been farming these 3 piglets for 2 months now. With pig foods costing of IDR 10,000 (approx US$ 1.1) per day, the profit after 6 months of farming from 3 piglets can be IDR 900,000 (approx of US$ 95). This money is really significant to help her to provide for her family's daily needs. This additional income is very important to supplement the income from her husband, Putu Yasa, who works as a seasonal driver and he doesn't have a fixed income.

With this business, she wants to expand the pig farming so she can provide more to her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Saat ini Ni Wayan Karsini sedang menjalankan usaha memelihara babi pengemukan disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yg mengurusi 2 orang anak. Karsini memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Dengan kandang yang terbuat dari bambu yang berada dibelakang rumahnya. Sudah dua bulan tiga ekor babi ini dipelihara. Setiap pagi sebelum memberi makan Karsini menyiram kandang terlebih dahulu, lalu diberi makan saat siang dan sore hari. Dengan modal pakan perhari Rp.10.000.- keuntungan selama 6 bulan dari 3 ekor babi sebesar Rp. 900.000,-Keuntungan ini sangat membantu biaya rumah tangganya. Karena suaminya, Putu Yasa, hanya sebagai sopir yang mendapat upah tidak menentu dan hanya tergantung dari orderan. Jika ada orderan maka suaminya akan mendapatkan penghasilan. Dengan usaha ini Karsini ingin mengembangkan untuk kedepannya memperbanyak bibit penggemukannya agar nantinya bisa menopang kebutuhan keluarganya

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods (Membeli pakan dan bibit babi)

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
G. Mukaddas is 37 years old. She is married and has two children.

About ten years ago, the financial situation of Muhaddas's family forced her to start her own business. She decided to sell the fabrics used for making the national dresses. With time, the financial position of the family improved due to the profit generated by Mukaddas’s business as well as because her husband went to work in Russia, sending considerable amounts of his earnings back to Tajikistan each month. Nevertheless, Mukaddas made the decision to continue her business and is now trying to diversify the range of goods she sells, in order to be able to respond to the interests of clients with very diverse tastes and levels of income. Typically, she purchases the fabrics from wholesale markets and from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan.

Currently, Mukaddas is asking for a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 4 months in order to purchase more fabrics for sale. Having showed herself as a reliable client of the loan organization, Mukaddas will also pay back the current loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Mirka

texts.en: Mirka was born in 1963, and she lives at the village Suha, near the town Bratunac. She sells milk and milk products, and raspberries, and she is farming sheep. Mirka wants to use this loan for buying a cow. Her husband  works as a painter and he can earn about 700 KM monthly. They have 3 sons from 11 to 26 years old, and 700 KM monthly is not enough for their cost of living. Mirka believes that one more cow will provide resources and better earnings selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: Buying a cow.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is 43 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa Valley. He has three children and makes a living painting cars. He also repairs cars for people who live in his area. This is the fourth time Fadi has applied for a loan from  Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy more supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a car-painting business

loans.name: Enedina Yolanda's Group

texts.es:
Alejandrina, Yolanda and Jossely have been members of the communal bank of Chacco for one year. They are from the community of Chacco which is located 30 minutes outside of Ayacucho.

Alejandrina is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She has a shop where she sells grocery items, and she also grows vegetables. Yolanda is 43 years old and widowed with 3 children. Yolanda travels to the city of Lima where she buys vegetables and clothing depending on the demand. She sells the vegetables in the Ayacucho market and she sells the clothing on credit in her community. And Jossely is single and 19 years old. She and her mother have a general store.

The women will use the loans to purchase sugar, noodles, milk, rice and tuna, as well as clothing to sell. They share the dream of growing their respective businesses, educating their children to be professionals, and improving their homes.

Alejandrina, Yolanda y Jossely pertenecen al Banco Comunal Chacco hace 1 año. Ellas son de la comunidad de Chacco que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Alejandrina es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una tienda de abarrotes y además se dedica a la agricultura de verduras.

Por otro lado Yolanda es viuda, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda viaja a la ciudad de Lima donde compra verduras y ropa dependiendo de la demanda, la verdura lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y la ropa lo vende a crédito en su comunidad.

Mientras que Jossely es soltera y tiene 19 años, Jossely junto a su mamá tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

Alejandrina, Yolanda y Jossely necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, leche, blusas, chompas, arroz y atún.

Los sueños de Alejandrina, Yolanda y Jossely son mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STOCK FOR THEIR RESPECTIVE BUSINESSES SUCH AS SUGAR, NOODLES, MILK, RICE, TUNA AND MILK, AS WELL AS CLOTHING TO SELL.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin P. is a 26 year old housewife in Kampong Cham. She stays home to care for her young child. Her husband luckily has a good job as the head construction worker for a small firm. He earns 10 US$ per day and has opportunities to advance in the company. She knows his work is where the financial future of her family rests and would like to take out a loan to buy him valuable but expensive tools he will need to fully master his trade. Rin P.'s husband is pictured here as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
Mr. Hermenegildo V. is 50 years old and is married to Mrs. Claudia Ramirez who is 40 years old, they have 3 children studying in college right now. Mr V. worked for 11 years for a private company and he retired. His savings and his pension covered the opening of a hairdresser shop that his wife manages. Also he has a grocery store in the market where he is in charge and manages; his best clients are the market visitors. In the future he would like to open a store in his own location and that his sons graduate from the university because he didn't have the opportunity to finish his studies. The loan was invested in the purchase of merchandise like threads, needles, rubber, toys, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Hermenegildo V. de 50 años esta casado con la señora Claudia Ramírez de 40 años, poseen 3 hijos cursando el colegio actualmente.

El señor trabajó 11 años para una empresa privada y se jubiló con los años. Con los ahorros que poseía más la jubilación que cobró abrió una peluquería que administra su señora. También posee una mercería en el mercado en donde él es encargado y administrador, sus mayores clientes son los visitantes del mercado.

En el futuro le gustaría abrir una tienda con local propio y que sus hijos concluyan la universidad ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar su carrera universitaria.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de artículos para mercería como son hilos, agujas, gomas, botones, juguetes, etc.

loans.use: Compra de artículos de merceria como  hilos, gomas, agujas, jueguetes, artículos para el hogar, etc.

loans.name: Kazisa's Hatutaki Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Kazisa is 45 years old. She is married, and has one child, who is 29 years old. She owns and runs a small food shop, which she opened in 2005. Everyday, Kazisa works from 6 AM to 10 PM, and earns a total of around $40 a month from her business.

In the past, Kazisa has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kazisa now hopes that another loan will allow her to purchase additional items, such as rice, maize, sugar, and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have business in selling snacks and porridges.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Zulekha's Mola Tujalie Group

texts.en:
Zulekha is 44 years and is married with 4 children ages 26, 23, 19 and 8. She has been selling food since 2002. She works from 7am to 7pm everyday and she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Zulekha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zulekha is now requesting a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, clothing, firewood and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 10 and 4. She has made a living selling charcoal and bread since 2003. Every day, she works from 7:15 a.m. to 2 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Zainab is looking to improve her business with a loan to buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 31 años de edad, pertenece al banco comunal llamado “2 de Febrero”, se dedica a la venta de hielo desde hace ya tiempo, ella tiene dos hijos, que son la luz por la cual trabaja cada día, porque desea verlos, en un momento dado, profesionales. Su conviviente Pablo, quien trabaja junto con ella en este negocio, está de acuerdo con todo lo que se propone para la mejora y prosperidad de su labor. Venden al por mayor, de 350 a 450 pedazos de hielo al día, aun así, no les rinde una ganancia suficiente para el satisfacción de todas sus necesidades, ya que las máquinas hieleras le ocasionan gastos, por eso que necesita de un préstamo para comprar otra hielera, e incrementar sus ventas.  Apoya a la señora Maria, es trabajadora, no te defraudará.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and belongs to the community bank call the "2nd of February," and has sold ice for a long time. she has two children, who are the light for which she works each day, because she wants to see them become professionals. Her partner, Pablo, works with her in this business, and agrees with her the decisions she proposes to improve on and prosper from their labor. They sell, on average, between 350 and 450 blocks of ice per day. Even still, this does not provide them with sufficient income to satisfy all of their needs. Since the ice machines are very expensive she needs a loan to purchase another ice machine and increase her sales. Support Maria, she is a hard worker and will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and additional ice machine.

loans.name: Kosar M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a wife of M. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan. Kosar baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a sweetmeat business. Her younger son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter is in 5th standard and her younger daughter is in 3rd standard. Kosar baji’s husband has a fruits & vegetable selling business. He buys fruits & vegetables from a wholesale market and sells them on a cart in different areas. Kosar baji helps her son in the making of sweetmeat. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fruits & vegetables to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khursheed baji requests a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Haleema baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ameeran baji requests a loan to buy material (sugar and tea) for her tea stall. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetable to resell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas G. is 26 years old and widely thought of as very determined to fulfill his dreams for his family.  With his talent and skills, he is sure that he can uplift their lives from poverty.  

He is married to Shery and has three children: Shery-Ann – 6 years old and a day-care student; Flora – 4 years old; and Nicolas Jr, one month old. His family lives in the rural and flat area of Malamag East, where vegetable planting and clean and green programs are the main projects being implemented in their village and other villages. Sometimes, floods strike in their village when excessive rains and typhoons take place.  

Nicolas manages a small furniture shop which is his only source of income.  He wants a better life for his family and hopes to achieve this by improving his business. In order to do so, he has applied for a loan which he will use to buy materials such as wood.

Nicolas works hard for the success of his business.  He is very optimistic that he can achieve his dreams and he believes that God is good all of the time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood for his shop

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Umwaka mushya muhire (Happy new year) from Saidi N. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Saidi is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children. 

This entrepreneur has been a motorbike driver for eight years, but what is amazing is that he was able to buy his own motorbike and as a result of this business he also bought a house for his family. This man gets up early, around 5:00 am, every day to start transporting people to their workplaces. Saidi is requesting a loan to help him buy another motorbike. His goal is to send all his siblings to school.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Nazirboy

texts.en:
Nazirboy is 39 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children. He is a man who from an early age was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work, raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he has to feed them properly.

Nazirboy has the best intentions for his children, and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his herd.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria es estilista, vende cosméticos, ropa y zapatos desde hace muchos años, negocio que inicio vendiendo en un tramo del mercado oriental de la capital de Managua, también  estudio en cosmetología todo esto lo realizo con ayuda de su mama y esposo, tiene 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Jericó con cuatro hijos  que están independiente y trabajan. Lo cual es importante para ella ver a su familia realizada, tiene cuatro ciclo de estar trabajando en Afodenic con esta solicitud  va invertir  en la compra de ropa para niño y adulto, zapatos, cosméticos para ofertar variedad a sus clientes. Sus plane a futuro es poder seguir creciendo en sus ventas como en inventario.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a hairdresser, and she has also been selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes for many years. She started her sales business in a part of the oriental market in the capital Managua; she also studied as a beautician. All of these activities were accomplished with help from her mother and husband. She is 61 years old and lives in the Jericó neighbourhood with her four children who are independent and have jobs. It is important for Maria to see her family do well. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic, and she plans to use it to buy clothing for children and adults, shoes, and cosmetics so that she has a greater variety to offer to her customers. Her plan for the future is to continue increasing her sales as well as her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Rafaela M. C. tiene la edad de 29 años,  habita en el barrio San José de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , el se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio; tiene a su cargo dos hijos un varón de 3 años y una niña de seis , los planes hacia su futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para darle una buena educación , doña Rafaela en un futuro quieres mejorar la infraestructura de su pequeña finca , ya que desde hace quince años la trabaja y con las cosechas no ha tenido un buen resultado ya que las plagas y enfermedades del cultivo no ha permito tener una buena producción , ella inicio los trabajos agrícola para obtener mas ingresos , el financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes y aplicar a ala siembra para que la cosecha sea buena y se pueda vender bien en el M..
texts.en:
Rafaela M. C. is 29 years old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who helps her pay their household expenses. He works in agriculture and sales. They have two children--a three-year-old boy and a six-year-old girl. Their plans for the future are to improve their living conditions and give their children a good education. In the future, Rafaela wants to improve the infrastructure of her small farm, since she has been working on it for 15 years and the crops haven't been very good due to plagues and illnesses. She began her agricultural work to obtain more wages. This loan will be used to purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to the seeds so that the harvest will be good and sell well at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to improve crops

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Biên năm nay 48 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị là thành  viên của Quỹ  từ năm 2005. Hiện nay chị đang làm công việc buôn bán cá còn anh Liên chồng chị  làm nghề đánh bắt cá trên biển. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng từ công việc buôn bán cá  và  nguồn thu từ công việc của chồng cuộc sống gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  vốn cho công việc buôn bán cá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Biên is 48 years old and has three grown children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, her husband Liên works as a fisherman, while she works selling fish. She earns 2,500,000 VND (144 USD) per month from her fish sales, and together with her husband’s earnings, this has enabled the family to enjoy greater financial security and a higher standard of living. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to invest in her business selling fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish sales

loans.name: Gombodorj

texts.en:
Gombodorj D. lives with his wife in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Gombodorj has two grown-up children who live separately with their own families.

Together with his wife, Oyunchimeg, Gombodorj runs a small retail business selling phone cards and mobile phone accessories. In 2004, he rented a stall in a local market and started selling the phone cards that he bought from wireless phone service operators at wholesale prices and his wife sells them through their stall.

Their business started with 400,000 MNT (approximately $290) of capital. After a few successful years he has become an official distributor of phone cards for all four major domestic operators, and receives exclusive discount wholesale prices. Recently, he added two more domestic operators, G-Mobile and Mongolian Telecom Company. His business capital has increased to 1,500,000 MNT.

Gombodorj hopes to have his own shop to sell his phone cards, instead of renting a small stall at the local market. He requests a loan to purchase more phone cards for his business.

In the photo, Gombodorj's spouse Oyunchimeg is shown at their phone card sales stall.

loans.use: To purchase more phone cards for his business

loans.name: Mirna Apariza

texts.es: Mirna Apariza Gómez M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Mirna tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Doña Mirna se dedica a la actividad económica de Doña Mirna es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante por lo que inicio por cuenta propia ya que anteriormente trabajaba como maestra y su salario no cubría todos los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada. Es por eso que le propósito de Mirna es comprar lo suficiente para abastecer la demanda. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta Managua o Chinandega ya que es aquí donde es favorable la compra de ropa usada. Los sueños de Mirna son de establecer una tienda de ropa usada con un excelente inventario.
texts.en:
Mirna Apariza Gómez M. is 58 years old and married. Mirna has 4 children and they all work. Mirna has been selling used clothing for more than 3 years. She is a street vendor, and began her business on her own after working as a teacher and her salary didn’t cover all her household expenses so she decided to sell used clothing. Mirna plans on buying sufficient inventory to meet her demand. She is seeking financing for working capital to be able to travel to Managua or Chanindega where the prices for used clothing are more favorable. Mirna dreams of opening a used clothing store with an extensive inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Viñero Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Juana T. T., Johana C. M. y María de los Reyes P. A...

 El grupo solidario El viñero, es formado a través de mercado, según la cercanía de sus negocios y por su confianza entre ellas, tienen pequeños puestos de ventas en el mercado municipal de masaya.

Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas de tramos y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Juana T. , vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene tres hijos que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Johana C. vende perecederos en el mercado, ofrece productos como tomates, chayotes, remolachas, lechugas, etc.. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad. Tiene tres hijos pequeños que le ayudan en el puesto y además van a clases, su horario de trabajo es desde tempranas horas y termina hasta la tarde.

Doña Maria de los Reyes, es la coordinadora del grupo, la eligieron porque es muy responsable con sus pagos, ella ofrece también productos perecederos iguales a las de la otras dos integrantes, tiene dos hijos pequeños que ella mantiene, van a clase a la escuela mas cercana del barrio.Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor la verduras que llegan del norte del país y que   son de mucha demanda, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar las ventas,
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Juana T. Torrez, Johana C. M., and Maria de los Reyes P. A. The group is named "El vinero" and they have stands set up in the market. They are such good companions that they have their stands together in the market in Masaya. The three members are neighbours and they sometimes get together to buy some products so that they will get better prices. Juana T. sells perishables in the market of Masaya. She sells fruits, having purchased them wholesale. She sells during the days. She has three children who are all going to school and her husband is a salesman in the same market where he carries a variety of products, contributing to the household expenses. Johana C. sells perishables in the market, such as tomatoes, chayotes, beets, lettuce, etc. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and he works as a taxi driver. She looks after her little boy while she runs the business. She has three young children that help her with the stand but they also go to class. Her work schedule starts in the very early mornings and to the late afternoons. Maria de los Reyes is the coodinator of the group. She was elected because she is very responsible with her payments. She also sells perishables, like her two other colleagues. She has two small children who she supports. They go to class in the nearest neighbourhood school. Her husband helps out with the household expenses. She dreams of making improvements to her home especially because in the winter the house floods. With the loans she has received she has purchased vegetables wholesale, those that are imported from the northern parts of the country. The products are of great demand and that has helped her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ada Erlinda

texts.es: Ada Erlinda T. M. tiene 32 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos. La actividad  económica de Ada es venta de comida. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio estableciendo una pequeña mesa en las afueras de su vivienda por las noches, empezó con la elaboración de tacos, enchiladas, gallo pinto, huevos entre otras cosas, al ver que con este oficio su familia podía subsistir decide trabajar con los financiamientos para salir adelante y estos le han ayudado con su negocio. Es por eso que este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales para cocina, granos básicos, frutas y verduras. El sueño de Ada es preparar a sus hijos y que su negocio sea el mejor.
texts.en:
Ada Erlinda T. M. is 32-years old and has 2 children. Ada's work activity is selling food, which she has done for more than 6 years. She started this business by setting up a table in front of her house at night and selling tacos, enchiladas, 'gallo pinto' (a dish of mixed rice and beans, called 'mottled rooster'), and eggs, among other things. Upon seeing that her family could live off the income from this work, she decided to seek financing to advance and help her with the business. This financing that she requests is for working capital, to buy kitchen materials, staple grains, fruits and vegetables. Ada's dream is to prepare her children and her business, so that they improve.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia Evangelina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas, ella tienen un pequeño puesto de caramelos y demás en la esquina de su casa, en la cual vende todo tipo de golosinas a los niños del barrio o cuanta gente pase por el lugar, ella solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar al pòpr mayor dulces y galletas y diversos productos para venderlos.

Nuestra socia encuentra muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ("Always United") Community Bank and is a native of the Santiago neighborhood in the city Cusco, Peru. She is 49 years old and single.
