She makes a living buying and selling snacks, and she has a small snack stand at the corner of her home, where she sells all kinds of goodies to the neighborhood children and the people who are passing by. She is requesting the loan to purchase candy, cookies and other products at wholesale to then sell. She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to fulfill her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia J. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Nelia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a business buying and selling wood coco lumber. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (about $208 US) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional wood products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoe

loans.name: Diolita

texts.en:
Diolita L. is from Brgy. Lopez Jaena, Sagay Sity. She is 52 years old and married with three children of adult age. She joined the project in 1994 and started a small general store in their community.  

The 15 years that she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon has made a marked improvement in her life. In her last loan, she borrowed 22,000 Philippine pesos, which she invested in the vulcanizing shop managed by her husband. It is now earning PHP 5,000 per month. This time around, she is planning to invest the PHP 22,000 she is borrowing to use as capital to buy and sell feeds in her general store as an additional source of  income.   

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Vilma Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos, La señora Saturnina estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Santa Rosa jr. 30 de Agosto 927.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías en miniatura. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de artesanías en miniatura, las mismas que los vende en las ferias patronales de la región.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder construir su casita y darles educación a sus hijos.
A ella le gusta la  puntualidad y los encuentros.

loans.use: Para la compra de artesanias en miniatura.

loans.name: Oreste Javier

texts.es: El señor Oreste Javier M. , tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio Francia N0 1 , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante , ellos tiene tres hijos de 16,14 y 8 años actualmente los tres estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , don Oreste desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura ya con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno; el cual le sirve como fuente de trabajo y se siente muy agradecido con  Afodenic ya que le  ha apoyado durante seis ciclo de producción ,  en ocasiones  la afectación mas grande que se le presenta con el cultivo son las cenizas del volcán ya que esto le ha ocasionado perdidas en su producto. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar la producción y a si poder ofrecer a buen precio en el M..

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Mrs. Seom Som Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people who are all living in Chong Koah Kor village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Seom S. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Pae Sao, is employed in an NGO in the local district. Mrs. Seom S. is 57 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Mr. Rin R. does not come to take a loan but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Khairidin

texts.en:
Khairidin is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. He opened his grocery 9 years ago. Khairidin provides his neighbors and occasional clients with products like bread, rice, sugar, meat, milk, and other staples. He tells us that thanks to his grocery’s early opening hours and the good service he offers his customers, he has been able to move forward with the business. Khairidin wants the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tinned products, sweets, drinks, etc. He and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff to increase his range of goods for selling

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Hilda Esperanza P., tiene una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace seis años, en donde vende una variedad de productos de granos básicos,  golosinas, frutas y productos de higiene personal, comenzó con dinero propio vendiendo ambulante en las ruta urbana de la capital,  atoles y golosinas, se le hacia difícil pero tenia que generar ingresos ya que solo su esposo no era suficiente por que son cuatro hijos que dar educación, alimentación como lo necesario de la vestimenta. Por gracias de Dios vendía todo. Y  recogiendo lo cual logro poner venta de golosina en su casa el cual logro poco a poco hacerla en una pequeña pulpería que gracias a los préstamo que hizo en Afodenic logro fortalecerla hasta ahora, tiene 35 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos cursan sus estudios y su esposo trabaja como conductor. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa. Con este préstamo surtirá de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones, golosinas, lácteos, entre otros que es el alimento de los Nicaragüenses. Lo cual espera obtener mejores ventas ya que en los últimos meses han estado bajas las venta lo cual, tiene perdida en vez de ganancia lo que le ha ayudado es que tiene dos cuarto alquilando y son ingresos fijos mensuales el cual puede cubrir para pagar luz, agua, entre otros gastos. Contenta con la institución por hacer posible las mejoras en su negocio como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Hilda Esperanza P., 35, has a small general store which she has managed for the past six years where she sells a variety of products like: basic grains, sweets, fruits, personal hygiene items. She began with her own savings as an itinerant saleswoman of atole (drink made of cornflour) and sweets in the capital's urban routes. It was difficult work but she had to generate income because her husband's earnings weren't sufficient to provide schooling, clothing and food for four children. Thanks to God, she would sell out of everything. In time, she was able to start to sell sweets from her home and little by little it grew into a small general store which, thanks to loans from Afodenic, she was able to strenghthen still more until today. Her four children are students and her husband is a driver. Her plan is to be able to continue to make improvements to her home. With this loan she will stock up on rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, sweets, dairy products, among other items, which are typical of Nicaraguan cuisine. She hopes to improve sales since they have been low these past few months which has led to net losses rather than profits. What has helped her to stay afloat is that she rents two rooms which produce a fixed monthly income with which she can pay basic utilities, among other expenses. She is happy with the institution for making it possible to improve both her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on rice, beans, sugar, oil, and sweets.

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “FORMANDO UN FUTURO”

Formando un Futuro es un grupo que vive en San Juan D. Lurigancho conformado por personas que han sobresalido D. problemas tan grandes como el abandono.
Caso D. L. señora Hilaria D. 55 años, que ha sabido reponerse D. grandes golpes D. L. vida, 
ElL. fue abandonada D. muy pequeña y tuvo que andar por las calles pidiendo algo que comer, hasta que conoció a una señora que se encariñó con elL. y L. ayudo, alimento y vistió pero Hilaria igual tenia que trabajar, Hilaria creció a base D. trabajo y a sus catorce años ya tenía trabajos más fuertes, uno D. ellos fue en un restaurante donD. tenia el empleo D. lava platos, a los quince año conoció a quien seria su pareja y padre se sus 2 hijas, él trabajaba en L. municipalidad D. recogedor D. basura, empleo que a L. justas alcanzaba para comer.
Pasaron los años y cuando L. mayor D. sus hijas tuvo 12 y L. menor 6, Hilaria sufrió otro abandono D. parte D. su pareja, él L. abandonó a su suerte, con sus 2 hijas, estonces Hilaria tenía que ser padre y madre, comenzó a trabajar nuevamente, inició vendiendo caramelos, después vendió chupetes, helados, luego comida, menús y en las noches vendía golosinas, galletas, en una canasta D. manera ambulante.
Después D. 25 años su ex-pareja, padre D. sus hijas D. Hilaria, volvió, pero solo por estar lisiado, sus hijas independizadas tomaron este hecho D. forma indiferente ya que tenían sus propias familias, ahora L. pareja D. Hilaria ayuda en lo que pueD., cuidando el negocio, etc. 
En L. actualidad Hilaria tiene un kiosco con permiso D. L. municipalidad donD. venD. golosinas, dulces, bebidas, etc., también tiene un carrito D. helados Donofrio, y un locutorio ambulante.
ElL. es una mujer fuerte que tiene sueños como los D. muchas mujeres en este sociedad, elL. nos comenta con una sonrisa: “Mi sueño es tener mi casa terminada y una bodega en elL., para poder trabajar sin necesidad D. salir D. mi casa pues lo que mas me gusta es el trabajo y si el trabajo esta en casa mejor para mi”
texts.en:
Formando un Futuro (Forming a Future) is a group that lives in San Juan D. Lurigancho and is maD. up of persons who have overcome problems as big as abandonment. For example: Hilaria, 55, has learned to overcome heavy blows in life. She was abandoned as a very young girl and had to roam the streets begging for food until she met a woman who became fond of her and helped her with food and clothing. Still, Hilaria had to work. Hilaria grew based on toil and, by the age of 14, had exacting jobs. One of them was as a dishwasher in a restaurant. At 15, she met the man who would become her partner and father of her two daughters. He was employed as a municipal trash collector, a job that barely earned him enough income to eat. Years passed and when their eldest daughter was 12 years old and the youngest was 6, Hilaria suffered another abandonment; this time by her partner. He abandoned her to her fate, with two daughters. Hilaria now had to be both mother and father and started working again. She began selling candy, then popsicles and ice-cream. Later it was food, prepared meals and at night, sweets and cookies that she peddled from a basket that she carried through the streets. After 25 years, her ex-partner and father of their daughters, returned but only because he was crippled. Their daughters were unaffected by this turn of events because they were independent by this time with families of their own. Now, Hilaria's partner helps out with what he can, like tending to the business, etc. Currently, Hilaria has a small kiosk which the city allows her to use to sell sweets, candies, beverages, etc. and she also has a small ice-cream vending cart for Donofrio brand items and she has traveling phone booths. She is a strong woman who has dreams like so many other women in this society. She tells us with a smile "my dream is to finish my home and to have a store in it so that I can work without having to leave my house because what I most enjoy is work and, if I could work from home, that would be even better for me"

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is from the town of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Letecia is married and has one child. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily used products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.

Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
En la pulpería de la señora María Nelly S. se vende comestibles tales como meneítos, galletas, tortillitas en bolsa, golosinas, entre otros productos. También vende detergente, jabón y papel higiénico. Ella se ha preocupado por mejorar cada vez más las condiciones de su negocio y hoy en día está solicitando un crédito porque le urge adquirir los productos para llenar sus estantes y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento.

Es por esta razón que ella espera confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su actividad y se proyectará como potencial comerciante.
texts.en:
María Nelly S. has a mini-market where she sells things like “meneítos” (puffed cheese snack), crackers, bags of tortillas, and sweets among other products. She also sells detergent, soap, and toilet paper. She has struggled to improve the conditions of her business more each time. She is now asking for a loan because she urgently needs to get the products to fill her shelves. That way she can continue to offer them in her establishment. That is the reason that she confidently hopes to be given the loan. That way she will get ahead in her activity, and she plans on being a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her mini mart

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
N. Grace is forty-five years old, is married, and is a businesswoman. She is blessed with four children of whom three are going to school and she has one dependent who is schooling, too.

Grace deals in produce such as cassava flour, maize flour, vegetables, and so forth. She is using the loan to purchase and stock at least four bags each of cassava and maize flour plus vegetables. She is adding capital to generate more profits.

Grace is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase at least four bags each of cassava and maize flour plus vegetables

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria I. R. tiene 58 años de edad y vive con unos compañeros, su esposo y nieta.  Tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son adultos.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Gloria es agricultora y crece naranjas, cacao, plátano, y café.  Asimiso se dedica a la crianza de animales.  Tiene cuyes, gallinas, patos, y pavos para consumir y vender.  Compra y vende sus productos en las ciudades de Matilde y Bucay los fI. de semana.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y comprar materiales para una secadora y hacer un baño en su casa.

Desea construir su casita propia pero todavía no alcanza.  Podría hacerlo cuando haga plata y salgan más cultivos.

Cuenta que vive en una comunidad muy unida y le gusta ver los partidos de volei en la comunidad y ver los programas en la tele.
texts.en:
Gloria I. R. is 58. She lives with some friends, her husband, and her granddaughter. She has six children, who are now adults. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. Gloria is a farmer, and she grows oranges, cocoa, bananas, and coffee. She also raises animals. She has guinea pigs, hens, ducks, and turkeys to consume and to sell. She buys and sells her products on the week ends in the cities of Matilde and Bucay. She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies, to buy materials for a dryer, and to make a bathroom in her house. She wishes to build her own house, but she cannot do that yet. She could do that when she makes money and has more crops. She says that she lives in a very united community. She likes to see the volleyball games in the community and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies and materials to improve her house

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en: Mrs. Dipa K. (see this note on Nepali names) is a resident of Sanepa, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery shop two years ago to improve the living standard of her family. Assisted by all members of her family, she sells a variety of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, biscuits (cookies) and snacks. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods for her shop. She is planning to spend any increase in income to help her husband to improve the quality of life of her family. Mrs. Dipa K., lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law and her husband, Mr. Amit K., who works in a private office.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en: Josiah is a good business man and is doing well in his retail charcoal business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers and hopes to expand it in the future. Josiah is 40 years old and married with three children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Josiah is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 65 year old widowed woman with four grown up children. She is in the business of selling food in Kisumu Ndogo-Malindi where her clients are  school children and teachers from the area. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets 14,000 KES a month in profit. Mary also does tailoring on the side.

She was introduced to KADET by her daughter who was in KADET at the time Mary joined and had borrowed from a bank previously. With this loan she plans to add tailoring materials for her shop with 30,000 KES, upgrade her food stall and stock supplies such as flour and sugar with 20,000 KES.

With the extra income from this loan she plans to invest in her garden. A very independent woman, Mary dreams of owning a vehicle.

loans.use: Upgrade food kiosk, add stock and add materials for tailoring shop.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.en: Oumy B. is 56 years old, widowed and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" DIAMAGUENE1 for two years and has repaid her previous loans on time. Her main line of work consists of selling fabrics but, as a second occupation, she sells peanut butter. Oumy B. is using the bulk of this loan to buy fabrics and the remainder to buy peanut butter. The earnings from selling these products help her cover daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Freddy Bayardo

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Bayardo A. R., tiene la edad de 38 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como oficinista, no tienen hijos, y habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, son vendedores de frutas, desde hace 5 años siendo esta su principal fuente de ingresos. 

En los últimos meses ha observado una alza en los precios de las frutas, esto ha obstaculizado la compra de más mercaderia, razón por la cual ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de frutas, que les aumente la oferta debido a que la demanda se mantiene en los meses de verano y desean aprovechar el clima, que motiva a la compra de frutas en la clientela, el apoyo que se le brinde, les ayudara a ambicionar  en proyectos que favorezcan a la estabilidad económico-social de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Freddy Bayardo A. R. is 38 years old and married. His wife works as an office worker. They haven't got any children and live in the Juan Ramón Padilla Housing community. For the past five years, he has been selling fruit as his main source of income. In the past few months, he has noticed a rise in the price of fruit, which has made it difficult for him to purchase more merchandise. This is the reason why he is applying for a loan, so that he can buy a larger inventory of fruit, which would then increase his sales due to the high demand that occurs during the summer months. With the warmer climate, his clients tend to purchase more fruit and he wants to be able and ready to take full advantage of this tendency. The help that he is asking for would help him in reaching this objective and thus adding to the socio-economic stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger inventory of fruit.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Trust. He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is ten years old. He is a college student.

For four years, he has been selling phone cards in the S.K.D. community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar-portion of this group loan to buy more phone cards.  His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his child so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Emmanuel is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and a widow. She has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells ready-to-wear clothes (RTWs) in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $135 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
La señora Maria Jose L. M., es una joven de 29 años de edad casada con un hijo de 8 años, su esposo es jardinero y apoya a la economía del hogar, ella se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, tienen un hijo pequeño de 8 años que estudia la primaria.

Ellos son una familia humilde que por la escases de recursos económicos  no han tenido el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para las remodelaciónes de su vivienda, con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de zinc, bloques, arena, cemento, puesto que desea construir un porche al frente de su hogar para brindarle una fachada mas presentable. Con esta inversión mejoraran sus condiciones de habita y sobretodo la tranquilidad de madre de poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor espacio donde morar y desarrollarse diariamente.
texts.en:
The young woman Maria Jose L. M. is 29 years old, married, and has an 8 year old child. Her husband is a gardener and supports the home financially, she dedicates herself to domestic work, and they have a young son of 8 years who is in primary school. They are a humble family that, because of the scant economic resources, have not had the capital necessary to invest in the purchase of construction materials for remodeling their house. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of zinc, blocks, sand, cement, since she wishes to construct a porch at the front of her home, to provide her a more presentable exterior. With this investment their living conditions will improve, and above all the peace of the mother to be able to offer her children a better space in which to dwell and develop daily.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her home

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Née le 14 Décembre 1980 à Comè, DOULLESSE Odile est mariée à Q. Emile et est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Odile habite le quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Odile a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Odile  mène comme activité la vente de haricot préparé à Cocotomey. C'est au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi que Odile achète ses produits. Odile exerce cette activité depuis six ans. C'est la première fois que Odile sollicite un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa production ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on December 14, 1980 in Comè, Ms. DOULLESSE Odile is married to Mr. Q. Emile.  She is the mother of three children, of whom two are in school.  She lives with her children and husband in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi.  The couple jointly provide for their family.  Odile dropped out of secondary school.  To support herself, she runs a business selling cooked beans in Cocotomey.  She buys her supplies at the Cococodji market, in Abomey Calavi.  She has been in this business for six years.  This is the first time she has requested financial support from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and to increase her production.  This will enable Odile to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of beans and containers of palm oil

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
This is Conchita M., 57, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mauro M., a church pastor, and is the mother of five children, all of whom are already settled down with their own families. She has managed to support her children’s education, a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Conchita as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Conchita operates a slipper-making business. Because of the hot climate and humidity here in the Philippines, slippers, flip-flops and sandals are the most common kind of footwear, especially for people working in the fields, streets and their homes. Conchita manufactures all types of slippers, made of different materials from cloth to leather to rubber. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy the raw materials necessary to continue production of her slippers. She will purchase rubber, leather, cloth, thread, rugby and other kinds of supplies. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business.  

Conchita dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work with the business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary to continue production of her slippers

loans.name: Patchy

texts.en:
Patchy B., from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province, is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Patchy owns and operates a specialized retail store making and selling specialty goods and delicacies including banana cues and sweetened rice in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 12 years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Patchy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPF that was used to purchase additional raw ingredients and as working capital, she is now requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP for the same purposes. This will be Patchy's fourth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients and use as working capital

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 38 years old. Divina is married and has 2 school-aged children. She sells fish for a living and has been doing it for eight years now. She also started raising hogs for fattening and sale. Divina works hard to have her own fishing boat and hopefully expand her livestock. She also wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Divina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Divina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
El señor C. V. Julio César tiene una hija de 10 años el cual le envía una pensión. 
Vive en el local donde funciona su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de plásticos como: tapers, baldes, cocinas entre otros artículos para el hogar.Hace dos años se dedica a dicho rubro.
Se propone el crédito para que así pueda comprar mas mercadería e incremente su capital. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Su aspiracion es tener un local propio y asi poder surtir mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. C. V. Julio César has a ten-year-old daughter, whom he supports financially. He lives in his place of work, where he sells plastic items such as Tupperware containers, buckets, stoves, and other household items. He has been doing this work for two years. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy more merchandise and increase his capital. He has good personal and professional references. His goal is to have his own shop; this way his business would be able to expand more.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a  fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling assorted fish to the market. Laura has set up a sari-sari (general) store where she sells various products. She hopes for her store to grow.

Laura joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish to raise and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise and additional store inventory

loans.name: Ibraim

texts.en:
Ibraim K. is a 58 year-old widower with five grown children. He lives in Altymish village. After graduating from the Institute of physical culture and sport, Ibraim devoted his life to the education of children. He worked at the local school for 35 years as a trainer and became school Head-deputy. Ibraim lived with a very happy marriage and his wife was the main person on whom he could rely. Last year, he lost his support. His beloved wife died and only his children and grandchildren could bring him back to life. Today, Ibraim lives with his youngest son, who followed Ibraim’s footsteps and became a teacher in the local school.  

In order to find an additional means of subsistence and to help his son to cover the expenses of his family with little children, Ibraim started to breed livestock. His hardworking and persistent activities carry him forward. Today he has two milk cows, one bull calf, and one mare with a foal. Now Ibraim wants to take a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy one milk cow and forage for his cattle. With the revenues from this investment, Ibraim plans to develop his farm by means of livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Laura Marisol

texts.es:
Laura Marisol T. C. tiene 23 años. Es siltera vive con los padres,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene hijos.
  
Laura  pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Laura trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.

Le gusta salir a bailar.
texts.en:
Laura Marisol T. C. is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  She does not have any children.

Laura belongs to the Communal Bank “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration), which is in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of the group engage in short cycle agriculture, mostly growing corn, rice, and black-eyed peas.  This Communal Bank has 13 members.

Laura is a short cycle farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and then sells her products from a store in her house and at the market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more supplies to expand her business.  With the help she will be receiving through this loan, Laura will be able to acquire necessities.  Her dream is to continue farming so that she can have money to purchase a car.

Laura enjoys going out to dance.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 3 hijos, de 8, 14 y 18 años de edad, los 3 estudian y ayudan a sus padres en sus horas libre, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, Vicente trabaja para la escuela en la colonia desde hace 3 años, con responsabilidad y dedicaciòn ya que ama su trabajo y es bien querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, alumnos y padres de familia por su humildad y responsalidad que tanto lo caracteriza.  

Solicita la ayuda de Kiva en su primer crèdito  para construcciòn de una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones y la de su familia.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es que sus hijos culmine sus estudios y tener estabilidad laboral para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente has 3 children ages 8, 14, and 18. All three are in school and help their parents in their spare time while his wife takes care of the chores at home. For the past 3 years Vicente has worked at a school in the area. He shows great responsibility and dedication since he loves his job. He is well like by his co-workers, students and parents for the humility and responsibility that he shows. 

He is requesting his first Kiva loan to build another room and so better his family's lifestyle. His greatest dream is that his children finish their studies and to have a stable job to continue to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Gladys Birmania

texts.es:
Gladys Birmania G. M. tiene 39 años. Vive en Union Libre,  vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueno es dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Gladys Birmania G. M. is 39 years old. She lives is in a common law marriage with her partner and children. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She has 2 children. 

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group work exclusively in agriculture, especially in short cycle cultivation such as corn, rice, soy and beans. All of the members are from the same area of the San Vicente Las Lomas community in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 12 people belong to this bank.  

Gladys has worked in agriculture, especially growing corn, for more than 3 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them at the market in  Ventanas.

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers to grow corn. With the support of the loan, she will be financially supported to meet her needs. They are facing challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. Her dream is to give her children an education. She likes to dance.

loans.use: To buy agricultural materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Alymbek

texts.en:
Alymbek K. is a hard-working 39-year-old farmer from Karakol. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. His wife is a teacher at the local school. 

After serving in the army, he worked in a meat-packing plant. To find additional means of subsistence for his large family, in 2000, Alymbek decided to start his own livestock-breeding business. With initial capital of only 3,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he bought a bull calf and managed to enlarge his stock to one cow, one heifer, one bull and nine sheep.
  
Now Alymbek needs to develop his farm, so he applied for a loan of 120,000 Kyrgyz Soms. With the revenues from this investment, he will make his dream come true - to provide a good education for his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more cattle to raise.

About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable populations. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is 34-years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: fishing and fish vending. She lives in Malocbaloc, Barangay Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9000. 

Gina is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Rosibel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosibel lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Erlinda L. Obregon de 47 años se dedica a la venta de tortilla, bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses y tiene una fritanga. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en maíz para las tortillas, carne para las enchiladas y frutas para los frescos. 
Las otras integrantes son  Rosibel F. de 38 años propietaria de una fritanga y María Godínez vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en: The Rosibel group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from the capital of Managua. The group coordinator is Erlinda L. Obregon, age 47, who sells tortillas- the signature food of Nicaraguans- and she has a food stand store. She will invest the loan in her business with the goal of continuing to expand, especially with corn for the tortillas, meat for the enchiladas and fruit for the drinks. The other members are Rosibel F., age 38, the owner of a food stand, and María Godínez, who sells tortillas and cooked beans.

loans.use: For corn, meat and fruit

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Maria has a salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Maria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play volleyball.

loans.use: To purchase braids

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. Justine has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Justine sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Justine has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Justine include seasonality and Defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages of Luwero for charcoal, build her own house. Justine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita is a married woman who lives in Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a fruits & vegetables business and a charcoal & wood business.  Her husband Jeoffrey, who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have four children who are between 1 and 6 years old. 

Lordita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lordita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th loan, Lorida is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of fruits to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lordita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina S. is from the village of Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Felomina is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Felomina owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. 

Felomina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Felomina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Felomina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felomina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Houête Ayidekon Group

texts.en:
The Houête Ayidekon group consists of 29 women, who all live in the same neighborhood and have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments. This is their first loan with ALIDE as a group.

Odette (with her hand raised in the picture) is 51 years old, and has lived in Calavi all her life. She is married with six children. For 15 years she has run a stall from her home selling food supplies, and with this loan she hopes to restock her maize and spices.  Her ambition is to grow her product line, and she cites her management skills as her greatest strength.

loans.use: Purchasing spices and maize

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is from the village of Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Grace is married and has two adult children.

To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store selling home products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store. 

Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store. This will be the second loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Jenibeb

texts.en:
24-year-old Jenibeb is a married woman with two young children. Her oldest child is four years old.

Jenibeb is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for five years. Jenibeb is working hard to help provide for her family. She is also saving for her children's future.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C. is 27 years old, married, and has three children. She was selected to be the head of her group which contains five people, all living in the province of Siem Reap. 

To make a living, she sells a small amount of items such as cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, and other items in front of her house. Her husband, Mr. Touy Ny, manages his business as well as running a motor taxi service in his community. To make more income, Mrs. Chea C. would like to request loan to expand her store.

The other four borrowers are: 

Mrs. D., who is applying for a loan to buy a new machine and nets for her fishing business. 

Mrs. C., a ferry boat operator, who is asking for a loan to repair her boat.

Mrs. S., a grocery trader, who is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell.

Mrs. Y., who is seeking a Kiva loan to build a new place for making alcohol.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby, 35, is married and has three children. Two of them are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ruby has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

Ruby has been in this business for 11 years.  

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.en:
Toirjon lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and the very-devoted father of two children. For the last eight years, he has made a living as a farmer. He works with his wife, and sells his produce in local markets. Toirjon is applying for a loan for 10,500 TJS to buy fertilizer, fuel and lubricants. He is committed to increase his profits, buy a home in town and provide his children with a good life. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 46 años de edad. Actualmente, Luis Alberto vive en la misma ciudad que nació junto con sus dos hijos. Luis Alberto vende medicina natural. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Luis Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar más medicinas naturales.  El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar D. banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Luis Alberto was born in the city of Cuzco (Peru) and is 46 years old. At present, Luis Alberto  lives in the same city where he was born together with his two children. Luis Alberto sells natural medicines. He has had this business for 12 years and it is going well for him thanks to the dedication that he brings to his work. At this time, Luis Alberto requires the loan to buy more natural medicines. He is a responsible and hardworking person and it was because of these qualities that the other members invited him to participate in the “Unión Latina” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicine.

loans.name: Sambuu

texts.en:
Sambuu is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is a pharmacist while his two older children go to a local secondary school. His youngest one, who hasn't reached school age, attends kindergarten.

He manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business in 2010. In addition, he operates a car wash and tire repair service, employing his two sisters with a reasonable monthly salary.

He is a polite man who is planning to conduct an auto part selling business in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna has a retail shop at home to make a living. She sells different food products in her community. Johnna is 28 years old and lives in Calamaba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She has been in her business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. 

Johnna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Johnna hopes to expand her retail business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 32 years old and lives in Ololmasani in Kilgoris area and is married to Janet.  They have three children ages six, four and two years old.

Mike has a retail shop that he has been running for the past two years.  He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a new stock of soft drinks, milk, bread and eggs for sale.  Mike is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business which will help him earn more income and help him provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, milk, bread, eggs, etc. to add to his stock.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
This lady is May, 31, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a waiter, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

May operates a little school supplies business where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, and the like, without going to a bookstore. May gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

May dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies.

loans.name: Hanamoa

texts.en:
Hanamoa is 45 years of age and married with three children. Hanamoa owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Hanamoa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hanamoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Hanamoa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Erdenemunkh

texts.en:
Erdenemunkh is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter on his own small sized land located in the Darkhan city of Mongolia. He is a truck farmer and cultivates vegetables in 2 plant-houses behind his house. Also he and his wife both work in a wool factory. 
Erdenemunkh uses his own grown vegetables in private needs and sells the remaining vegetables outside of his family.  This covers the most part of his income and he is planning to add another plant-house in his vegetable garden. It is a natural-oriented businesses. Therefore he is taking a loan to cover a plant-house cost. Before he had taken loans 2 times and successfully repaid them on time.

loans.use: To covers a plant-house cost.

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, José Horacio se considera un luchador, que decidió no dejarse derrotar por los problemas económicos que enfrentaba su familia, y comenzar un negocio propio para brindarle a sus 9 hijos estabilidad económica, y aunque ha sido difícil lograrlo día a día trabaja con la ilusión de ir progresando, José Horacio tiene una chaza donde vende dulces, cigarrillos, chicles y otros, a las afueras de un colegio ubicado en el municipio de Santuario del departamento de Antioquia. 

Sueña con llegar a tener un establecimiento más grande, que sea reconocido y donde pueda vender gran variedad de productos. Pero para ello necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda comenzar a cumplir este sueño, con él comprará surtido de dulces e insumos que surtan su negocio, y así continuar progresando, mejorando las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, José Horacio considers himself to be a fighter that refused to give up when his family faced financial troubles, starting his own business to provide his nine children with financial stability.  While it has been difficult to do day to day, he works with the hope of moving forward.  José Horacio has a stand where he sells candy, cigarettes, gum and other items outside of a school located in the Municipality of Santuario in the Department of Antioquia.

He dreams of having a larger point of sale that people know and where he can sell a large variety of products.  However, he needs a loan in order to begin to fulfill this dream.  With this loan, he will purchase assorted candy and supplies to stock his business and continue progressing and improving sales, as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to stock his business.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 26-year-old young woman who is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with modest salary and he also works as a taxi driver. 

Ayat wants to share with her husband in completing the price of purchasing a new taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for her share, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Ayat gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband and purchase a new taxi. This will enable her husband to work extra hours and increase his income to provide better living conditions for the family. 

Ayat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing new taxi.

loans.name: Rabiyuvlo

texts.ru: Рабиювло возраст 42 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и ответственный человек, он 4 года занимается куплей и продажей сухофруктов и имеет хорошую прибыль. Он также занимается куплей и продажей свежих фруктов. В бизнесе ему помогает жена. Он полученного дохода он построил дом. Рабиювло  запрашивает займ  на сумму 11000 сомони для покупки товара, полученный займ поможет развить бизнес и принесет прибыль в семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Rabiyuvlo is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He is a hard-working and responsible person, who has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for four years and makes a good profit.  He is also involved in buying and selling fresh fruits.  Rabiyuvlo's wife helps him in this business.  He used his profits to build a house.  Rabiyuvlo is requesting a loan in the sum of 11000 somoni to buy products.  This loan will help him to develop his business and bring a profit to the family budget.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and is married to a welder. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters.  The daughters are employed; the older one is a bookkeeper, and the younger one is in obstetrics. Her older son works in Russia, and her younger son is a soldier. In order to earn money, Tamara breeds cattle. She has been running a cattle breeding business since 1985, with which her husband helps her. At the moment they have a cow, five calves, and six sheep. With this loan, Tamara plans to purchase four calves to increase her number of cattle. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development, and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four calves for breeding.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él es comerciante de mariscos al mayoreo, este negocio es de familia, lleva 5 años realizándolo por su propia cuenta, logrando mantenerse y de las ventas poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos variados, pescado fresco de varias clases, curvina, guapote, boca roja, sardina, entre otras clases, para ofrecer al mayoreo, esta inversión le ayudara bastante para abastecer a los clientes que le comprar los productos.
La aspiración de José es comprar mariscos frescos, para agradar a los clientes, manteniendo su preferencia, así también velar por las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and three children.  He operates a wholesale seafood business.  It's a family business and he has been running it on his own for 5 years now.  He makes enough from the business to support his family.  
Jose is applying for a loan to buy seafood--fresh fish such as corvina, guapote, boca roja, sardines, etc.--that he will resell to commercial buyers.  This loan will allow him to stock the business with the products that his customers want.  
Jose's goals are to: stock his business with fresh fish, satisfy the demand from his customers and provide for his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fish-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install security grilles at the windows of her home

loans.name: Paula Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Paula es soltera pero  tiene una niña de 16 años  que se encuentra estudiando, ella sola saca adelante a su hijita,  la clienta vive en la casa de su  Padre en la zona de ciudad Satélite La cliente tiene la actividad de comercio ambulante por el centro de la ciudad (venta de variedades adornos de cocina, etc. ) con esta actividad ella corre con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del crédito para  comprar variedad de mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, ya que la Sra. tiene varios pedidos de productos ya que tiene mucha clientela, ella es una persona amable y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, su deseo es el de ver a su hija profesional en un futuro sentirse orgullosa ya que  su sacrificio valió la pena.
texts.en: Mrs. Paula is single but has one 16-year-old daughter who is in school. She is the only provider for her little girl. Paula lives in her father's home in the city of Satélite. She has a stall downtown where she sells various decorations and accessories. She is able to cover her household costs thanks to this business. She will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise for the end of the year, since she has various orders and a large customer base. She is a very kind person and is very grateful to the Institucion for this support. Her desire is to see her daughter become a professional in the future, and to be proud, because her sacrifices will have paid off.

loans.use: to buy home accessories.

loans.name: Guwa Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Arthur is 59 years old. He is married and has four children aged 39, 37, 28 and 25 years. He does not have other dependents. His wife helps him in the business.

He is a general dealer and runs a grocery shop at Guwa Town Centre. He has been in the business for three years and is doing well. He has one employee. 

He is facing challenges of buying goods at high prices and incurring high transport costs. He has a vision of expanding his business and wants to buy a car, which he will use for transporting his goods, in the next five years. 

With the profits from the business he will be able to buy food and livestock for the family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and hardware.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has five children. Her husband operates a bar. Efua works buying fresh fish from the market and then smoking them to sell at Ankwanda near Elmina. Efua uses her income to help her husband to pay school fees for their children. 

Efua is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. This will result in an increased income that she will save for the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
San Expedito se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá  gracias a que una de las miembros contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 19 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Felicita, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas, como ser cadenas, pulseras, anillos y demás. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y poder, de esa forma, estar cada vez más cerca de su meta, la cual es poder tener su local propio.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar joyas, y de esa forma poder surtirse, ya que tiene pedidos con los cuales le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
San Expedito is the name of a distinguished group of women which was formed in the city of Ita, thanks to the fact that one of the members contacted the consultant at a weekly meeting she was conducting in the area, to find out the kind of work the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras undertakes.  Once advised about the Program she was able to gather together 19 women who are currently working very comfortably together and are in their 3rd loan cycle.
 
One of the members is Señora Felicita who sells all kinds of jewelry such as chains, bracelets, rings and more. Through this work, she helps her family to get ahead and in this way can be ever closer to her goal of having her own premises.

She is asking for the loan to buy jewelry and in this way stock up as she has orders pending she would like to be able to complete.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Nafea'a

texts.en:
Nafea'a is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan, who supports two family members.

She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for materials for sewing such as fabric, beads and thread.

In the future, she wants to open a sewing factory and also she would like to buy a home.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and three children (two girls and a boy, aged 10, 8,5) in the Old City of Jerusalem. She is the household breadwinner as her husband is unemployed on modest disability benefit. She gets some income from hairdressing and beauty treatments, but their home is too small to expand this business. She has received business training from MATI, a business development foundation in Jerusalem, and has begun to import blouses on a small scale. Demand for these imports was heavy at a good price, and she now seeks working capital to expand this import business. If this is successful, she hopes to set up a boutique in the Old City where she can combine this business with her hairdressing and beauty treatments.

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: A. K. Solidarité Group

texts.fr: Le groupe A. K. SOLIDARITÉ est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Patricia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.
