texts.en:
Agatha M. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has one child who is in school. Agatha has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Agatha sells her products at the market, retail.    Agatha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of biscuits, reading charts, cigarettes and envelopes. She also generates additional income through working as a cleaner at Makerere University.

The main business challenges for Agatha include holidays and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale, build her own house, and also to educate her child up to university.   Agatha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of biscuits, reading charts, cigarettes and envelopes

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny A. is from the village of Mapang, Rizal. He is 27 years old. Johnny is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he owns and operates a business, selling a variety of snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been operating his business for a year, earning an average monthly net income of $100.

In 2009, Johnny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting his 1st loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the renewal of his business permit. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to support his family's needs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the renewal for his business permit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a member of the Skylimit Group in Faulu Kenya.  The members of the group share business ideas, save their money on a weekly basis and guarantee each other's loans. Hence, he opted to join the group so that he would access loans easily from Faulu Kenya.  

He sells gas cylinders to earn his living. He has been in the business for over 24 years. He has employed three people in his business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy gas accessories.

loans.use: To buy gas accessories

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Luisa is the president of her group, Unidas Venceremos 4 (United we'll win), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro, and their community depends on tourists. It is a poor area where the economy used to thrive on sugar cane but has more recently waned, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Luisa makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. She is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase calling cards, mobile phones, copy paper, etc. She operates a Cybercafé, where she offers services such as photocopying, internet access, and printing.  She also sells communications products like calling cards, cell phones and telephone line activation.  She will use the profits to further invest in her business, as clients always need more services and products. Her most important challenge is to improve her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy calling cards, mobile phones, copy paper, etc.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William tiene 38 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.  Es una comunidad relativamente mediana formada hace casi 12 años.

William se dedica a la comercialización de rocotos, un pimiento típico de Perú y Bolivia, al por mayor en el Mercado Mayorista Los Pathos. Este negocio es administrado por él y su conviviente en puesto propio. Gracias a esta actividad él ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

William desea adquirir más mercadería ya que tiene mucha demanda de público por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
William is 38 years old, married, and has two children in his care.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz district.  He lives in a medium-sized community which was created almost 12 years ago. 

William's business is selling 'rocotos', a traditional Peruvian and Bolivian pepper.  He sells his produce wholesale in the Los Pathos Wholesale Market.  He owns his own stall and runs the business together with his wife.  Thanks to his business, he has been able to support his family and get them ahead in life over the years.

William would like to acquire more merchandise since he has a lot of demand.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Flor De Lima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Flor de lima las integrantes le pusieron así porque el punto de reunión de los integrantes de este grupo hay un árbol de lima lleno de flores, este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas que se  dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Este grupo esta ubicado en una de las colonias de Pinotepa Nacional un lugar donde su gente es muy amable y de buenas costumbres.
La persona que representa este grupo es la señora Eva Isabel S. O., es madre soltera tiene 2 niños que estudian. Ella se tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa, vende pantalones, camisas, blusas, playeras, su pequeña tienda esta ubicado en su casa, ella comenta que le va un poco bien en sus ventas, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercancía y así surtir mas su tienda y obtener un poco mas de beneficios para ella y sus hijos ya que ellos son su mas grande tesoro y trabaja día con día para que nada les falte.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Yesenia López M. quien esta casada con el señor Eliseo tiene 2 hijos 1 de 8 años de edad y el otro de tan solo un año de edad, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de antojitos actividad que viene realizando desde hace varios años, ella tiene un pequeño local en el mercado en donde vende diferentes antojitos como son: sopes, tacos dorados, enchiladas, tostada y tacos de res, ella dice que inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenia ya que el dinero que gana su esposo no le alcanzaba y como su hija entro a la primaria iba a necesitar más dinero es por ello que ella empezó este negocio, comenta que le va bien y ahora con el préstamo que solicito piensa comprar otros productos para vender otros tipos de antojitos ya que sus clientes le piden que haga otro tipo de guisado y como dice el dicho “al cliente lo que pida”.
Ella desea engrandecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien y tengan un buen porvenir.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Juan José. Taller Mecánico
Luis Enrique. Venta de Calzado
Eva Isabel. Tienda de Ropa
Yesenia. Venta de Antojitos
Leonor Mónica. Elaboración de hamacas 
Obdulia. Venta de Antojitos
Ana Gloria. Venta de Plásticos
Juana. Venta de Cosméticos
Maricela. Venta de Cosméticos
Martha. Venta de Verduras
texts.en:
This group is called 'Flor de Lima' (Flower of the Lime Tree).  The members gave the group this name because where they meet there is a lime tree which is full of flowers.  This group has 10 members who all work in different businesses.  The group is located in one of the districts of Pinotepa Nacional, a place where the people are very kind and have good manners.

The group's representative is Eva Isabel S. O..  She is a single mother who has two children in school.  She has a small clothes store where she sells pants, shirts, blouses and t-shirts.  Her small store is located in her home.  She tells us that her sales are doing okay.  She requested this loan so that she could buy more merchandise and thereby better stock her store and make a little more profit for herself and her children since they are her great treasure and she works every day so that they don't want for anything.

Another of this group's members is Yesenia López M. who is married to Eliseo.  She has two children.  One is 8 years old and the other is only one year old.  She requested this loan so that she could buy supplies for making snacks.  She has been in this business for several years.  She has a small sales location in the market where she sells different snacks such as 'sopes' (fried tortillas topped with refried beans and spicy sauce), fried tacos, enchiladas, tostadas and beef tacos.  She says that she started this business from necessity as her husband's money didn't reach far enough.  When her daughter started elementary school she was going to need more money and, for this reason, she started her business.  She tells us that it is doing well and she plans to use the loan that she requested to buy other products so that she can sell other types of snacks since her customers are asking her to make another type of stew and, as the saying goes, 'al cliente lo que pida' ("give the customer what he wants").

Yesenia would like to expand her business and she would like her children to study and have a good future.

The members of this group are as follows: 
Juan José - vehicle repair shop
Luis Enrique - footwear sales
Eva Isabel - clothes store
Yesenia - snack sales
Leonor Mónica - making hammocks 
Obdulia - snack sales
Ana Gloria - plastic products sales
Juana - cosmetics sales
Maricela - cosmetics sales
Martha - vegetable sales

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clemetine is 29 years old, and she has a two-year-old child. She owns a general store in which she sells sorghum, tomatoes and berries. She has had this business for the past two years and her husband sells different kinds of items. Clementine is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes. With the profits she plans to open up a shop and put in a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old.  He is married and has three children.  George sells second-hand shoes.  It has been six years since he started this  business.  George has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he used his previous loan to boost his business.  He hopes to expand the business into wholesale.  

George has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy  more shoes and to open another business premise to sell shoes.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and open another business premise

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is an enterprising 53 year-old mother from the County of Kisumu, along the shores of Lake Victoria. She is married to Douglas, who operates a motor vehicle mechanic business in Kisumu town. They have three grown children.

Annah operates a second-hand clothes business in Kibuye market, a busy open air market in the county of Kisumu.  She has been in this business for the last ten years and makes a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. She joined KADET LTD and is taking her first loan of Kshs 60,000.   She will use it to buy new stock of second-hand clothing for resale. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to open another clothing stall within the city of Kisumu, and she dreams of one day becoming a leading supplier of second hand clothing to other small scale traders. At the moment, she is looking for a Kiva lender to help her realize this dream.

loans.use: to buy new stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Zavhanaa

texts.en:
Zavhanaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Mongolia's Zavhan Province. Her husband is a herder, while her two younger children are pupils and her older children secondary school teachers. Zavhanaa manages a clothing-making business in her town, an enterprise she started in 1988 and worked hard to stabilize and expand. She now makes all kinds of Mongolian traditional clothes called Deel.

An honest and hardworking lady who is trying hard to provide all the necessities for her children's education and support, Zavhanaa is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: Nzoka

texts.en:
Nzoka is a 69-year-old business man. He is married to Mutethya who is a housewife and they are blessed with four adult children. He has been running a retail shop and livestock-keeping business for the past 30 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to add more stock of sugar, rice and cooking fat and livestock for resale. With the anticipated profits from the two businesses, he intends to increase his working capital for the businesses. 

His future  hopes are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, rice and cooking fat, and buy livestock to resell.

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
The Sumbersari Permai group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp.10.000.000, and each member will receive Rp.1.000.000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement their family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their third loan with MUK.

Kadek is the head of the Sumbersari Permai group.  She is married and has one child. She will use the loan to buy three piglets.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months of fattening.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 27 years old and involved in the business of making "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie back the hair). It is a very famous product among women. 

Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes. He sells shoes to different factories and shoe shops. He has a good number of business contacts and receives regular orders every month. 

Robina is the mother of two children. Both of them are very young and are not of school-going age yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husband’s shoe-making business. With the loan, he will be able to make a larger quantity of shoes due to the availability of shoe-making materials. Robina will also invest some of the loan in her "Pranday"-making business in hope of getting better profits. 

Her husband has been operating his business for the past six years and Robina has a lot of confidence in him. She hopes that taking a loan will be a profitable experience for her. 

She is a new loan applicant with Asasah.

loans.use: To buy shoe-making material and material for making "Paranda" (an ornament used to tie back the hair).

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has worked as a gas station supervisor since 1995. His business income is very important because he is the main one responsible for paying the family expenses, especially the children's education fees. With his requested loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to pay the school registration for his children. It’s required at this time for all the school management to start student registration procedures, which only last for a couple of weeks. So Fady has to move fast and gather the needed sum of cash to be able to allow his children to proceed with their educational path.

loans.use: to pay school registration for his children

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Està casada, tiene 35 años y cuatro hijos estudiantes del nivel secundario.

Desde hace 15 años trabaja en una empresa privada de elaboración de yogurt hasta las 6 de la tarde. Cuando tubo a sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de trabajar màs y apoyar en la economía de su hogar, empezó a vender refrescos, chupetes y dulces en la calle con que no tuvo mucho exito. Por eso tomó la decisión de invertir el cápital inicial de PEN 300.00 en una parrilla y empezó vender pollos y carnes asadas. Ha aumentando la variedad en sus comidas como juanes, arroz chaufa y refrescos de frutas. Trabaja actualmente en ambas actividades y le va muy bien, además de su rica preparación, ha salido adelante con sus hijos a los que mantiene y educa.
Con el nuevo préstamo de PEN 1,700.00 comprará productos para implementar un negocio con pollos vivos, carnes de res, especias, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceites en litros, racimos de plátanos, sacos con carbón para asar sus parrillas, utensilios de cocina así que mesas y sillas para así captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos .
Mónica Patricia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, su sueño es contar con un negocio en su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Mónica Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” (Women Headed to Victory II) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are high school students.

For the past 15 years, Mónica has worked at a private company that makes yogurt. Her job schedule lasts until 6pm. When she had her children, Mónica saw the need to work more in order to support the household finances. She began selling soft drinks, lollipops, and sweets on the street, but she did not have much success. For that reason, Mónica made the decision to invest her initial capital of 300 PEN in a grill and began selling chicken and roasted meats. She expanded her menu by adding “juanes” (a traditional Peruvian specialty of chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves), fried rice, and fruit drinks. Mónica currently works both jobs and has done very well. In addition to preparing her rich foods, she has been able to help her children get ahead by supporting them and providing them an education.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, Mónica will buy products to keep her business in operation such as live chickens, beef, spices, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, liters of oil, bunches of bananas, sacks of charcoal for her grill, cooking utensils, as well as tables and chairs in order to attract new customers and keep them satisfied.

Mónica Patricia is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business in her home. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing opportunities to women like her so that they can make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cooking utensils, and various ingredients.

loans.name: Leornard

texts.en: Leornard is a hardworking business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last nine years, he has been selling DVDs to earn a living. He works in his business so as to provide for his family and provide quality education for his children. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy DVDs.

loans.use: To buy DVDs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene grado de instrucción primaria.
Desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de cereales, detergentes, pastas dentales, shampoo, galletas, etc. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma  de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco cajas de galletas, cinco paquetes de detergentes, pastas dentales y cereales, nos cuenta que su mercadería la compra en Desaguadero y la vende en la ciudad de Moquegua, a veces su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él trabaja en transportes como chofer.
La señora desea que su negocio crezca y sea más grande para mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y  sus ganancias
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the  “La Yunguyeñita” community bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department.  She is 24 years old, lives with her husband and has 2 children.  She has a primary school education.
For the last cycle she has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles, money which she invested in her business of selling cereals, detergents, toothpastes, shampoo, crackers, etc..
With this new loan of 500 new soles, she will buy five cases of crackers, five cases of detergent, toothpastes and cereals.  She purchases her merchandise in Desaguadero and sells it in the city of Moquegua.  At times, her husband helps her in her business.  He is employed as a driver.
She wants her business to grow to be larger and this way generate better income.
What she likes about the community bank are the meetings, the savings and her profits.

loans.use: to buy five cases of crackers, five cases of detergent, toothpastes and cereals.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 33 years old. He lives with his mother in Ddmashen village, Sevan area. Since 2003 Armen has been working for the police and at the same time he and his mother are engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding.

Armen and his mother breed cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens. He sells the produced dairy products to fellow villagers, and the meat to butchers. He uses the rest of the agricultural produce for his family's needs. He also grows wheat and oats, which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. Thanks to farming, Armen provides for his family and now he intends to buy three more cows. This will help him to sell more dairy products and thus to increase his family income in the future. Therefore, he needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenia drams (AMD).

This is Armen’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never been delayed in his repayments.

loans.use: To buy three more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 46-year-old married man with a son. He lives with his wife and son in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa and his wife have been running a food stall for nearly six years. They sell Thai noodles to people in the local community. He intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet his customers' demands. 

He hopes that through the loan he can earn more money with his current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is 38-years-old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Hafswa has been working hard to manage her produce store which sells fresh fruits, vegetables and other foodstuffs to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Hafswa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize millet and sugar, and will help Hafswa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hafswa hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Hafswa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Majidu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize millet and sugar.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Eusebio tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde efectúa reparaciones de muebles y confecciona muebles nuevos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser madera en diversas clases, cola, barniz, para continuar con su trabajo, pues es su única fuente ingresos .Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene cinco hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente desde el año 2009. Esta es también la segunda vez que solicita que su crédito sea financiado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio works in a small carpentry workshop where he does furniture repair and produces new furniture pieces. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as different types of wood, glue, and varnish so that he can continue his work since this is his only source of income. Eusebio lives in his own home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is married and has five children.

Eusebio is very satisfied with the previous loans he has received since 2009. This is the second time his loan request is being financed through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, varnish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sisimukha A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha A SHG Group in Western Kenya! Martha is the facilitator of the Sisimukha A SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martha takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds for early land preparation for planting. In the recent 2011 season, Martha had an excellent maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martha was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martha and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Martha will save for the future and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha A SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo above, Martha is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito D. La Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 50 años, está casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes.
Hace 10 años que inició su negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, D. esta forma apoyó con la educación D. sus hijos, pero por algunos problemas familiares el negocio fue decayéndose, hace dos años que decidió formar parte del Banquito Comunal y con el préstamo D. S/. 300.00, logró reactivar su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, y actualmente prepara comida (almuerzos) para dar pensión a sus clientes, todo esto la mantiene en actividad, D. esa manera genera sus propios ingresos.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, implementará su negocio con productos como conservas, golosinas, abarrotes y bebidas gasificadas.
Angélica es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,  su sueño es seguir ampliando su tienda D. abarrotes y tener un restaurante, para lograr la estabilidad económica que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Angélica belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II,” which is in the district La Banda D. Shilcayo, San Martín Province, department of San Martín. She’s 50 years old, married, and has 5 grown children. 

She started her business selling necessities 10 years ago and was able to support her children’s education. However, due to some personal problems the business fell through. Two years ago she decided to join the communal bank, and with a loan of S/. 300.00 she was able to restart her business selling groceries. Now she prepares food (lunches) in order to better serve her customers. All this keeps her in business, and in this manner she generates her own income. 

With this new loan of S/. 1,200.00 she will expand her business with products like preserves, candy, groceries, and soda. 

Angélica is a hardworking and tenacious woman. Her dream is to continue expanding her grocery store and have a restaurant so that she can have the economic stability that she craves.

loans.use: to buy groceries like preserves, sweets, food, and soda.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, es comerciante de medicinas, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, ella aprendió el negocio de la medicina trabajando con una amiga, quien le enseño para cotizar los precios, trabaja en su propia casa, no tiene un horario fijo y ya posee experiencia en el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo, pues quiere comprar un lote de medicinas, para vender la compra le ayudara para mantener a disponibilidad de los clientes, un surtido de jarabes, pastillas, inyecciones, de medicamentos y vitaminas,  esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer su negocio.
Ella quiere tener un negocio grande, con más clientela y proveer para su familia lo necesario, permitiéndole vivir en otras condiciones.
texts.en:
María sells medicines for a living.  She lives with her family, her husband and two children.  She learned the medicine business working with a friend who taught her to give quotes on the prices.  She works from home and doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She already has experience in this business.  

She is requesting a loan to buy medicines to have on hand for her customers to buy.  She will stock medicines in the form of syrups, pills, injections, and also vitamins.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business.  

She wants to have a large business with more customers and to give her family what they need, allowing them to live in other conditions.

loans.use: buy medicines such as syrups, pills, injections and vitamins to stock her business.

loans.name: Malka

texts.en:
Malka is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She rents out marine and fishing equipment, a business that has been in operation for the last three months. She purchased the items from her savings and from a previous loan from Milango. Besides this, Malka owns a clothes and a juice business.
She is applying for a loan of Ksh 80,000 to buy more marine and fishing equipment. Malka’s main challenge is seasonal weather and high fuel cost. She will reinvest the extra income obtained from this business to restock her electrical shop.

loans.use: To buy more marine and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pedro es de ciudad del este, está casado  con la señora  Carmen, juntos tienen 2 hijos aun pequeños que van a la escuela.
Nos cuenta Pedro que tiene una pequeña despensa, la cual está bien surtida, además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso. Ambos negocios lo están ayudando a él y a su familia, generándole un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de su esposa y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad. Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y honesta.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, verduras, hortalizas, lácteos y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que estas le brindan.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the Ciudad del Este.  He is married to Carmen, and they have two young children who go to school.

Pedro tells us that he has a small grocery store, which is well stocked.  In addition to that he sells all types of clothes.  His sales are increasing more and more.  Both businesses are helping his family by generating a good income for him.

With the help from his wife and his whole family he is getting ahead with great sacrifice and effort.  He is now a successful small businessman with numerous and fixed customers.  This is due to his kindness.  He is known for being a responsible and honest person.

He is requesting the loan to buy food like vegetables, dairy products, and other supplies to be able to stock his business.  This is the way that he will get ahead of his customers’ demand.  

He is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the help they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy food like vegetables, dairy products, and other supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 37 years old. He is married to Margret and they have 2 children. Samuel has been running a bakery for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 6800.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of Kes 20,000. He intends to use the loan to purchase wheat, cooking oil, and yeast for baking. With the anticipated profits, he will diversify into farming.

His hope and dream is to do both the bakery and a farming business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, yeast, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en: Ferial is a 53 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for clothes and blankets to sell.In the future she wants to expand her project and she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Sonagnon Group

texts.fr: SONAGNON est un groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. A. Béatrice, la représentante du groupe(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. A. Béatrice est mariée à un peintre auto du nom de Sunday. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. A. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, A. Béatrice vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des tissus de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, A. Béatrice vend aussi des chaussures ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. A. Béatrice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, A. Béatrice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SONAGNON un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine, des tissus et des chaussures.

loans.name: Sènadjro

texts.fr: Sènadjro âgée de 41 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Sènadjro est marié à une marchande du nom de Homagnissi. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Sènadjro vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sènadjro vend depuis vingt ans, de l’huile rouge comme activité principale. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sènadjro vend des noix palmistes. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Sènadjro achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sènadjro sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile de palme et des noix de palme

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella sells glasses and doing eye exams in Guayaquil. After working at an optometrist’s office for some time Estrella saved enough money to start her own business. She had to make a $480 investment in the glasses kit that she uses to take people’s measurements. After she takes the measurements and her clients chose the frames she sends the glasses in to get the correct lens put in. She mostly sells in her community, but also travels to colleges, churches and hospitals selling her products. She is very popular because there are not any optometrists that will go to their clients, especially in these marginalized communities.

She is currently separated from her husband and has the responsibility of providing for herself and her 15 year old child while he finished high school. Her dream is to finish her studies at the university so she can be a certified optometrist. She eventually wants to open her own office. She will invest the money in new frames and a second display case.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new glasses frames to sell to her clients

loans.name: Kokou Améto

texts.en:
Well known for the quality of his palm oil, Mr.D. Kokou Améto was born in 1975 in Agomé-Glozou where he still resides. Married and father to four (04) children, he is practicing this activity, which he inherited from his mother fifteen years ago. He gained tremendous experience from his practice. The income from the production of palm oil, even meager, allows him to care for his family’s needs.

Today he is overwhelmed by the market’s demand because he lacks the financial means. He is requesting a loan of $750 to buy tons of palm nuts to produce oil. This will improve the living conditions of his whole family and will help Mr. D. to better save and obtain a regular income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Reconnu pour la qualité de son huile de palme, Monsieur D. Kokou Améto est né en 1975 à Agomé-Glozou où il réside encore. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il exerce cette activité qu’il a héritée de sa mère depuis une quinzaine d’années. Aujourd’hui, cette durée lui confère de l’expérience. Les revenus tirés de la production de l’huile de palme quand bien même maigre lui sert à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Aujourd’hui excédé par la demande sur le marché faute de moyens financier, il sollicite cet apport financier de $750 pour acheter des tonnes de noix de palme afin de produire plus d'huile. Ceci pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de toute la famille et aidera Monsieur D. à mieux épargner et avoir de revenus réguliers.

loans.use:
Purchase of tons of palm nuts and tools for his trade

Achat des tonnes de noix de palme et des matériels de travail

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en:
Gricelda is married. To earn extra income and support her family, and because she enjoys sales, she began her own business selling shoes six years ago. Gricelda is hardworking and entrepreneurial. She is comfortable with people, something that has helped her win customers and stay in business. Right now she is looking for a $250 loan to buy the merchandise her customers want. She proposes to repay the loan in 3-6 months. The well-being of this family and the growth of the business is in your hands, so please do not hesitate to help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Gricelda es casada, la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder sacar adelante a su familia y el gusto por las ventas la incentivaron a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, desde hace 6 años. Griselda es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, su carácter le ha ayudado a sobresalir en su negocio por la facilidad que tiene de relacionarse con los demás, así es como durante este tiempo ha estado ganando clientes y ha logrado permanecer en el negocio.

En estos momentos ella necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y cubrir sus demandas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3ª 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is married and has six children. Only the youngest --- who are 7, 15, and 17 years old respectively --- depend economically on their parents. Alicia and her husband are from Veracruz, but they migrated to Nuevo Leon 25 years ago in search of better opportunities. Due to high unemployment, her husband began helping one of his aunts, who sold plants and toys. Thanks to the experience he obtained, he was able to start his own business later. His revenues, however, could not cover all of his family's needs. Consequently, Alicia began to sell these same products in other markets.

Right now, Alicia seeks a loan of $750. She will use this to buy merchandise, with which she hopes to increase her sales by offering her customers a wider variety of products. She offers to repay this sum in 6 months. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Alicia and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia es casada y tiene seis hijos, solo los más pequeños de 7, 15 y 17 años de edad dependen económicamente de ellos, Alicia y su esposo son originarios de Veracruz, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia se mudaron a Nuevo León desde hace 25 años, ante la falta de un empleo su esposo comenzó ayudándole a una de sus tías que se dedicaba a vender plantas y juguetes, gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo pudo iniciar su propio negocio, pero el ingreso que obtenía era insuficiente para todas las necesidades de su familia, así que Alicia también empezó a trabajar vendiendo los mismos productos en otros mercados.

En estos momentos Alicia solicita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas al ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar el bienestar de Alicia y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Alimammad

texts.en:
Mr. Alimammad is a low income vulnerable person. He is 52, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Alimammad sells various sorts of fuel. His younger son helps him and sells the fuel for vehicles, tractors and other farm machinery. In farming seasons there is great demand in fuels and Alimammad plans to buy additional tank to store another sort of kerosene. For this purpose he applied for $1000 loan to Normicro Saatli branch and he hope he would be lucky.

loans.use: To buy a petrol tank

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc's husband left home, and her business is selling rice and spaghetti. Her two sons work as day labourers, and her youngest child is in the 6th class. Their average income is $12,5 per month/person. Cuc is requesting a loan of $50 to raise ducks which will provide school fees for her son. The loan will be repaid in four months.

loans.use: To buy and raise ducks

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Shahodat G. has been in this business for 11 years. She has 3 children and is a widow. She uses business profits to support her family and to save for her daughter’s wedding. She plans to use her loan to purchase inventory to sell in time for the New Year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гайбуллоева Шаходат занимается данным бизнесом в течение 11 лет. Имеет троих детей. Вдова. Доходы получаемые от бизнеса направляются на содержание семьи и для накопления для свадьбы дочки. Получив займ она намеревается закупить товар для продажи к новому году.

loans.use: Increasing of assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business (Ampliar su negocio)

loans.name: Thi Mao

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mão, 27 years old, a hard working woman, is married with two children. She is in scrap material business. Everyday she rides her old bicycle more than ten kilometers around rural area to collect scrap then sells them back to the depots. She will use funds from the loan as capital money. She makes about 3USD a day. Not much but she can make the repayments.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mão 27 tuổi, chị là người phụ nữ chịu khó. Chị đã có chồng và 2 con. Chị làm nghề đi mua phế liệu, hàng ngày chị đi chợ bằng chiếc xe đạp đã cũ, trên đường về chị bán lại hàng cho các đại lý thu mua. Chị vay vốn về để đi chợ thu gom được nhiều phế liệu hơn. Công việc của chị khá vất vả vì mỗi ngày chị đi xe đạp vài chục cây số. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị cũng được trên 50.000đ. Khoản thu này không lớn nhưng giúp chị có thể trả hàng tuần hợp lý.

loans.use: Buy scrap material

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old car electrician. Ali lives and works in Saida in southern Lebanon. This is the second time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy materials for his business. In addition, with the expected increase in income to be generated from this loan, he would like to buy a car.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Neh

texts.en:
Neh was born in 1957, married and a mother of six children. Her challenges have been that of sickness, marital misunderstanding and the destruction of her property during a political uproar. Her husband’s unemployment also made it difficult for her family to feed well and for her children to go to school. This led her to seek help and to become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all her loans with which she raised money to pay school fees for her children, buy a plot, build a house and buy food for her family.

Neh is requesting a new loan to carry out the business of patching and selling tires,engine oil and crop cultivation. Her son, who has experience in the repair of tires, will take care of the workshop. The shop is situated along the main road with access to many clients. With this, she will raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees, buy medications and to complete her house.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase tires and buying of seeds for crop cultivation

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a widow with four children ages 14 (twins), 16, and 25. She makes a living as a dress maker and works from 8 AM to 4 PM daily. From this business, which she started ten years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $85.

Mwanajuma hopes for a loan to purchase sewing materials in order to expand her business. She is a member of loan group Tuwtmaelto, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Ružica

texts.en: Ružica is a single woman from the town of Derventa. She works and her monthly salary is 400 KM. This would be her first loan from MCO WWI; she is requesting 1,000 KM. She would use the loan to buy rose seedlings, which she would plant and sell. Ružica hopes to increase her monthly revenue in order to buy more rose seedlings, cultivate them, and sell them.

loans.use: To buy rose seedlings

loans.name: Sousa

texts.pt:
Sousa L. is 46 years old. He is married and he had 6 children. The oldest one is 26 and the others are 21, 13, 11, 8 and 1 year old respectively. The are all in school except for the youngest one. Besides his sons and daughters, he also supports his mother and nephews that live with her by sending money and food. Sousa went to school until the 8th grade and because of his family situation he had to start working at an early age to cover the expenses, worse yet, there were no evening classes available at that time. Sousa worked for a pottery company in Mozambique that awarded him in 1981 with a 3-year scholarship in Cuba. He still receives pension payments from that company. He lives in his own home. In 1989, Sousa built an iron shop that later had to be passed on to his ex-wife when they were divorced. Sousa is now self-employed. Since 1999 he has been running a restaurant he built with his own resources. The restaurant opens at 8:00am and closes at 9:00pm; it has 3 employees. He learned the skills needed on his own when he realized that his salary was not enough to pay for his family´s needs. The best selling dish is pork meat which goes for 80,00mt and costs him 45,00mt. His monthly income is 12000,00mt and from that amount he saves 3500,00mt. This is his second loan request in his life and first through Kiva. The first loan was in the amount of 10000,00mt given by BPD (People´s Development Bank) and it was used to build the iron shop his ex-wife now owns. The second loan will be used to purchase a variety of products for the restaurant, thus, increasing sales. In the future, with help from other loans, Sousa intends to open up a butcher´s shop to sell meat and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sousa L. tem 46 ano de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos sendo de 26 anos de idade o primeiro, 21 o segundo, 13 o terceiro, 11 o quarto, 8 o quinto e um ano o sexto. Todos ainda estudam excepto o menor de todos. Para além dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mae e seus sobrinhos que vive com a sua mae enviando dinheiros ou generos alimenticios. Sousa estudou até Oitava Classe e por situação familiar teve que começar a trabalhar muito novo para sustentar a familia e como na era nao tinhas escolas que davam aulas de noite. Sousa trabalhou na ceramica de Moçambique empresa que lhe deu bolsa para estudar em Cuba em 1981 por tres anos, empresa que até hoje se benificia de uma pensao. Vive numa casa própria. Em 1989 Sousa construiu uma ferragem qual teve que deixar com sua primeira esposa, quando se divorciaram. Sousa trabalha a conta própria, onde desde 1999 explora um estabelecimento (Restaurante) construído por fundos próprios o Restaurante abre as 8:00h e fecha as 21:00h e tem 3 empregados. Aprendeu o trabalho por inciativa própria quando viu que o salario não respondia as necessidades da casa. O prato com mais saída é o acompanhado com carne de Porco que vende por 80,00mt meticais qual lhe custa 45,00mt. Tem uma receita mensal de 12000,00mt e poupa 3500,00mt. Este é o segundo emprestimo na vida e primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt contraído no BPD( banco popular de desenvolvimento) valor que usou para construção da ferragem que deixo com a sua primeira esposa. O segundo usara para adquirir produtos diversos para o restaurante aumentando assim as vendas. Sousa pretende futuramente com ajuda dos empréstimo abrir um talho para vende de carne e expandir o seu negocio.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his Restaurant

loans.name: Sandra Gloria

texts.es:
Sandra started her business selling cosmetics and natural products but she realized that it wasn’t going well, so she convinced her two oldest children to start their own business, taking advantage of the fact that they had studied computers. She began in March 2003 and air-conditioned one of the rooms in her home in order to make it into a computer maintenance workshop, making use of one of her children’s degree in computers. Thanks to God since then it has gone well, and at this pace they will soon have their own shop established.

She needs a loan of $325, which she will repay over 3 months, in order to buy an extensive variety of computer supplies that will help them to perform their work better and satisfy their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra inició el negocio vendiendo cosméticos y productos naturistas pero veía que no le iba bien y fue entonces cuando convencío a sus dos hijos mayores de poner su propio negocio aprovechando que ellos estudiaron informática. Comenzó en Marzo del 2003, acondicionaron uno de los cuartos de su casa para poner el taller de mantenimiento de computadoras aprovechando que uno de sus hijos había terminado la carrera de Lic. En Informática y gracias a Dios desde entonces les ha ido muy bien, a tal grado que ya muy pronto tendran su propio local establecido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un extenso surtido de consumibles de computadoras que les ayudan a elaborar mejor su trabajo y dejar satisfechos a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama T. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’ignames à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité plus depuis plus de 6 ans et souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des ignames dans des villages environnants pour la revente et  aussi louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Les gains de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Ama est celle habillée en corsage rose.
texts.en:
Ama T. is 52, married, and mother of 5 children. She sells yams in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for more than 6 years and is hoping with this, her second loan from FECECAV, to bolster her business by buying yams in the surrounding villages for re-sale. She also hopes to rent a place to store her merchandise. The increased sales will allow her to provide better for the needs of her children. Ama is the one who is wearing a pink bodice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy yams in the surrounding villages and rent a place to store her merchandise

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, salir adelante en la economía de su hogar y ayuda a esposo con gastos de escuela y manutención ya que el sale de viaje y para no estar esperanzada a que le deposite dinero, busco una actividad que le generara ingresos. Comenzó hace 1 año cuando una hermana la canalizo con una distribuidora de cosméticos y la dio de alta, entonces ella empezó a vender estos productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un kit de la nueva temporada y poder así ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Katia took the initiative to launch her business so that she could help her husband pay for household expenses and to help improve the family's economic situation. Her husband travels frequently, and Katia wanted to find her own source of income so that she wasn't constantly waiting for him to deposit money. Katia began her business a year ago, when her sister introduced her to a cosmetics distributor who supplied her with merchandise, which she then began to sell.

Katia needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, to buy this season's cosmetics kit and start selling these new products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy this season's cosmetics

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 49 años de edad, estudió tercer grado de primaria, es casada y madre de dos hijos (una mujer de 25 años y un varón de 21 años de edad). Vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1301, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno, y desde hace 09 años es socia del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo.

A los 07 meses de nacida quedó huérfana de madre y a los 16 años de edad quedo huérfana de padre. Desde los 14 años de edad se fue a trabajar como vendedora de una tienda de abarrotes. Cuando cumplió 28 años formó su hogar y junto a su esposo empezaron el negocio de abarrotes como ambulantes. Desde hace 10 años aperturó una tienda de abarrotes, la cual vienen viene atendiendo hasta la fecha.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas, comprará con todo el capital productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes).

Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y poner más productos (surtir la tienda) y dejar un capital a sus hijos para que puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
Sabina is 49 years old, studied to third grade in primary school, is married, and is the mother of two children (a daughter who is 25 years old and a son who 21 is years of age). She lives in Jr. Arica Nº 1301, district and province of Yunguyo, Puno, and for the past 9 years she has been a member of “La Yunguyeñita” Communal Bank in Yunguyo. When she was 7 months old her mother passed ago and at 16 years of age she became an orphan with the loss of her father. Since she was 14 years old she went to work as a salesperson in a grocery store. When she turned 28 years old she formed her household and together with her husband they started a grocery business as traveling vendors. For the past 10 years she has had a grocery store which they have up to the present time. With this loan of S/.1,500, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy essential household products (groceries). Her dream is to have a big store and put more products (diversify the store) and leave some money for her children so they can work.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential household products (groceries).

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo is a small-scale businesswoman. She believes that “the sun shall soon shine,” that is, her life and her business will soon have a new turn. This is because she now has new capital from LAPO Microfinance and Kiva, and she is very happy. 

Taiwo is 32 years of age and she has 3 children. Taiwo sell jewelry door-to-door, from street to street, and from community to community. Taiwo’s business is very small, but she is hard-working and she wants to increase the prosperity of her business and that of her family. 

Taiwo needs a loan of N50, 000 ($425 USD) to enable her buy more jewelry and to open a shop for her business. She is grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry and rent a shop

loans.name: Maria Micaela

texts.es:
La pulpería P. es el nombre del negocio cuya propietaria es la señora María P. dedicándose a este desde hace 6 años. Al ver la necesidad de ampliar su negocio ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda con el propósito de dar lugar a que se puedan introducir más estantes donde ofertar sus productos.

Para llevar a cabo esta reconstrucción en su vivienda ella ha utilizado el apoyo de Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Sin embargo a medida que la construcción avanza ella va requiriendo mayores cantidades de materiales de construcción y para esto una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta forma comprar la arena, piedrín, cemento, laminas de zinc y madera para las puertas. Todo esto con el propósito de mejorar y ampliar su pulpería ubicada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
The “P. Pulpería” (small grocery store) is the name of the business whose owner is María P., who has had it for 6 years. Because she sees the need to expand her business, she has begun to re-construct her house, with the purpose of creating space for more shelves where she can offer her products. In order to re-construct her house, she has used the support of Ceprodel to buy the construction materials. However, as the building process advances, she needs larger amounts of construction materials and so she is once again seeking the support of Ceprodel for a loan so that she can buy the sand, pebbles, cement, and zinc panels and wood for the doors. This is for the purpose of improving and expanding her small grocery store, which is located in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the department of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is thirty-six years old. She is divorced and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She says she has been divorced for the past eight years. According to Elizabeth, her husband travelled overseas, only to let her know that they couldn't continue to be a couple.

Elizabeth says she takes care of the children alone. Her son is currently in senior high school while her daughter is learning a trade: hairdressing. Elizabeth is a food vendor. She sells fried yams and cocoyams by the roadside. She procures her goods from local farmers, at times on credit, and pays them back after her sales. She has been in this business for two years. Elizabeth wants a loan to buy the raw materials in bulk so that she can expand her business. She desires to pay for her son to attend university.

loans.use: To buy yams and cocoyams in bulk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en alquiler con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la calle Illimani de la zona Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como procuradora en la Alcaldía.

 El crédito que solicita es para la operación de su cuñado, de 65 años de edad, cuya rodilla está en muy malas condiciones. La operación se efectuará en el departamento de Tarija debido a que el seguro donde son atendidos los rentistas es de muy mala calidad.

Maria es cliente de Impro desde Agosto de 2008; su historial crediticio es bueno  y además el carácter social del crédito influye notablemente para que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Maria lives with her husband and two children in a rented home in the city of La Paz. She works as an attorney in the mayor's office. The credit that she is requesting is for the operation of her brother-in-law, who is 65, and whose knee is in very bad shape. The operation will take place in the department of Tarija since the hospital where people who rent are attended isn't of very quality. Maria has been a client of Impro since August of 2008. Her credit history is good and the social nature of this credit has notably influenced her ability to receive a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the expenses of a knee operation for her brother-in-law

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom K., a resident of Ta Suon village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Su Han, is a cow breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so Mom is requesting a loan to purchase two cows for breeding.

She is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén es socio del Bancomunal las Rosas del Valle.
Rubén es conviviente  tiene 34 años, tres hijos D. 12, 6 y 3 años, los mayores estudian en  L. escueL.  estatal.
Hace once años L. esposa D. Rubén trabajaba vendiendo  lencería en un puesto D. un familiar, elL. vio que era rentable y junto con sus esposo decidieron  alquilar un puesto ahora  venden lencería.   
Rubén necesita un préstamo D.  3000 soles, para L. compra D. brassier, fajas, trusas, medias.
DesD. que está en Finca, las charlas que ha recibido le han ayudado, ahora toma nota D. todos Ingresos y egresos, aprendió hacer  balances, ha comprado un nuevo puesto en el mercado.  
El sueño D. Ruben  es comprar el puesto que tiene alquilado hace años.
texts.en:
Rubén is a member of the Communal Bank of Rosas del Valle. He is 34 years old and lives with his partner and three children aged 12, 6, and 3. The older children study in public school. For 11 years his wife worked selling lingerie in the shop of a family member. She saw that it was profitable and together they decided to rent their own shop to sell lingerie.

Rubén needs a loan of 3000 soles (about $950 US) to buy bras, girdles, and stockings. Since he has been in Finca, the conversations he has had have helped him, and now he takes notes of all income and expenses, learning accounting for his business, and he has bought a new stall in the market. Rubén's dream is to buy the stall that he has been renting for years.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rubén necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para la compra de brassier, fajas, trusas, medias.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb T. is 36 years old. She married in 1991 and has four children: one son and three daughters. Three of her children attend school while the last one is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chroeb has been selling lottery tickets for sixteen years. She has filled up the ground around her house and would now like to obstruct the land when the rainy season comes. She is asking for a loan of $500 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Sumya

texts.en:
Sumya T. is 51, married and the mother of one. Her family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002, she opened a grocery story right next to her house and on the plot of land she owns. Her store is located in a good location and there are no other competitors in the area. She has many repeat clients including her neighbors. Increasing numbers of customers has driven working capital from 800,000 tugrugs to 4,200,000 tugrugs during the last seven years.

Sumya's husband, Boris, is a cab driver and her only daughter, Handmaa, is studying at a university to become a medical doctor. Sumya is requesting a loan to buy a variety of food products such as flour, rice, vegetable, sugar and candies. Her dream is to have her own supermarket downtown.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food products such as flour, rice, vegetable, sugar and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 31 años, es natural de la ciudad de Chanchamayo (selva del departamento de Junín), es soltera vive con su hijo Oscar de 7 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de leche embolsada, empezó con este negocio debido a que necesitaba solventar los gastos de su pequeño, felizmente todos sus esfuerzos dieron resultado y ahora posee mayor estabilidad económica, ya que realiza muy buenas ventas en el barrio en el que vive. Considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio es que las personas saben que la leche producto muy nutritivo y le hacen constantes pedidos, es por eso que nunca le faltan los clientes. A Lidia le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da tiempo suficiente para estar con su pequeño hijo. En un futuro, a Lidia le gustaría tener una tienda de comestibles. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para venderlos y así obtener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Lidia is 31 years old and is from the city of Chanchamayo (jungle area of the Junin Department). She is single and lives in her own home with her 7-year-old son, Oscar. For the past 9 years she has sold packaged milk, an enterprise she began so that she could support her son. Happily, all her efforts were rewarded and she now enjoys improved economic stability since her sales are quite good in her neighborhood. She believes that her business does well because her customers know that the product is very nutitional and they are constantly placing orders so she is never short on customers. Lidia enjoys her work very much because it allows her to spend valuable time with her son. In the future, Lidia would like to have a grocery store. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the funds to buy more products to sell thus obtaining indreased income for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
ROSITA U. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” domiciliada en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo N° 946 del distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años, 2 hijos mayores, y su esposo tiene trabajo como obrero de una empresa.

Tenía un negocio de productos de belleza y hace 3 años  obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con esto compro algunos cosméticos, pero por inconvenientes tuvo que dejar de trabajar con productos de belleza. Actualmente ella vende ropas como blusas, camisas, polo, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y para luego ofrecerlo a sus vecinos a amistades.

En los tres años que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres trabajadoras para que así puedan salir a adelante.
texts.en:
Rosita U. D. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" (United Women) community bank. She lives in the Calleria district and is 50 years old. She has two adult children and her husband is a worker at a company. She owned a beauty products business and three years ago, she obtained her first loan of 300 new soles. With this, she bought some cosmetics. However, as a result of some drawbacks, she had to stop working with beauty products. Currently, she sells clothing like blouses, shirts, polo-shirts, etc. With this loan of 1,000 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and then sell them to her neighbors and friends. In the three years that she has been with Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy from the support given to working women so they may get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase different types of clothing.

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en:
Lerna G. is a picture of a brave woman. Despite failing in three relationships with men she thought loved her, she managed to stand tall and raise her three children well. It was hard for Lerna to ignore people's negative perception towards what happened to her. But Lerna ignored those opinions and managed to focus her attention on the people that make her happy and complete- her children. After having her heart broken several times, she no longer dreams of having another man in her life. She has to prepare her three daughters for the future and provide them with a sense of security. 

Lerna has "sari-sari" (mini variety) store business to grow. She is not content with having only one type of business because she wants to diversify to ensure she can meet the family’s needs. In addition to her sari-sari store, Lerna also started a buy-and-sell business. Someday when her businesses have grown, she dreams of building a house to shelter her daughters from harm. She hopes that her daughters will grow up differently and that they will have a better education.

Through Lerna's membership in ASHI, she believes that she has the opportunity to achieve her dreams for her children. With access to credit, she is able to have a business of her own and doesn't have to depend on other people to help her. This loan will help bring her business and self confidence to a higher level. Her achievements thus far are because of ASHI, her children, and because of people who trusted her in so many ways.

loans.use: restock variety store

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Chab K., 43, has been involved in a business of selling groceries at home with a typical income of US $4.20 per day in Takeo Province since 1998. K. works very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. She and her husband are blessed with five children; two of them are students at a local high school, and the rest are employed with a fair income to earn a living. Her husband is a palm sugar seller who usually generates a gross income of US $33 in revenue per day.

K. really wants to take a loan of US $1000 to expand her inventory by purchasing more various kinds of groceries for her store. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to generate a better income to cover her family expenses as well as to save to cover her children’s future education.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries for resale

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: LAS DELICIAS  fue fundado el 03 D. AGOSTO del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio, el grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 16 personas,entre otras actividades estan la venta D. bijouteria, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi (durazno seco), venta D. helados, panaderia, pintado en tela, que son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos.Las Señoras estan conforme D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena.			
La Sra.ELDA M.  es Presidenta del grupo, es nueva  como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento. Ella se dedica a la venta D. pan ademas D. ir a vender a provincia bijouteria, atienD. a sus hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable .Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.			
La Sra. Juanita G. es la tesorera, socia antigua. Se dedica al rubro D. venta D. bijouteria y animales, dentro del rubro tiene 4 años D. antiguedad y tambien  realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia y ademas D. considerarla que  es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo. 			
La Sra. Marcela T.,  ella es secretaria  del BE Las Delicias, se dedica al pintado en tela, realiza manteles, servilletas y pintado en poleras, tiene 18 años y aún sigue estudiando y perfeccionando sus tecnicas D. pintado en tela tiene, 3 años D. antigüedad  en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a sabado 5 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su domicilio para hacerle los pedidos.
texts.en:
Bank of Entrepreneurship: LAS DELICIAS

This bank was established on August 03, 2009 as an initiative by a group of women entrepreneurs to develop their small businesses. The group is on its 2nd loan cycle and consists of 16 members. Their businesses offer the following products and services: jewelry, food, sewing and tailoring, cosmetics, medicines, refreshments (such as mocochinchi), ice cream, baked goods, hand-painted fabrics, and other activities that require access to quick credit. The members are satisfied with the work of Emprender because they have learned how to save and handle more responsibility. As a group, they respect one another and enjoy the time they share when they meet every two weeks.

Sra. Elda M. is the group president and new to this position. She sells bread and is planning to also sell jewelry. She takes care of her children and is a very friendly and dynamic person. Sra. Elda has also demonstrated that she is an accomplished and responsible leader, since she has met all of her loan commitments.

Sra. Juanita G. is the group treasurer and a long-time member. In addition to selling jewelry and animals, she also handles the chores at homes. With the income she earns, she is able to support her family. Sra. Juanita is considered one of the most respected and accomplished members of the group.

Sra. Marcela T. is the group secretary. She makes hand-painted fabrics used for tablecloths, napkins, and T-shirts. She is 18 years old and is still studying and perfecting her painting techniques. Sra. Marcela has 3 years experience with her business. She works 5 hours a day, Monday through Saturday. Her job is primarily to meet the people who visit her shop to place their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital & purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат Бекназарова проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж вместе сыном работают на земле. Сама же Зумрат вместе с дочерью занимается торговлей. Она имеент магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараборота.
texts.en:
49-year-old Zumrat B. lives in the Yavana district with her husband and four children. Her husband and son work the land together. For her part, Zumrat is engaged with her daughter in retail. She has a store where she sells food products. The loan is requested in order to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: 42-year-old Marilyn Dansalan resides in Trento, Agusan del Sur. She is a mother to 2 children. Their source of income is rice farming. Marilyn just recently joined CEVI. In need of additional financial assistance for their farm, she loaned Php4, 000, which will go to farming materials and equipments. She learned from fellow farmers that CEVI’s financial assistance truly is a helping hand and she hopes to experience the same.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie R. is from the village of Tugas. She is 41 years old. Nelie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Nelie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Zonia Deisy

texts.es: Zonia Deisy A. A. reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad.
