Zonia de 53 años de edad es una mujer viuda, vive con sus hijos que son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente, Zonia trabaja solamente para sus gastos y costos del hogar, posee un negocio de venta de pupusas de Juves a Domingo y panes con pollo de lunes a miércoles, ella es muy conocida en su colonia por una persona muy amable y trabajadora que ha mantenido su negocio ya por veinticinco años. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos necesarios para la elaboración de pupusas.
texts.en:
Zonia Deisy A. A. lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She is 53 years old and a widow. She lives with her adult children who are financially independent. Zonia works only to pay for her living expenses.

She has a business in which she sells pupusas Thursday through Sunday and panes con pollo (a traditional Salvadoran chicken dish) Monday through Wednesday. Zonia is well-known in her neighborhood for being a very friendly person and a hard worker. She has been in business for 20 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase necessary ingredients for making pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Philo

texts.en:
Philo owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She opens her stall daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 48 years old and married with five children.

Philo is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.en: Olga is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000 and this is her third Kiva loan. She has a popular food stand in the Subtiava Market in the city of León. She has a prime location, an excellent reputation and a very strong work ethic. Through the financing of Fundación León and Kiva, she has expanded her services to include a section for the sale of clothing. This loan will be used to support both her food stand and the new clothing venture. She will purchase firewood, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, and chicken as well as a variety of new clothing merchandise. Olga reports that business can be irregular.  One day she will sell out of all the food that she cooked, and another day business will be poor, and her food will not sell.  Olga continues to grow her business and dreams of one day having a beautiful store that sells new clothing.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS ALONDRAS”  se encuentra ubicada en la parte baja de Huaycán distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace unos 3 años, la alcancía comunal está conformada por 11 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual está representado por: 
Julia S. Tereza M., sigue actualmente asumiendo el cargo de presidenta, tiene 37 años y un  hijo de 15 años.
Julia se dedica  a la venta de ropas importadas según pedidos, su préstamo lo invertirá en compra de ropas  para la campaña navideña, para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados de sus clientes, en el futuro anhela poder hacer crecer  su negocio.
Luz A. J.: actualmente esta asumiendo el cargo de Tesorera, tiene 37 años, es madre soltera con un hijo. 
Luz se dedica a la venta de ropa  según pedidos desde hace 6 años, realiza también servicios de confección, con los cuales a logrado  mejorar su condición de vida, con el  préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropas variadas para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados, en el futuro anhela  hacer crecer  su negocio y llegar a  establecer  una  bodega.
Nuria V. A.: actualmente asume el cargo de secretaria, tiene 34 años, conviviente, con 2 hijos. Nuria  y su  esposo se dedican a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos, con el préstamo realizara la compras para su negocio, con el cual le permitirá cubrir sus necesidades y mejorar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Las Alondras Communal Bank is located in the lower part of Huaycán, in the Ate district, Lima department. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for three years. The communal bank is comprised of 11 members who work in different types of activities like production, commerce, and service. They are represented by: Julia S. Tereza Morial currently continues as the president. She is 37 and has a 15 year old son. She sells imported clothes by orders. She will use her loan to buy clothes for the Christmas season. That way she will cover her customers’ orders. In the future she longs to be able to make her business grow. Luz A. J. is currently the treasurer. She is 37, and she is a single mother with one child. Luz has been selling clothes by order for six years. She also makes clothes. These activities have enabled her to improve her living conditions. She will use the loan to buy various clothes to cover the orders she has received. In the future she wants to make her business grow and establish a convenience store. Nuria V. A. is currently the secretary. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Nuria and her husband sell replacement parts and accessories for vehicles. She will use the loan to purchase things for her business. That will allow her to cover their necessities and improve her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Loriza

texts.en:
Loriza L. is 46 years old and a good mother to her two children, who have graduated from college. She is married to her kind-hearted husband, Jose L., a sales representative of Greenlife. They live in Morong, Rizal, an attractive place, . 

Loriza sells Greenlife products. She plans to use this loan of Php 25,000 to expand her business and get involved in other businesses for supplementary profits. She will use this loan to buy Greenlife coffee (Php 5,900.00), Greenlife juice (Php 4,000.00), Greenlife syrup (Php 7,700.00) and Greenlife assorted products (Php 7,400.00). During her two years as a member of ASHI, Loriza has performed very well and ASHI trusts her to repay her loans.

This loan will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a winning business, the best in life, and a happy family as well. She is very thankful to ASHI for their continuous support of her dreams. She also hoping that, with the help of ASHI, she can provide a sustainable life for her family and enable them to have a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: To buy Greenlife products to sell

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 50 years old. She is married with six children. She manages her business with her children to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes for a bigger stall in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles N. W. is twenty seven years old, married and does not have any children. His business is located at Gikomba, a very busy market in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. He has been selling cereals to the people of Nairobi for the last five years. He has to work really hard to make profits as there are many other people who engage in the same kind of business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice.

He is using his loan to buy more cereals to expand his business and he wants his business to grow to a point where he will be able to supply in wholesale. He has a dream to start another business for his family. He is a very hardworking man and he wants to own land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy beans, peas and black beans

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna R. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store while her husband does other things. The couple has three children between the ages of 13 and 23. Two of their children are currently in school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.
Lorna joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been able to increase the family income from her general store. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP from her business activities.
Lorna is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her general store, and this had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now on her twenty-first loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store. Lorna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family – to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is from the village of Sebasi in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Veronica is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica provides motorcycle transport services. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. This will be Veronica's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and licenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: additional paint for vehicles

loans.name: Eudricelo

texts.en: Eudricelo L. is from the city of Labo, Ozamiz City. He is 42 years old. Eudricelo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eudricelo owns and operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a passenger-van service. Eudricelo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Eudricelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eudricelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Eudricelo is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Eudricelo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Restaurant 315 Group

texts.en: Salima is leader of the two-person Restaurant 315 Group. She lives in district 11 of Khir Khana, Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 38, married and the mother of five children. She is a good tailor and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is a hard-working woman and happy that the income from her tailoring enables her to support her family. Salima can sew all kinds of clothes and has lots of clients. She needs the loan to purchase sewing materials such as different kinds and colors of thread, needles and so on. She hopes to grow her business and to be able to send her children to better private schools.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Faith Dama

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Dama is single and has a boutique shop at Malindi town, where she sells clothes, shoes and jewelery. Her business, which is four years old, targets the town's residents. She normally gets a monthly profit of 8,000 Kenyan shillings.

Dama learned about Kiva's partner KADET from friends and came to inquire at the office, where she then registered as a client. This is her first loan and she will use Kshs 10,000 to stock ladies shoes and Kshs 10,000 on underclothes. With the extra profits, she will expand her business to a wholesale level.

An ambitious lady, she has hopes to pursue further studies and obtain a Masters in Business Administration degree.

loans.use: Adding ladies shoes and underclothes

loans.name: Señor De Mayo Group

texts.es:
“Señor de Mayo” es un grupo de 13 señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  están juntas hace 6 años aproximadamente. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Una de las integrantes es Miriam C. que ingreso al grupo por invitación de sus primas que ya estaban en el grupo y durante este tiempo ha podido participar de todos los servicios de Pro Mujer. Ella se dedica a vender ropa en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, hace 4 años, con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar más mercadería y seguir generando ingresos que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus dos hijos.
Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas requieren el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“Señor de Mayo” (Lord of May) is a group of 13 women who attend their meetings at the Alto Lima Community Center. They have been together for approximately six years. The members gathered to access a loan from which they all could benefit because they needed to improve and expand their businesses.

One of the members is Miriam C., who was invited to join by one of her cousins who was already part of the group. During this time, she has taken advantage of all the services offered by Pro Mujer. Miriam has been selling clothes at different fairs throughout El Alto for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise so that she can continue generating revenues and provide the basic necessities for her two children.

The other members have different businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors. All of them need this loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 60 years old widowed and mother of nine children. Two of her children attend school.

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 44 years and has one employee. Her main products are beans, bananas, maize and tea which she sells at the local market and to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. Her major challenge is a lack of finances for expansion.

Sarah has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow that will provide enough milk to sell and for her grandchildren to consume.

She appreciates the loan.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio M. is from the town of Albur. He is 50 years old, married to Julieta and has 6 children. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years now. Antonio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Antonio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his daughter's business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Jeska

texts.en:
Jeska is a 33-year-old woman, a single mother of three children whom she looks after in a rented home in Masindi, Uganda. Jeska says she wants to have her own home in the near future. She sells local brew and has been doing so for the last nine years. 

At this stage, Jeska wants to have a bigger and a good place to house her pub business as she seeks to grow the business for more income for her family. Her local brew is hugely marketable. For a certain tribe who cherish it much more than any other drink, it’s actually hugely appreciated and valued.

This is Jeksa’s second loan from HOFOKAM and she is to buy millet for processing the local brew to sell in her pub.

loans.use: Buying millet for processing the local brew to sell

loans.name: Mayra Mariby

texts.es:
Mayra Mariby L. V. tiene 30 anos de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 9 anos.  Reside en Colonia Los Angeles en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras.  Mayra comenzo vendiendo ropa usada, actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida y sigue con la ropa para obtener mejores ganancias.  Trabaja en el domicilio y la ropa la vende en el mayoreo.  Tambien hace turnos en el hospital donde trabaja como servicio social como esta estudiando enfermeria.  

Mayra usara el prestamo para la legalizacion de un terreno el la Colonia Los Angeles.  Su Papa se le regalo un solar y quiere quiere hacer su casa para que su hija viva mejor.  Una vez que la terreno esta legalizado podra solicitar prestamo mas grande para surtir y ampliar su negocio.  

Su sueno es tener legalizado su propiedad y que el negocio valla creciendo para obtener mejores ganancias y atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mayra Mariby L. V. is 30 years old, single, and has a 9 year old child. She resides in the Los Angeles subdivision of Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras. Mayra started selling used clothing, but she now sells food and continues with her clothing business for extra income. She works from home and sells clothes at the wholesale market. Mayra also works shifts at the hospital as a community service volunteer since she is studying nursing.

She will use this loan to register her property. Her father gave her a plot of land and she wants to build a house so that her daughter can live better. As soon as her property is registered, Mayra will request larger loan so that she can restock and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to have her property legally registered

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari sari (general store) business.  She lives in  Brgy Zone III, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  sari sari  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 2,500 Php. 

Jocelyn is now borrowing PHP 9000 so that she could increase the working capital of sari sari store. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jocelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  'Dungganon' way. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives with her husband and five children in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. She is a very talented lady. She prepares embroidered clothes for her neighbors to earn an income. She is particularly excellent with her hand-made embroidery. With her art she crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes and attracts more customers with her work. 

She is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints. Both of her sons work. The older one sells shawls and the younger one sells clothes by going door to door in communities. 

Her husband runs a clothiing shop in the market. He buys the clothes from cities Multan and Lahore. These days her husband is facing the problem of low inventory and is unable to fulfill the requirements of the customers. Therefore, she has applied for a loan for the 3rd time from Asasah to financially help her husband. 

With the loan he will buy clothes in bulk for selling. This will not only cut the cost of traveling but also he will be able to buy the clothes on discount as a result of bulk purchasing. Shamim is hopeful that this investment will bring happiness to her family and that her family’s standard of living will improve.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the village of Rizal. He is 43 and widowed with three adult children. To make a living, Jose owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2007, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and cassava

loans.name: Rene De Jesús

texts.es:
El joven R. Hernández es un transportista que vive en el Municipio del Viejo.
El va a utilizar el crédito para comprarle 06 llantas al bus que viaja desde Chinandega a León y Viceversa y necesito tenerlo bien enllantado y en buenas condiciones.
Este Joven vive con su esposa y manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido con CEPRODEL,  por brindarle esta oportunidad de tener créditos y  espera trabajar por mucho  tiempo con la institución.
texts.en:
Mr. R. H. is a chauffeur that lives in the township of Viejo. He will use the loan to purchase 6 tires for the bus that travels from Chinandega to Leon and back, as he needs to have tires in good conditions.

This young man has a wife and says that he is grateful with CEPRODEL, for giving him the opportunity to access the loan and wishes to work with this institution for a long time.

loans.use: Buy 6 tires for a bus

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia, de 38 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora; convive con Oswaldo, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos Marilu de 18, Wilfredo de 15 y Genesis de 1 año, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vista Hermosa (sierra peruana). Para mantener a su familia ella se dedica a varias actividades; una de ellas es la agricultura; en los terrenos de cultivo que le heredaron sus padres, todos los fines de semana los dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos de papa. Pero lo que más le gusta a Eugenia es trabajar en su renovadora de calzados, que está ubicada en zona céntrica de su ciudad, ya tiene 19 años dedicándose a ello, y constantemente recibe visitas de sus clientes, ya que su trabajo es muy bueno, más adelante está planeando comparar materiales de construcción para edificar su casa; en su terreno propio, que tiene en la ciudad; para que pueda trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y como miembro activo de banco comunal, está muy contenta de poder compartir sus experiencias de éxito. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará materiales que solicita para su renovadora de calzados.
texts.en:
Eugenia, age 38, is an unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives with her life partner, 42 year old Oswaldo.  They have four children, but they only live with three of them.  Marilu is 18, Wilfredo is 15, and Genesis is 1 year old.  They live in their own house in Vista Hermosa (in the Peruvian mountains).

She does various activities to support her family.  One of those activities is farming on the land she inherited from her parents.  Every week-end she takes care of her potato crop.  However, what Eugenia likes the most is working in her shoe repair shop, which in in the central area of the city.  She has been doing that for 19 years.  She has a continual flow of customers because her work is very good.  Later, she plans on buying construction material to build a house on the land that she has in the city.  That way it will be easier for her to get about.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  As an active member of her communal bank, she is very happy to be able to share their successful experiences.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy materials for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the efficiency of her shoe repair business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia C. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Eugenia is married and has one school-aged and one adult child. To make a living, Eugenia plants and harvests corn for sale. Eugenia has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Eugenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia had successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Eugenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Robertha Lisseth

texts.es: Robertha Lisseth es una madre de familia de 32 años que reside junto a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos. Robertha tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general pues ofrece calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general y sus ventas los realiza a diario  en su domicilio y de manera ambulante sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona, tiene varios años de experiencia en este rubro, y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda cuenta con una clientela fiel. Robertha desea ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas para percibir mayores ganancias, este es el motivo de su crédito para la compra de materia prima. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia.
texts.en: Robertha Lisseth is a 32 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and 2 children.  Her business is selling general merchandise such as footwear, cosmetics and clothes.  She sells her items daily in her home and in the streets.  Her main customers are the inhabitants of the district.  She has several years' experience in this trade and owing to the quality of the products which she offers and the good service which she provides, she has a number of loyal customers.  Robertha would like to expand her business and increase her sales to make more profit.  This is her reason for requesting this loan which will be used to buy raw materials.  She is quite a responsible woman who is devoted to her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 47 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snack foods and canned goods in the local community. She also buys and sells coconuts. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 9000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Amalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 28 years old single and resides in Binangonan, which is located in the Province of Rizal. She has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and gain greater revenue. 

Verginia’s dream is to have a fully fledged expanded sari-sari (variety) store business.  She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true and hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of living, lifting her out of poverty.

Verginia is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business efforts.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and basic household necessities.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Helen is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Anorkhon has sold women’s clothes. A married mother with two children, she is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Anorkhon is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Anorkhon has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 6,000 TJS to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Anorkhon plans to continue enlarging her business and improving her family's financial situation.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to develop her business

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en:
Nyambayar, 45, is married and lives with his wife and six children in Darhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in a small house with a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, next to it on the outskirts of the city. They had to build the 'ger' as they are a big family and the house that they own is too small for 8 people. Two of  Nyambayar's children go to university while three others attend secondary school. 

Nyambayar started his clothes retail trading business in 1991 with a working capital of 500,000 MNT by renting an outdoor stall at a local market in Darhan.  In ten years' time, he has managed to enlarge his  business by operating lingerie sales and has increased his working capital 3 times over. He wants to rent an extra stall and expand his business by operating a clothing trading business. 

Nyambayar is a gentle and hard-working person who says, "My desperate wish is to be able to provide my children with the opportunity to get a good education so that in the future they can have a good life. And I would also like to expand my business." He is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to bring in more goods for sale due to Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian Traditional New Year, as everyone buys gifts for each other.

loans.use: To bring in more goods

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh T. P. was born in 1954. She has 4 children( two sons and two daughters). She raises ducks and grows rice and right now she  has 400 ducks. Her husband was retired. They have a monhly income of about 5.000.000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy food for her ducks.

loans.use: to buy food for her ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils, plates and a few bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una viuda D. 70 años D. edad.  Tiene hijos mayores que ya no viven con ella. Vive en su casa propia en el distrito D. Nueva Arica, ubicado a más D. 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque.

DesD. hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a la venta D. animales al público en general en el mercado local. Ha pedido un préstamo para comprar más animales para su negocio. Desea aumentar su venta para lograr mayores ingresos y usarlos para pagar gastos personales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles. Simona sigue siendo muy trabajadora y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Simona, 70, is a widow.  She has adult children that no longer live with her.  She lives in her own house in the Nueva Arica district located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

For over 20 years she’s been selling animals to the general public and in the local market.  She has asked for a loan to buy more animals for her business.  She wants to increase sales in order to earn higher income to use for personal expenses.

Because of this she has felt it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Simona continues to be very hard working and has very good personal and work references.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Rosemonde

texts.en:
Rosemonde was born in 1972 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She now lives in the Houeto district with her husband Frederic and their five children.

For the past 20 years Rosemonde has run a general store out of her home, selling a range of items from food to charcoal. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Her ambition is to buy her own piece of land. She cites her welcoming nature and her dynamism as her strengths in business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock for her store

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg is 45 year old widow and lives with her two daughters, aged 21 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her youngest daughter is a student while her oldest daughter helps with her business. 

Enkhtsetseg supports her family by operating a shoe retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia with help from her daughter.

When she first began her business in 2002, she was a contracted seller of a local shoes factory and she didn't have her own working capital. As result of her hard work, today she has 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at her stall. During the past nine years, she has gained a lot of experience and she has been able to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to purchase shoes for spring. 

She wants to improve her business with this loan and then be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for spring

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos remojados como moraya, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de productos remojados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos remojados al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qorilazo communal bank, located in Cusco.

Her name is Elena. She is 38 years old and married, with 4 kids. She alternates her everyday activities with the sale of products such as flour and quinoa. She works from 9am to 6pm. With this job she is able to help her children get ahead. She would like to increase her business. She is requesting funds to purchase products wholesale. 

The member is very happy to receive this loan, and agrees to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Aunty Aba Sarah

texts.en: Aunty Aba Sarah B. is a hairdresser at Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Aba Sarah has been a hairdresser for three years. She helps her husband take care of the home. She needs a hair dryer. Her loan will be used to purchase a hair dyer and creams and hair products to use on customers' hair. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better place.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and creams and hair products.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a hardworking thirty-year-old married man.  He lives with his two children in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole  breadwinner for the family.  His desire is to buy land and expand his farm.  

For three years, Deo has been providing motorcycle transport for a living.  He started as a street vendor and later bought a motorcycle.  He has challenges in the poor road network that causes many accidents.  His desire is to buy at least four motorcycles so as to spread his risks.  Deo needs the loan money to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Kitinda Traders Group

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Dominic is happily married with four kids. They are a happy-go-lucky family and love to get together for reunions, especially on the weekends. To support his family, Dominic relies on income from his pub business in Ntungamo. At his pub, he sells a variety of both hard and soft beverages. This means he needs to restock to be able to meet the demands of patrons who frequent his pub. At times, though, he is so inundated by the demand of his clients that he runs short on supplies. That means he has to dig deep into his profit reserves to restock. He reckons this loan will come in really handy. Formerly, Dominic had a hand in an agro sales business. This hardworking man says his business generates 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) weekly. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks to resell at his pub.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell at his pub

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker; his income is $4 per day. She has four children, three are working in a factory and the other is working as a construction worker; each of them can earn $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cement, sand, and bricks to repair her house. She plans to send her daughters to study tailoring and will open a small tailoring shop at her house for them. She hopes that after she receives this loan she will have a better house, with a toilet and bathroom, in which to stay and feel more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her house

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Carlos Fernando es soltero se dedica a trabajar con instructor de refrigeración,  es una persona que se ha caracterizado  por ser honrada, responsable,   con buenos valores y principios  morales. 

Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar  crédito para ser invertido en compra de herramienta de  equipo para refrigeración para mantenimiento de reparación de refrigeración para trabajar por cuenta propia y mejora  su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Fernando is from the city of Managua. He is single and he works with a refrigeration instructor. He is an honorable and responsible person with good values and moral principles. 

He came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy tools for use in repairing refrigeration so he can work on his own and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase tools used in refrigerator repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Luzviminda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from sugarcane farming.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is 25 years old, married and supports two people. 

He has been practicing farming for seven years.
 
He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and married to Jeniffer. The couple is blessed with one child. For the past 18 months, David has run a boda-boda (motorbike transport) business. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. David works very hard. 

David is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy spare parts, repair his motorbike, and purchase a helmet. He will use the extra profit from his loan to educate his child. David hopes to provide a wonderful and stable financial future for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, repair his motorbike, and purchase a helmet

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia, viven unión libre con el señor  Guillermo  y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes aun están a su responsabilidad, ella vive en un lugar en donde las personas hablan la lengua tzotzil.

    Se dedica a bordar y elaborar camisas de mantas,  y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  más material y poder  trabajar más días a  la semana, en esta actividad lleva  veinte años y cuatros meses en la que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello apoya a su esposo con los ingreso de la  casa.

    Su importación por esta actividad fue por si sola ya que en ese lugar donde ella vive todas las personas se dedican a bordar y costuras camisas y blusas de manta y le gusta mucho trabajar con ello.

    Su más grande deseo es que como esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda  continuar trabajando para  apoyar a sus hijos dándole una buena educación y con el tiempo terminen una profesión.
texts.en:
Sra. Cecilia lives with her common-law husband Sr. Guillermo and their five children who are under their responsibility. She resides in a place where the people speak the Tzotzil language.

Cecilia produces embroidered shirts and blankets. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more materials so that she can work more days each week. Cecilia has been practicing her trade for 20 years and 4 months. She says that she has done very well and has the support of her husband with the household income.

This business is important to her because she can work alone. She also lives in a place where everyone knows how to embroider and sew shirts, blouses, and blankets. Cecilia enjoys her work tremendously.

Her greatest wish for her small business and this is loan is to be able to continue working so that she can support her children and provide them a good education. In time, she hopes that they will pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy blankets and thread for making embroideries.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, desD. hace 4 años se dedica a la venta D. pupusas, hasta la fecha ha sido un negocio estable, apoyada por su esposo y sus hijos.
Ella solicita su segundo préstamo para la mejora del negocio e invertirlo en materiales D. la pupuseria, papel, salsas, maíz, aceite, gas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar sus ventas, produciendo más.
El propósito D. ella es tener el apoyo financiero, para poder desarrollar el negocio, mantenerse siempre con sus clientes y estar en armonía con su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and her two children. For four years she has sold pupusas (tortillas filled with cheese and other fillings, a specialty of El Salvador). Up to this point it has been a stable business, supported by her husband and children.

She is asking for her second loan to improve her business and to invest in supplies for the pupseria: paper, sauces, corn, and oil. This purchase will help her improve her sales, producing more.

Her intention is to have financial support in order to be able to develop the business, to always keep her clients, and to be in harmony with her family.

loans.use: to purchase paper, sauces, corn, oil, and gas fuel for the pupuseria.

loans.name: Teresa Petita

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años, vive con su familia en Otavalo. Teresa se describe como una persona muy trabajadora, alegre, activa y le gusta llevarse con todas las personas.

Trabaja con una hija en su tienda de víveres. Trabaja con Fodemi por años consecutivos el actual crédito que solicita es para abastecer su tienda de víveres y también para la compra de un frigorífico para la carne, inversión que le servirá para aumentar su producción, sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos que le servirá para dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio para poder dar trabajo a personas que necesiten y también seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 40, is married and has three children who are 22, 19 and 5 years old.  She lives with her family in Otavalo.  Teresa describes herself as a hardworking, cheerful, active person who likes to get along well with everyone.

She works with her daughter in a food store.  She’s been working with Fodemi for consecutive years.  The current loan is to stock her store with foodstuffs and also to buy a refrigerator for the meat.  This investment will help her increase production and sales and thus her income that will help for her children’s education.

Her dream is to have a larger business to employ people who need work and also to continue to provide education for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and a refrigerator for the meats in her store.

loans.name: Sikilo Ouest Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sikilo   est né depuis la création du banc villageois portant le même nom en 1998. Il est composé de 27 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adama,(assise en troisième de la  gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle vendeuse d’articles divers au marché de son quartier.  Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour enfants en vu des les revendre durant la rentrée des classes.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Sikilo group was established after the creation in 1998 of the banc villageois which has the same name. The group is made up of 27 women who all live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Adama, (seated, third from the left) is the group's leader. She is 59 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. For more than five years she has been selling various items at the local market. With this loan she plans to buy children's clothes to re-sell at the beginning of the school year. The profits will allow her to help her husband in paying for food and education.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to re-sell at the beginning of the school year.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a married woman. Her husband works as a driver. Sara operates a charcoal business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years and her primary customers are charcoal retailers. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenges as seasonality and transportation and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Sara will use the Kes 40,000 loan to build a shelter for her business and add more charcoal sacks. Sara aspires to have several charcoal stands in the future. She joined Yehu to gain access to working capital.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her business and add more charcoal sacks.

loans.name: Naftary

texts.en:
Naftary is a resident of Nkubu Town, Central Kenya where he practices farming and works as a clerk in a local coffee factory. He has had eight straight years in farming and currently produces milk, maize and coffee, which go to the local market. He is married with two children who are 5 and 3 years old. The oldest is already schooling.

Naftary has requested a loan of 78,750 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will improve his family living standards and help him educate his children. He adds that he plans to buy more dairy cows to expand the business.

Naftary, however, notes that animal diseases are a challenge to the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aouth Guenold

texts.fr:
Client de 23 ans, celibataire sans enfant, il se lance dans la menuiserie après son brevet d'études  techniques.Ayant deja beneficie de plusieurs cycles de pret, il a agrandi son atelier et a un petit atelier d'exposition des meubles, il a rembourse avec succes et il a favorablement epargne.Ses revenus ont largement augmentes , il a en moyenne 300.000 frs a 450.000frs par mois.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va continuera agrandir son atelier en achetant des planches comme les bastings, des lattes, contre plaques, des éponges , des tissus en velours et des boites de colles.
Il use des nouvelles  stratégies  pour faire avancer son activité, il fabrique des tableaux, des tabourets, des pouffes et des tables de cuisines , des tires lires, des tables a manger et des fauteuils sur commande  qu'il vend a tout instant a des prix favorables. 
Pour le futur , il a l'ambition d'être un grand entrepreneur,et commencer avec des cours d'apprentissage de menuiserie aux jeunes défavorisés.
texts.en:
This client is 23 years old, single, with no children. He entered the profession of furniture making after obtaining his technical studies certificate. 

As he has already enjoyed several previous loans, he has been able to expand his workshop and he has a small furniture showroom. The loans were properly repaid, and he has been able to save. 

His income has increased substantially, now averaging 300,000 to 450,000 francs/month. With this new loan, he will continue to expand his workshop by purchasing supplies such planks, slats, plywood, sponges, velour fabric and boxes of glue. Using new strategies to advance his business, he makes trays, stools, ottomans, kitchen tables, money banks, dining tables and armchairs to order, which he sells at competitive prices. 

In the future, he plans to become a successful entrepreneur, starting with offering apprenticeships to at-risk youth.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plywood, nails, glue, sponge, velour material

loans.name: Shirikisho Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Shirikisho group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Moses was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Moses will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Shirikisho group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Moses is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a 44-year-old married woman with 11 children. She resides at Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Silveria owns and operates a business venture selling "kangkong" (swamp cabbage or water spinach) in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business 14 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 with her business. 

Silveria is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year, and she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to purchase more kangkong to sell. In the future, Silveria wants to make improvements of her house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase more kangkong to sell.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Hernestina; ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado,la socia tarbaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda ,mas grande de venta de frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Hernestina is single and has one child. She continues to manage her business of selling vegetables and fruits at the market. Hernestina works from 8am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. She dreams of having a large store where she can sell fruits and vegetables. Hernestina is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her business.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro Jesús tiene 28 años de edad, es una persona que disfruta ver películas en sus tiempos libres, en la actualidad el vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.	

Pedro se dedica a brindar el servicio de mantenimiento y soporte de computadores, como otro ingreso, en las mañanas se dedica a atender en una cabina de internet, esto lo ayuda a tener un poco más de ingresos. Él ha estudiado en la universidad lo que le ha permitido aprender todo lo necesario para desarrollarse en su trabajo.
En promedio atiende 2 clientes a diario, esto le permite obtener una ganancia de S/.30, en algunas ocasiones puede ganar hasta S/.60, dependiendo de lo que le soliciten sus clientes o también de la cantidad de personas que atienda.

El préstamo Kiva lo ayudará a poder comprar herramientas y un disco duro que le permita tener más variedad de programas en su computador y solo de esta manera logrará otorgar un mayor y mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con esta ayuda el podrá continuar incentivándose para poder adquirir un local propio y así atender a muchos más clientes y con este nuevo ingreso de dinero desea poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Pedro Jesús is 28, and a person who enjoys watching movies in his free time. Currently, he lives and works in Ica, Peru. 

Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours to the south of Lima, the country's capital. It is celebrated by Peruvians as the "The Land of Sun.

It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), and for its production of grapes, asparagus and olives. It is perhaps best know as the source of Peru's traditional national drink, Pisco. The client's home and company is located in this warm and dry climate.	

Pedro provides computer maintenance and support services. As another source of income, he looks after an internet booth in the mornings. This helps him to have a little more income. He has studied at university, which has allowed him to learn everything necessary to develop his business. 

On average he serves two customers daily. This allows him to earn 30 soles, and on some occasions he can earn up to 60 soles, depending on what his customers ask for, and also on the number of people he serves. 

The Kiva loan will help him buy tools and a disk drive that will allow him to have a greater variety of programs on his computer. Only in this way will he be able to provide more and better service to his customers.

This help will give him encouragement to keep working toward having his own shop, so that he can serve many more customers. With this new income he wants to be able to have his own house.

loans.use: To buy tools and a hard drive.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pora surge gracias a la intervención de una de las miembros, la cual contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. Actualmente están en el Octavo Ciclo, con 11 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable. Ellas desean que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras.
Myriam es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien se esfuerza día a día por su familia. Ella comenta que hace un tiempo se dedica a la venta de bebidas y gracias a sus buenos precios y a la variedad que tiene ya ha podido formarse una buena clientela. Ella dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por ayudar a su familia y darles lo mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, sidras y demás tipos de bebidas, con las cuales podrá surtirse para sus clientes, ya que esta en tiempos de mucha venta, como ser navidad y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Kuña Pora Group came together thanks to one of its members, who contacted her neighbors and friends to form a communal bank in their area. They are now in their eighth cycle and have 11 members. They are a group known in their neighborhood for their unity, solidarity, and responsibility. They all hope that they can get ahead and support one another through their work together.

Myriam is a very hard-working and spirited woman who struggles day in and day out for her family. She says that for some time now she has been selling beverages, and that thanks to her good prices and variety she has been able to develop a good client base. She says that all of her efforts are to help her family and to make their lives better. She is requesting this loan to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, ciders, and other types of drinks, so that she can stock up for her customers during the high selling period of Christmas and New Years.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, ciders, and other types of drinks to resell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 24 years to 26 years. She describes herself as responsible and jovial. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge as shortages of charcoal due to government restrictions on the cutting of trees for charcoal production. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Sofia's business goal is to be a large-scale supplier of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paul Vincent who works abroad and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Victoria maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference is the profit that dealers earn as their income.  Victoria's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 from sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Victoria is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Victoria hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Estrellas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS II” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tejido de busos, taller de cerrajería, venta de dulces, tejido de dulces, panadería, tejido de chalinas, chapistas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirió recientemente de un conocido que le vendió el negocio armado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tornillos, fierros y palas) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago con su grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrellas II” (Stars II) is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Lidia serves as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling food, knitting sweatshirts, managing a metalwork shop, selling sweets, knitting baby clothes, managing a bakery, knitting scarves, and operating an auto body shop.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Lidia.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house.  Lidia currently has a hardware store.  She gained knowledge about this business after acquiring it recently from an acquaintance who sold it to her fully stocked.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying screws, braces, and shovels.  She acquires her inventory from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells these products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Lidia is married and has four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lida said that she enjoys the payment meetings with her group.

loans.use: to buy screws, braces, and shovels.

loans.name: Lolonyo

texts.en:
Mr. A. K. Lolonyo was born in July 1963; he is the eldest son of a family of twelve (12) children. As his parents died, he had to drop out of school in order to work and feed his brothers and sisters. Despite his courage and boldness, he early got worn out by still rudimentary agriculture. Later he got a job as a salesman in a Lomé shop. Thanks to his little savings and chiefly to the support of his wife, he opened a little cement and hardware shop. But as he does not have enough of financial resources, he is obliged to get supplied at retailers’, which does not allow him to make profits large enough to take care of his wife and five (05) children and some of his brothers and sisters who still depend on him. As he has no adequate capital, he often finds himself in shortage and temporarily closes the shop while demand remains permanent. To stabilize his business and meet market needs, Mr. A. needs a credit of $850 to directly order his goods from the production plant and constantly have a sufficient amount of goods..

Né en Juillet 1963, Monsieur A. K. Lolonyo est le fils aîné d’une famille de douze (12) enfants. A la mort de ses parents, il a dû abandonner les études pour travailler et nourrir ses frères et sœurs. Malgré son courage et sa bravoure, il est très vite épuisé par une agriculture encore rudimentaire. Il s’est fait engager dans une boutique à Lomé et plus tard, grâce à sa petite économie et surtout avec le soutien de sa femme, il ouvre lui-même une boutique de vente de ciment et des produits de quincaillerie. Mais ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers, il est obligé à chaque fois de s’approvisionner chez les détaillants. Ce qui ne lui laisse pas une marge bénéficiaire suffisante lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses cinq (05) enfants en plus de certains de ses frères et sœurs qui dépendent toujours de lui. Faute de fonds de commerce adéquat, il est régulièrement en rupture de stock et obligé de fermer momentanément la boutique pendant que la demande reste permanente. Pour stabiliser son commerce et répondre au besoin de son marché, Monsieur A. a besoin d’un crédit de $850 pour passer directement ses commandes à l’usine de fabrication du ciment et de disposer constamment et suffisamment de stock sécurité.

loans.use: To buy cement directly from the production plant

loans.name: Zinhoé

texts.en:
A married mother of 2, Ms. Zinhoé K. is 44 years of age. She currently lives with her family in Agbanakin. The weaving of mats constitutes her main income-generating activity, which she performs with passion. Difficult and exhausting but quite profitable, the business provides a meager income for Ms. K.. She is asking for $500 to obtain necessary raw materials at a lower cost, thereby increasing production with the proper equipment. Acquiring these raw materials and equipment will make her job easier and increase production, as well as the income Ms. K. needs to bring her family out of its current state of absolute poverty.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame K. Zinhoé est âgée de 44 ans. Elle vit actuellement à Agbanakin avec sa famille. Le tressage de nattes constitue pour elle la principale activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce avec passion. Difficile et fatiguant mais très rentable, cette activité procure de maigres revenus à Madame K.. Dans le souci de disposer de matières premières nécessaires à moindre coût pour augmenter la production avec des matériels appropriés, elle sollicite $500. L’acquisition de ces matériels et matières premieres faciliteront le travail et feront augmenter la production et naturellement les revenus dont a besoin Madame K. pour sortir sa famille de la misère absolue actuelle.

loans.use: Acquisition of equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Zeynal

texts.en: Zeynal N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan, where he is currently living with his wife and two children. Eight years ago he stared a small food market near the bazaar in the city of Aghsu and has watched it flourish. He sells dry goods, tea, carbonated beverages and snack candy, among other things. Zeynal is requesting a loan from Normicro to increase his product variety to include fresh products, such as fruit and vegetables, for purchase.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 57-year-old mother of 3, Hersena (22), Antonio (18), Roberto (19) and wife to Gilberto Mosquea. She sells all sorts of miscellaneous products for everyday life including clothes, shoes, creams, hair products, hats, etc. With her loan she is going to buy more products and she hopes to eventually be able to open up her own boutique with all of her products, because as of now she is selling the items out of her own house. She believes this expansion will enable her to improve her family's quality of life and that she will be able to help her children get started in a business.

Note: Arsenia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $900 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita belongs to the communal bank "El Alto Mayo" and is dedicated to selling groceries and grains. Her shop is located at the Grau Market in Rioja, San Martin. Lita is 32 years old, married and has a 10-year-old son, her daily inspiration at home and at work.
