She attracts clients thanks to her charisma, and also because she treats them cordially and has a well-stocked store. Lita is requesting an $800 loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of four sacks of rice, four sacks of sugar, 24 liters of oils, grains, peas, beans, corn, drinks, soap and other products that her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lita pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Alto Mayo", se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y granos, su local está ubicado en el Mercado Grau de la Localidad de Rioja en el Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un niño de 10 años, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante en sus actividades diarias de casa y de su negocio. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlas con cordialidad y tener un negocio surtido. El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/ 2,500.00 soles (US$ 790.00) lo invertirá en la compra de 4 sacos de arroz, 4 socos de azúcar, 24 litros de aceite de diferentes marcas, granos como menestras (sacos de 50Kg.), alberja partida, frejol blanco, frejol amarillo, maíz cuzco, maíz para cancha, canario ( 01 saco de cada uno), jaboncillos y jabones (01 caja), refrescos en cajitas pequeñas (04 docenas), conservas de pescado (04 cajas de diferentes marcas), y otros productos más que los clientes lo requieran.

loans.use: Purchase high-demand products

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from Lahore, a fast growing metropolis. I am married with six children. I make jewelry tassels and my husband operates a ‘rent a car’ business. My eldest son also helps him in his business. Earlier my husband used to sell fruits and vegetables in the local food market but then he had to give up this business due to the very small profit ratio. His current business is doing well. Now he needs to add on a new car to his store so that he can promptly respond to a large number of clients and generate more profits. Please lend him the required money which he will add to his savings so that he can buy a new car.

loans.use: Buy a new car for the "rent a car" business

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Mrs. Benedicta A. is 42 yrs old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City. She sells yams and dried fish; she learned this business for 2 months and then started her own in 1996. According to her, when given a loan she will be able to buy more dried fish to be sold. She is a LAPO member (the lender).

loans.use: To buy more dried fish, crayfish & yams to sell

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
We find Benita and her happy husband, Pablo, proudly showing us their beautiful clay ceramic works. The inherited this beautiful art from their humble parents, who were the best artisans and clayworkers in their small town, Pukará. Now this pair lovingly continues the same work, beginning their daily work at 8:00 in the morning and finishing at 6:00 in the evening, every day of the week. Then when they have a large quantity of products, they sell them in the markets in the states of Arequipa, Cuzco, Puno and Lima. Benita and Pablo wish to offer a profession to their four children, who shortly will be starting their university studies. In order to make their dreams reality they need greater income from their work and therefore they are asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of raw material (clay) and thereby increase their production volume of their beautiful and incomparable objects.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Benita y su alegre esposo Pablo, mostrando orgullosamente sus hermosos trabajos de cerámica en arcilla. Ellos heredaron este bello arte de sus humildes padres, quienes fueron los mejores artesanos y alfareros de su pueblito Pukará. Ahora esta pareja gustosamente desempeña el mismo oficio, ellos inician su labor diaria a las 8:00 de la mañana culminándola a las 6.00 de la tarde, durante todos los días de la semana; luego de contar con gran cantidad de productos se dedican a venderlos en los mercados de los departamentos de Arequipa, Cuzco, Puno y Lima.El deseo de Benita y Pablo es ofrecerles una profesión a sus cuatro hijos, quienes dentro de muy poco tiempo estarán siguiendo sus estudios superiores. Para concretar sus anhelos requieren obtener mayor ingreso con sus trabajos es por eso que hacen la solicitud de un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de materia prima (arcilla) de esa manera aumentar el volumen de producción de sus hermosos e incomparables adornos.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Kikooza G(Vi) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Prossy N..  She is currently in the business of making local brew and is requesting a loan of UGX 600000 to expand her brew business.  Prossy is 28 years old.  With the profits from her loan, Prossy hopes to be able to start a poultry business. Prossy is joined in her small group by Irene M., Betty N., Margret N., and Immaculate K..  Irene M. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 700000 to purchase more matooke for sale.  Betty N. is currently in the business of local brew and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000 to increase inventory.  Margret N. is currently in the business of local brew and is requesting a loan of UGX 200000 to re-invest in the brew business.  Immaculate K. is currently in the business of local brew and is requesting a loan of UGX 800000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the brew business

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude D.  business is the production of food and its sales.  She is married and has 4 children. She plans on increasing her production and sale but currently lacks adequate funds.

She is requesting a $525 loan as additional capital to buy more food stuffs and other food items for her food production.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs and other food items for food production.

loans.name: La Franbruesa Group

texts.en:
Ana M. is a lovely young woman who lives with her four children and husband in the town of Los Alcarrizzos, a suburb of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has started a small business providing public transportation to her community members. Ana is requesting this loan so that she can improve the service she provides to her clients, making her car safer, more comfortable, and more fuel efficient. With the profits from her business, she hopes to begin saving more money, working towards realizing her dream of one day returning to school so that she can become college-educated; as well, she hopes to be able to help send her children to college. She says that it is often difficult to advance economically in Los Alcarrizzos, but with hard work and this loan, she believes she can improve her life and business, one day at a time.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Ana M. herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase car parts and pay maintenance costs.

loans.name: Fatma's Tubumisifu Nmissil Group

texts.en:
Fatma, age 45, is a widow who cares for her 3 children, ages 18, 16, and 8 years old. She makes a living selling charcoal and works from 7am to 10pm daily. From this business, which started 2 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $45.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She is a member of the Tubumisifu Nmillil loan group and will be sharing this loan with Mwamali, another group member. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminatou B. was born on November 3, 1968 in Mango, in the county of Oti in the far north of Togo. She is married and the mother of three children. She has lived in the neighborhood called Nukafu since 1995 and her primary business is the sale of rice and peanut fritters. In the beginning, she made and sold only peanut fritters, but with her first loan of US$ 725 from WAGES, she added the sale of rice to her initial business.

The loan she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 9 sacks of rice and 2 sacks of peanuts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Aminatou est née le 03 novembre 1968 à Mango dans la préfecture de l’Oti à l’extrême nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite dans le quartier de Nukafu depuis 1995 et a pour activité principale la vente du riz et de beignet d’arachide. A ses début, elle ne fabriquait et vendait que des beignets d’arachides mais avec le premier d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA qu’elle a obtenu auprès de WAGES, elle a ajouté la vente du riz a son activité initiale.

Le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter neuf (9) sacs de riz et deux (2) sacs d’arachides.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and peanuts

Achat de riz et d'arachides

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
Maria is married with three children, she lives in a well known neighbourhood of this city. She has a well-stocked grocery store that she runs with a lot of effort and with the help of her husband the business stays afloat.

Her children help her with house work so that she can look after her business better. Her husband drives a small bus and in this way helps his spouse. Maria deals with the household expenses and those of her children, and uses what her husband earns to pay the other bills and buy things for their home.

She is a very hard-working person and has shown herself to be very responsible with financial commitments. She is looking for a new loan to buy merchandise and in this way to increase her business with their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria esta Casada con 3 hijos, ella vive en un barrio muy conocido de esta ciudad. Tiene una despensa muy bien surtida que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido salieron adelante.

Los hijos le ayudan en las tareas de la casa para que ella pueda cuidar mejor el negocio. Su marido hoy día trabaja como taxista en el micro centró y así ayuda a la esposa. María se encarga de los gastos de la casa y los hijos, con lo que gana su marido pagan otras cuentas y compran algunas cosas para la casa.

Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y demuestra ser responsable con sus compromisos financieros. Hoy ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para adquirir mercaderías y de este modo aumentar sus ingresos con sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of rice flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih, 28 years old, is a single man. He lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Nazih owns a small shop where he sells cell phones, accessories and perfumes. He needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase more cellphones, which will allow him to improve and expand his business.

Nazih is a very ambitious man. He is willing to ensure better living conditions for his parents and hopes to earn enough money to get married and raise a family.

This is the first time Nazih has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Nila Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is 35 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a hardworking woman who is always looking for opportunities to develop her family, and she does this by way of her own business which she set up 2 years ago. She has a small store in her home, taking advantage of the opportunity that her house is located in one of the main streets in her neighborhood. Her stores offers daily staples, including all kinds of groceries. She also promotes her crops in that she and her husband are excellent farmers. This has assured Virginia more income for the economy of her home, which has brought her much satisfaction. She is aware of the current agricultural situation; for this reason, she has decided to open this shop to improve her economic situation.

As a mother, Virginia wants to give the best to her 4 children who are studying.

She is asking for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of store merchandise and farming activities.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos. Es una mujer trabajadora que busca siempre las oportunidades de desarrollo de su familia y esto lo hace a través de su propio negocio que instaló hace 2 años, se trata de una pequeña tienda en su casa, aprovecha la oportunidad de que su casa está ubicada en una de las calles principales de su zona, donde ofrece todos los días productos de primera necesidad, todo tipo de abarrotes y también aprovecha para promocionar el producto de sus cosechas, ya que ella y su esposo son agricultores por excelencia, es así que Virginia asegura un ingreso más para la economía de su hogar, la cual le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, ella es consciente de la actual situación de la agricultura, por la que ha decidido abrir esta tienda para la mejora de su situación económica. Como madre que es, Virginia quiere dar lo mejor a sus 4 hijos que están estudiando.

Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda y otra parte será invertida en sus actividades agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store and farmland

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. is 45 year old. She is divorced and the mother of six children. She is a local manufacturer of soaps. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She also sells palm oil for cooking. She is not able to produce soap in large quantities because of the lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to improve her income so she can support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called St. John Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Marry is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Mary is a farmer. Mary works on her farm every day of the week from 6:30 am to 4:00 pm. She cultivates pumpkin, corn, and other vegetables. Mary lives in Ketu, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is asking for a loan of N120,000 ($1025) to purchase pumpkin seeds to sow and insecticides to control pests. Mary says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pumpkin seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a brindar servicio de llamadas por celular de forma ambulante, desde hace 4 años, en los cuales ha sabido aprender de su negocio, los clientes son numerosos, ya que Yovana cuenta con un gran carisma que hace que tenga sus “caseritos”, clientes muy fieles a su negocio. El negocio anda muy bien, por ello Yovana quiere expandirlo comprando otro equipo para hacerlo trabajar. Las dificultades radican en tener que permanecer caminando y no tener estabilidad en realizar su trabajo, lo cual se le hace cansado, pero Yovana sabe que son pequeñas cosas que tiene que aprender a superar si quiere progresar. Ella se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, comprometida a ser responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yovana is 22 years old, is single and lives in her parents' house. She has worked as a traveling cellular telephone call provider for the past 4 years, in which she was come to know her business. Her clients are numerous as Yovana has great carisma that makes her have her “caseritos”, clients who are very loyal to her business. The business is going very well which is why Yovana wants to expand it buying another telephone to put it to work. The difficulties are having to keep walking and not have stability in carrying out her job, which makes her tired, but Yovana knows that these are little things that she has to learn if she wants to progress. She is in her first loan with Prisma Microfinance and is commited to being responsible and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of another cellular telephone

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Evangelina S. ha sido acreditado de FVP ya pago puntualmente seis créditos alguno de ellos fueron para mejoramiento de sus vivienda y otros de salud. 
Ella necesita una cocineta para poder guardar su despensa ya que es madre soltera y vive sola, porque sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar su cocineta y planea pagarlo con su trabajo como cocinara en un comedor de una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Evangelina S. has been accredited by FVP as she has already re-paid six loans punctually, some of which were for housing improvements and others for healthcare. She needs a kitchenette to be able to keep her supplies as she is a single mother and lives alone because her children already have their own families. She is requesting this loan to buy her kitchenette and plans to pay for it with her work as a cook in a factory cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a kitchenette

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria trabaja como costurera juntamente con su esposo; confecciona chamarras que son comercializadas en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta actividad constituye su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja, de los cuales dos están en la escuela y la mayor en la universidad estatal. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción y así terminar la construcción de un cuarto para la hija mayor, ya que actualmente comparten un dormitorio con sus padres y hermanitos.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica a Maria para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria works as a seamstress alongside her husband. She makes jackets that are sold in the city of Cochabamba. This activity constitutes their main fountain of income with which they cover the support of their three children who depend on the couple and of whom two are in school and the eldest is at the state university. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction material and used to finish the construction of a room for their eldest daughter since she currently shares a room with her parents and little brothers. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation qualifies Maria for approval for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of materials to finish the construction of a room for her eldest daughter.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Tkouv village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kun Sok, is a worker who earns money in the local market. Mrs. Sokha K. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 36-year-old mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Las Muchachitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Muchachitas" esta representado por la señora Rosario María y esta conformado por 12 miembros los cuales residen en la av. tres pasos al frente en el cual es son 11 mujeres y 1 varón, en cuanto al parentesco familiar la señora Rosario María  y la señorita Veracruz  son madre e hija pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. Todos los miembros se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, venta de comida, de pan, servicio de limpieza, servicio de construcción de viviendas  y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir.  Existe gran competencia dentro del ámbito comercial así como variedad de productos para ofrecer a la venta, las socias se basan en su experiencia y en la calidad de sus productos para hacerle frente a la competencia y poder generar mejores ingresos cada día, es por este motivo que necesitan el crédito para la adquisición d material de primera para mejorar cada día mas la calidad de sus productos así como mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo para un mejor acabado. La mayoría de las socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que cuentan con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital en la cuales han demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
This community bank, "Las Muchachitas", is represented by Rosario María and is made up of 12 members, 11 women and one man, who live on Tres Pasos Avenue. Rosario María and Veracruz are mother and daughter buth each has her own independent source of income. Each of the members has a different business, such as selling cosmetics from catalogues, selling food, bread, offering cleaning services, residential construction services and dressmaking. There is a great deal of competition to their business in the variety of products offered for sale: the members rely on their experience and the quality of their products to face the competition and make more money each day; because of this, they need the loan to acquire more raw materials to improve the quality of their goods as well as their work tools to give their goods a better finish. Most of the members have experience with group loans as they have experience borrowing from other financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital in which they have demonstrated their punctuality and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Laisim

texts.en:
Mrs. Laisim L., 26, and her husband, Mr. Yan Ngoeun, 31, residents of a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 2001 and have one son, a student.  

Laisim has been a silk weaver for six years, selling her products to the middleman in the village, while her husband has been an English teacher for ten years. They also farm. In order to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business and to provide capital for their farming operation, Laisim is requesting a loan of $600.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and for farming.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana P., 46, is single with two children.  She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the people of the village and the neighbourhood, three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 tala (~$60 US).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, a sewing machine, needles and thread

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert D. is a married small businessman who lives in Kitunda, a selected site for poultry keepers in Dar es Salaam. He runs a business raising poultry, both layers and broilers, in Kitunda . He purchases the poultry chicks from the inter-chicks company and from other chick incubator companies. He collects eight trays of eggs daily and sells wholesale. He uses his business income to meet his daily family needs and capitalization for his business. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 (Tanzanian shillings) to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: David Hernand

texts.es: El Señor David V. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital llamado Memorial Sandino, casado su esposa se dedica a vender cosméticos tiene dos hijos. Como planes tiene remodelar su casa para tener mayor comodidad y seguridad. Actualmente don David tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas de productos lácteos,  juego videos y tiene conocimiento de albañilería lo cual pone en practica como otro ingreso mas. Se le ha presentado algunas dificultades que es la falta de financiamiento para ofertar mayores cantidades de productos. Da la gracias a Afodenic por permitirle desarrollarse como comerciante, con el préstamo que solicitad comprara productos como: queso, crema, cuajadas, leche agria y mantequilla. Para ofertar a su clientela la variedad de productos así como la captación de nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Comprar queso, cuajada, crema

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
A la edad de 60 años, la señora María Ofelia C. labora en su actividad de elaboración de tortillas las cuales son vendidas por ella misma en su localidad en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

Actualmente ella ha reconocido que necesita invertir en la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz y leña y es por esto que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para la compra de dicha materia prima y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Ofelia C., 60, makes tortillas. She sells them in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She currently needs to buy raw materials such as corn and wood. That is why she hopes that Ceprodel will give her a loan to buy these raw materials and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mrs. Savat K., 60, is a widow with one son who has been a soldier for nineteen years. She lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savat has been selling groceries and Chinese noodles for ten years. She buys grocery items from Korky market, approximately three kilometers from her house, for resale in her village.

She hopes to expand her business; it would better for her to have more income to support her family. So she is asking for a loan of $500 in order to purchase more grocery items for her stock and to fix the door of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale and to fix the door of her house

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Terisita H. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. Terisita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Terisita owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Terisita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Terisita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Terisita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Terisita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Terisita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una joven madre muy trabajadora, tiene 29 años. Desde que nació su segunda hija su trabajo en el hogar se incrementó, además que apoya a su suegra por vivir en su casa. Realizar los trabajos agrícolas le place de sobre manera, ya que gracias a sus cultivos bien atendidos logra cosechar abundantes papas y arvejas de primera calidad, por lo que decidió enviarlos directamente a un mercado importante de la ciudad de Lima. El dinero de las ganancias obtenidas lo invirtió en la compra de un auto, con el que su esposo está realizando transporte de pasajeros. Yolanda no piensa dejar sus cultivos, por lo contrario, los ha incrementado, ya que sabe que ahora no tendrá dificultad en el transporte de sus productos. Ahora, en cuanto va cosechando va cargando directamente a su carro los sacos para transportarlos hasta el mercado de Tarma, por ello, siente que su trabajo se hace más liviano. Yolanda se siente muy feliz con sus cultivos y su movilidad, con la que posó orgullosa. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal, pues lo que más la motivó a ingresar fue el seguro de vida que se incluye con el crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos y también para el pago de la tarjeta de circulación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 29 years old and a hardworking young mother. Since the birth of her second daughter, her work at home has increased. She also supports her mother-in-law who lives with her at home. Yolanda manages to have time for farming along the way, and thanks to her attentiveness, she achieved an abundant harvest of potatoes and peas that are of high quality. She decided to sell her crops directly at the largest market in the city of Lima. Her earnings will be used to purchase a car that her husband can use as a passenger taxi.

Yolanda has no intention to quit farming. In fact, she plans to increase her production since she will no longer have difficulty transporting her products. She can load sacks of produce into her car and transport them to the market in Tarma, which will make her work load feel lighter. Yolanda is very happy with her harvest and the ability to move her produce.

This is Yolanda’s first loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank. She was prompted to join upon learning that life insurance was included as a benefit of her loan. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her crops and also pay for her driver’s license.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida P. has been a CEVI client for quite a long time now. She is on her 7th loan in CEVI because she is happy with its services and with the staff who implement the program. She has seven children: three girls and four boys who are all studying.

Bienvenida needs additional capital to support her business which is selling fish. She wants to buy a new boat engine and needs Php 12,000 to purchase it. Receiving this loan will also help her to send all her children to school and to buy some of their needs.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen B., from the village of Gango Ozamiz City, is 40 years old, married and the father of three school-aged children. To make a living, for over 15 years Stephen has owned and operated a business that provides sound system services to local community members. He earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Stephen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC, he is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be Stephen's fourth, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es: La señora Lesli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vendedoras de Villa Universitaria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de ajos, ubicada en su misma casa. Lesli, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su casa diariamente a comprar,  es ella, quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ajos en sacos y de buena calidad para consumidores. Lesli, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará sacos de ajos.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 65 years old, is married, and is a mother with six children. One of her kids is in school and the rest of the children are grownups.

To support her household, Adwoa buys and sells cereals like local maize in the community market to her loyal customers. She has been in business for seven years now. She says the selling of this product is very lucrative.

Adwoa takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family, especially for their education. She hopes to repay the loan on time so that she can access a new one.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like rice

loans.name: Leticia M.

texts.en:
Leticia is a married woman who has been in business for about 18 months. She has a daughter in nursery school and eight dependents. Leticia owns a kiosk at the central market in Bo where she sells cosmetics and African dresses for women. Prior to setting up her own business, Leticia was in hotel management, but then resigned as the salary she was earning was meager. 

Leticia hopes to use the loan to purchase additional cosmetics and African dresses for her kiosk, and the proceeds will be used partly to secure a plot of land and later build a house. She spends her entire time at her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and dresses.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y cuyes. Para la alimentación cuidado de sus animales cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor.
Paralela a esta actividad brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros con un motocarro que logró comprar con los ahorros de su trabajo y a pesar de no ser muy común que una mujer maneje este tipo de vehículos, ella lo hace muy bien y sus clientes le tienen mucha confianza.
Nora disfruta mucho de ambos trabajos porque le permiten ingresos diarios y costear los gastos de su familia. 
Su deseo a futuro es tener más animales, pero de una mejor raza, así como tener casa propia donde pueda implementar un establo más amplio. 

Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un crédito con MFP, esta es una experiencia novedosa para ella, así como ser parte de un banco comunal; sin embargo está muy entusiasmada, porque sabe que de esta manera podrá progresar, por lo que se compromete a puntual en todos sus pagos. 

El dinero que solicita le servirá para completar el valor de una vaca más para su establo, siendo el precio total un aproximado de 1500 soles.
texts.en:
Nora is 30, and she lives in a rented house with her husband and 3 children. For the past 4 years she has raised cattle, and guinea pigs. Her oldest son helps her with the feeding of the animals. Besides the animals she has a transport service for passengers with a motorbike that she was able to buy with the savings from her work. Despite the fact that it is not common for a woman to drive this type of vehicle, she does it very well and her customers have a lot of faith in her. Nora enjoys both jobs because they give her daily profits that help her pay for her family’s expenses. Her goal for the future is to have more animals, but of better breeds, as well as to have her own house where she can set up a bigger stable. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from MFP. This is a new experience for her, to be part of a communal bank. Nevertheless she is very enthusiastic, because she knows that in this way she can progress, and she will make her payments on time. The money that she is asking for will help her pay for another cow for her stable, since the price is approximates 1500 soles. de 1500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun C., age 30, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and she also makes and sells brooms at the local market, earning approximately US $2.00 each day. Her husband, Chak Chamnan, who appears in the photograph, is a motor-taxi driver who makes US $7.00 of profit each day. They have four children; two are students and two are too young to attend school. 

Bun makes her brooms from a type of long grass that grows in the forest. She told to a loan officer that she needs to spend around US $30.00 on food and US $15.00 on utilities. Bun C. is asking for a loan of US $500.00 to purchase cows to assist her in her farm work.

loans.use: To purchase cows for her farming business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años y vive feliz en su casa propia junto a  su esposo Carlos de 40 años, aún no tienen hijos, pero igual buscan mejorar cada día.Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas al por mayor y menor, dentro de su casa; esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo y lo que más le gusta es poder terminar una  cantidad de mercadería a diario, porque es una meta trazada que tiene que cumplir, lo que le disgusta es que cuando no le salen las frutas debe coger un triciclo y empujarlo por diferentes lugares aledaños a su vivienda ofreciendo sus productos “esa rutina es bastante cansada, al final del día terminas sin fuerzas, ni garganta por haber gritado mucho, pero el hecho de terminar sin frutas hace que valga la pena”, señala Rosa, a la vez explica que su trabajo es muy rentable porque le ha permitido construir su casa, mantener su hogar y cubrir sus necesidades, en el futuro desea aperturar varias tiendas de venta  de frutas las que sólo tenga que administrar como lo viene haciendo con la tienda en su casa.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta segura que pagará puntualmente para acceder a más créditos, además esta muy contenta con el trabajo que desarrolla en su banco comunal porque aprende mucho.Con el dinero del préstamo tiene  previsto comprar frutas al por mayor, para luego venderlas y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives happily in her own home with her husband Carlos, who is 40. Although they have no children, they are always looking to improve each day. For the past 18 years, Rosa has been buying and selling fruit in bulk and in small amounts outside of her house. She manages this business with her husband. What she likes most about her job is being able to sell all of her merchandise by the end of the day since that is a goal she tries to accomplish. The part she dislikes is hauling the fruit to her house in her tricycle from various places nearby. Rosa says her daily routine is very tiring. She lacks the strength by the end of the day after shouting a lot to attract customers. However, she says selling all of her fruit by the end of the day makes the effort worthwhile.

Rosa says her work is profitable because it has allowed her to build a home, support her family, and meet their basic necessities. In the future, she wants to open more fruit stands that she can manage in addition to the one she has established at home. This is her second loan with MFP. Rosa is careful to make her payments on time so that she will be eligible to access future loans. She is pleased with the work of her Communal Bank because she has a learned a lot through this experience. The loan will be used to buy fruit in bulk so that she can sell them at a higher profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Asaba Ahebwa Kabagidi Tibadesi Group

texts.en: K. Tibadesi, 43, is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She is a hardworking businesswoman who has owned a grocery store for more than 20 years. Tibadesi is using her loan to purchase grocery items, such as bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes and so forth, to sell in her grocery business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, such as bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Hassan Namatsi

texts.en:
Hassan Namatsi A. is famer in Nambale, Busia District. He ventured into the farming business in 2009 from a construction job. He buys his farm stock from Eldoret twice a year in tandem with the seasons of the year. 

Hassan is 52 years old, married and a proud father of 7 children. He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to expand his business. He says this will go a long way in ensuring education for his children and guaranteeing his dream of doing so.

loans.use: Expand Farming Business.

loans.name: Joveryann's Group

texts.en:
Joveryann R. and her children are from the village of Balatacan in Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Joveryann is the leader of a two-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repayingthe loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Joveryann is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joveryann owns and operates a retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as candies, biscuits, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Joveryann has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Joveryann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joveryann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Joveryann is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Joveryann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 23 years old and lives in Bint Jbeil southern Lebanon. For the last two years, he has made a living selling CDs and cassettes. He also owns DJ equipment, which he rents our for private parties. When he started his business, he didn’t have enough cash, which is why he took out a loan to buy merchandise and improve his opportunities. He is now applying for a second loan, to buy more merchandise to sell. He has always repaid debts on time, and feels confident he can continue to do that because he has a lot of experience in sales and and meeting clients' needs. Most of his customers are friends, neighbors and people from the surrounding villages. He went into business because he likes to work independently, and plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mr. S. is a 27-year-old married man and a resident of Kompong Thmor, which is a commune in Kompong Tom Province. He is married to Sophy, 27, and they have been blessed with two young kids. Neither of the kids is enrolled in school. His wife, who appears in the photo here, raises a few pigs in a stall next to their house to earn a living. In order to make a living, S. earns money from fishing and selling chop-wood. Currently, S. does not have adequate cash to support his family. He has been planning to invest in a new trade for years but his plan has not been successful because he doesn’t have money. Therefore, S. looks for a loan as capital to purchase entertainment instruments that he will use to provide a service to earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase entertainment instruments

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia P. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran ZDS. She is 46 years old. Cecilia is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cecilia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Angeles, esta casada,  anteriormente fue cliente Kiva, respondió con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, y las cuotas estuvieron de acuerdo a sus ingresos, ella trabaja juntamente con el esposo en un taller de cerrajeria por la zona de Santa fé, tiene dos hijos pequeños en edad escolar, lo que le pèrmite a ella trabajar en otra actividad que es de empleada del hogar por la zona de Seguencoma, el taller se encuentra en su domicilio, por lo que su esposo controla las actividades de sus hijos, son una pareja joven, ahora el préstamo lo invertiran en compra de herramientas  y continuaran con el arreglo de  su vivienda, ellos solicitaron repetir monto y plazo, y con las mismas condiciones, ya que tienen un presupuesto para cubrir sin contratiempos esas cuotas. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Angeles is married and was a previous Kiva client. She handled her loan payments responsibly and completed them on time. Angeles works with her husband at a locksmith shop in the Santa Fé district. They have two young children who are in school and keep her busy when they are at their home in the area of Seguencoma.

Their workshop is set up in their house, which allows her to supervise her children’s activities. Angeles and her husband are a young couple. They now request a loan to invest in the purchase of tools and to continue the remodeling of their home. Their loan will be the same amount and repayment period as before, as well as contain the same conditions. They have already set aside room in their budget to cover the payments. Angeles is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for her locksmith shop

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ella es María Alcadia S. V. quien desde hace dieciséis años  tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cosidos.  Ella con el préstamo compra leña, maíz y frijoles en grandes cantidades.

Sus compañeros de grupo son Ángela del Carmen Vázquez R. quien comercializa chatarra y Liliam de los Reyes C. R. quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Alfa y Omega" (Alpha & Omega) group is composed of three hard-working, dedicated and determined women. One of them is María Alcadia S. V. who has had a tortilla shop for 16 years; she also sells cooked beans. She will use the loan to buy firewood, corn and beans in large quantities. Her fellow group members are: Ángela del Carmen Vázquez R. who retails recyclables and Liliam de los Reyes C. R. who has a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rodrigo A., a businessman, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing a clothing and curtain store while having a direct-selling business as a sideline. She sells a popular brands of cosmetics.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues. She used the money that she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities and designs of clothing to replenish her current inventory. She also will invest some of the loan to do advance orders on her cosmetics direct-selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide her children with further education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities and designs of clothing inventory and advance orders on her cosmetics direct selling line.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy L. is a married woman who owns a small business. She runs a café in Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells cooked and fried food to customers. She purchases the ingredients from wholesale and retail city market shops. She was able to buy a plot of land in Kigamboni ward from the income of her business. In addition, the income helps her meet her family's daily needs. She needs a loan of TZS 1,400,000 to grow her business

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina de  labora como decente  de primaria desde hace 13 años en  la Escuela Ruben Dario. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar pues tiene su pequeño negocio de ferreteria.   

Martina esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crèdito  con el objetivo de construir una habitaciòn y de esta manera brindarles comodidades a sus 3 hijos.  Expresa que se siente agradecida con AFODENIC por el apoyo que le ha brindado, pues gracias a los creditos otorgados ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Tanto ella como su esposo son reconocidos como personas de buen comportamiento social, son una familia muy humildes y trabajadores.  

Ademas Martina se caracteriza por su gran espiritu de superacion profesional pues actualmente esta cursando su tercer año en la universidad URACCAN la aspira a sacar su titulo de Ciencias de Educacion, su mayor sueño en la vida que sus hijos tengan salud y que estudien para que sean hombres de bien y tener una vivienda bonita como toda persona con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Martina has worked as a primary school teacher for 13 years in the Ruben Dario School. She has three children who are in school. Her husband helps with the household expenses, as he has a small hardware store. Martina is seeking her seventh loan in order to construct a room and thus make her three children comfortable. She says that she is grateful for the help of AFODENIC--thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to improve her living conditions. She and her husband are known to be well-adjusted people. They are a humble and hardworking family. Furthermore, Martina is known for her spirit of professional ambition. She is currently in her third year of university at URACCAN [Nicaraguan University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast] to get her degree in Educational Sciences. Her main dream in life is for her sons to be healthy and study in order to become good men, and to have a beautiful home like every person with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
Doña Arely Sugey C. P. es comerciante,  soltera tiene un hijo menor de edad vive junto a su familia en el barrio San Agustín, su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos opera desde hace trece años en su casa de habitación.
   
La razón por la que actualmente está solicitando el crédito es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de la materia prima para continuar realizando los deliciosos alimentos y así seguir adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
Arely Sugey C. P. is a merchant. She is single, has a small son, and lives with her family in the neighborhood of San Agustín. She has been operating her small business out of her home for three years. Arely has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for two years, and has had twenty loans during that time, each of which was repaid in two months. These loans have enabled Arely to maintain her business and provide stability for her family. The loans have also enabled her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing general merchandise

loans.name: Rovella

texts.en:
Rovella M. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fish vending and carpentry. She lives in Zone 4, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and carpentry businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,800 PHP. 

Rovella is now borrowing PHP 9,000 to buy more stock for her fish vending business.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rovella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

Rovella's picture was taken at the NWTF-PD Center House when she attended the weekly center meeting.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn K. (pictured here), age 50, is a widow with one daughter. She lives along National Road Number five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her elderly mother and two nephews are living with her. 

Torn has been a garment factory worker for 20 years. Her nephew is a garment worker along with her. Torn does not have transportation for commuting and spends a lot of money on traveling costs. For this reason, she is applying for her a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 52 years old with two children, one of whom graduated from the local school. Ms Ly has managed a restaurant serving breakfast and lunch to workers for five years. Her restaurant is always crowed with customers and she can earn 120,000 VND profit per day. A client of SeDa for four years, she has used loans effectively. She now wants a loan of 8,502,000 to buy a big refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a big refrigerator.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 53 years old and is married with three adult children. Bernardita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernardita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcia Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Marcia L. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, se desempaña como responsable del Registro civil de las personas en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene cinco años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de cerámica y cemento con el objetivo de ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en: Marcia L. is from Santa Rosa del Peñón. She is in charge of the civil registry for the city where she has been working for five years. This is the first loan she has requested from field partner CEPRODEL. The purpose of the loan is to purchase ceramic and cement to slowly improve her home.

loans.use: Purchase ceramic and cement.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip L. plans to buy a new video camera with his loan. Currently, a video production company contracts him to film events, business meetings and depositions. Because he does not have a camera, he has to rent one each time he is contracted and the profit margin is lower. When he buys his new video camera, he will not have to rent equipment and he can even be hired directly, instead of through a company. 


Phillip hopes that his business will expand to the point where he can buy better cameras and employ people. He also dreams to start many more businesses like refurbishing cars to use less gas and buying homes to rent out to people. Phillip is very involved in his church and is excited to teach the youth group how to film. They all plan to make short films together as a youth group activity.

loans.use: Video Equipment

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 45 years old, and married, with 4 children. His children are 18, 17, 11 and 8 years old. To make a living, Jose plants and harvests rice for sale. Jose wants to provide a better life for his family. He also dreams of seeing all his children finish college and be successful.

Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angelica Liliana

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

La señora Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal hace  dos años y dice que se siente muy a gusto en el mismo por la ayuda que recibe de parte de la fundación, así como también de parte de sus compañeras del grupo. Ella tiene 37 años de edad,  de estado civil divorciada, pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 15 y 10 años, el mayor esta en el colegio y el otro en la escuela.
 
Se dedica al comercio vende productos Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas).  También vende ropa y zapatos por catálogo, vende puerta a puerta y también en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local  donde sus clientes en su mayoría la visitan para hacerle sus pedidos y sus compras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, deja a crédito aunque la mayor parte de  las ventas son al contado. Sus productos lo que es ropa y zapatos se los envían desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar: ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y accesorios de damas. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y poder ampliar su casa que es pequeña.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo district of the province of Manabí is known for its beautiful landscape, forests, wildlife and also for its hardworking people employed in agriculture and animal rearing. This is where the Madres Para Un Futuro Mejor (Mothers for a Better Future) Communal Bank meets every fortnight.

Angélica has been a member of the Communal Bank for two years and says she feels very happy there because of the help she receives from the foundation, as well as from her fellow group members. She is 37 years old, divorced and has two children aged 15 and 10 from her former marriage. The eldest child is in secondary school and the other attends primary school.
 
She makes her living from selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). She also sells clothes and shoes from a catalogue, selling door to door and also in her own home, where she has a small shop where most of her customers visit her to make their orders and purchases. She works every day from 8.30am til 4.30pm, she offers credit, though most of her sales are paid in cash. Her clothes and shoes items are sent from Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy: clothes, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories. Her dream is to have a bigger shop and be able to extend her small house.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en:
Constantina C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 24 years old and single. She has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Constantina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Constantina does her best to feed her child and herself.

Constantina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constantina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Constantina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita E. is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Punta Sulong in the municipality of Baliangao, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Carmelita sells her own ocean-caught fish to the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Carmelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 14,800 PHP, her sixth from PMPC, that will be used to repair her fishing tackle.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing tackle

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida P. is from Barangay Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Leonida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business, primarily selling rice cakes in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a married small businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk who has been offering taxi services in his home town and beyond for the past seven years. His monthly income is 6,000 Grivnyas. Vasyl sold vehicles before he started this enterprise.

Vasyl is requesting a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to purchase new winter tires and an accumulator unit, as well as to repair the running gear of his vehicle. Two of his goals are to pay off his car loan and buy all necessary furniture and appliances for his apartment.

loans.use: To purchase new winter tires and an accumulator unit and repair running gear of his vehicle

loans.name: Francline

texts.en:
Francline is a married man with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

He has been operating an open-air vegetable stall, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Francline faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. He hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions and tomatoes for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Adyabold

texts.en:
Adyabold is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in an old, small house. His wife works in a department store as a salesperson. Adyabold operated a taxi service for the past few years by using his friend’s car. During that time, he gained much experience in conducting a business. He is currently employed at a taxi company as a taxi driver. Adyabold is a very hard-working person and is known for his good character. 

His house is too small for his family, and it needs repair. So he is asking for a loan to purchase insulation materials for the house.

loans.use: To purchase insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires for her taxi

loans.name: Adama S.

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Adama S. C..  She is married and has one child who is 15 years old. In 2005, Adama established her assorted utensil items business. She began her business because she wants to sustain herself and family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid two group loans, and she now requires an individual loan in order to purchase different types of utensils. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Adama plans to be a supplier to other traders. She plans to open a shop and hire workers.  She is serious and determined. Transportation cost and inflation are her main business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Additonal assorted utensils - pans, bowls, bucket, rubbers etc. in larger quantities

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Christina E. has supported her family by selling accessories such as hair bands, clips, elastic ponytail bands, and earrings. She currently sells her wares at Abrafo, a village near Abura, carrying them from customer to customer. 

She would like eventually to open her own shop. To realize this dream, she intends to improve her immedate sales by buying a greater variety and quantity of accessories to meet the needs of her customers and to grow her customer base. Additional profits will be reinvested into her business.   

Christine attended school up to the junior high level. She and her husband, who works as a driver, have five children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more foods and different kind of beverages for his general store

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Nanda Kumari M..  She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 7.  In 2005, she established her business of making brass religious statues.  Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her work.  In the future, Nanda Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child. She is from Lebanon. She sells a wide range of Lebanese food and products from her home to customers from her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works in a local food company.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase milk in order to produce its delicious derivatives such as white cheese, yogurt, etc.  In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as to sell popular homemade food products. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase milk to make her products to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 43 years old, married and supports eight people. He has been a farmer for the past four years with a monthly income of KES.5,000.

He repaid his previous loan well and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs. 

With the profits generated he plans to expand his farming and venture into livestock keeping.
He dreams of being rich. He is an assiduous man who works hard to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sauzan

texts.en: Sauzan is 43 years old, and she has one child, 24 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She sells different kinds of foodstuffs which include beans, sorghum and maize. She has been selling foodstuffs for 15 years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs to make more profit.With the profit she plans to feed her family and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Minda Lee

texts.en:
Minda Lee is 39 years old and is married with two school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines. Minda Lee's husband is also a farmer. 

Minda Lee is asking for a loan of PHP25,000 to purchase inputs needed for their field, such as fertilizers and rice seeds. In the future, Minda Lee hopes that she will earn a higher income from her farm yields in order to financially support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, such as fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia Mercedes tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, la responsabilidad que tiene es su hijo de 15 años que está a su cargo. Inicio este negocio para ofrecer productos que sus diferentes clientes le realizan, Claudia es una mujer  muy emprendedora a pesar de los diferentes problemas que enfrenta como es el tiempo ya que tiene que recorrer muchos lugares. El crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado, toallas entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia Mercedes is 41 years old.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business more than 8 years.  She has a 15-year-old son in her care.  She started the business to sell products ordered from her various customers.  Claudia is a very enterprising woman despite the various problems she faces, like time, because she has to go to several places.  The loan is to buy clothing in general, sheets, cosmetics, footwear and towels, among others.

loans.use: to buy clothing in general, cosmetics, footwear and towels, among other things.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Marites has a retail shop that sells tablea or home made chocolate bars. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars.
Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, Roda has operated a clothes sales business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Roda dreams of owning her own business premises in the future.
With this 50,000 KES loan, Roda wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.
