loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora tiene 64 años, está casada con el Señor Juan, quien es D. profesión albañil, tienen 2 hijos mayores D. edad, que trabajan en forma independiente, viven en la ciudad D. Paraguarí.
Aurora posee una despensa hace más D. 20 años en su propio domicilio, su marido actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la Argentina, su hijo el mayor trabaja en una empresa privada y su hija es D. profesión docente. Uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio y D. esa forma poder ofrecer más comodidades a sus clientes y además tener más capacidad D. almacenamiento.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, carnes y demás que le servirá para abastecer su negocio y D. esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda D. ellos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta les brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora is 64 years old and married to Sr. Juan, who is a professional mason. They have two grown children who work independently. They live in the city of Paraguarí.

Aurora has managed a food pantry for more than 20 years from her home. Her husband is currently working in Argentina. Her older son works for a private company and her daughter is in the teaching profession. One of her dreams is to expand her business so that she can offer more amenities to her customers and increase her storage capacity.

She is requesting a loan to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, meats, and other items to restock her business. This will allow her to meet the demand for these products. Aurora is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience, and needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 220 talas or US $92 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Miriama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Miriama's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1, 2, 4 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Hoyo del Toro, named in honor of their community name. This is a small community on the road to San Pedro D. Macoris and this group has 20 business people. Carmen is a young mother of three children. 

Carmen sells clothes, especially second hand clothes, in a flea market close to her community. When the Esperanza program went to her community, she decided to have a loan for her business, after 10 loans she has been able to establish her business and to proviD. for her family. She will invest this loan to buy a bag of used clothes and blankets.

Carmen said that her most biggest challenge is to raise her children into a better enviroment, she wants to give them a safer life, and with few needs as possible; she is working to proviD. school, food, clothes and other needs. She enjoys learning and taking care of her children. 

She is dreaming to see her children attend the University, graduate and become professionals. Thank you! 

Carmen is the lady on the right bottom in the picture.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes and blankets

loans.name: Rubia Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora Rubia es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, viven por el cantón Gualaceo. Este cantón es muy visitado por su armonía, el encanto y la calidez de una ciudad antigua y moderna, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, su gente no pierden sus tradiciones, se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías y lo más importante son personas cálidas y amables.

La Señora Rubia tiene 56 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando. 

Doña Rubia labora en la preparación y venta de comida, labor que realiza hace un año, trabaja sin un horario fijo de domingo a domingo. 

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas. 

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the “Gualaceñitas” communal bank; they live in Gualaceo Canton.  This canton is much visited because of its harmony, charm and warmth of a city that is both ancient and modern.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents keep their traditions.  They make crafts but what is most important is that they are warm and kind people.

Rubia is 56 years old, married and has three children who are all adults, married and independent.  Her husband is a driver.  They do not own their house; they are renters.

Rubia works making food to sell, a job she’s been doing for the last year.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed work schedule.

This is her third loan with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy dinnerware and foodstuffs to prepare her meals.  Her goal is to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware and fodstuffs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children.

Ahmad has owned a market since 2004, selling foodstuffs, household items and accessories. He has more than seven years of experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,500 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to add more items for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and more items for his market.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past seven years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his electronics store, which mainly sells and repairs computers. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more computers and replacement parts and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more computers and replacement parts.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38-years-old and is married to Catherine. Together they have four children aged eight, seven, four and one years old. He is a farmer, farming fruits besides owning a retail kiosk. He has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.
 
This is the third loan term in KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and pay for the labor. 

The anticipated profits will help him educate his children and build another house.His hope is to own a motor bicycle to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Blanca Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la aldea Rio Chiquito en el municipio de El Progreso. Ella tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15, y 12 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando.  Su esposo Reyes es agricultor y la pareja lleva 18 años de casados. La familia depende de los ingresos de la pareja para vivir. 

Blanca tiene una pulpería donde vende una gran variedad de productos incluyendo lácteos, granos, carnes, embutidos, harina, frijol, pan, manteca y golosinas. Ella se puso la pulpería hace 4 años debido a sus deseos de superarse. Ella nota que había una demanda para el negocio porque la gente comentaba que hacía falta una pulpería en el barrio.

Un crédito anterior le ayudó a surtir más el negocio. Con el crédito actual de L21,000, Blanca va a aumentar su inventario comprando granos básicos, manteca, pan, refrescos y golosinas. Ella espera ofrecer una buena variedad de productos y tener satisfechas las necesidades de sus clientes. También desea superar las bajas ventas que ella atribuye a las fuertes lluvias que han caído en Honduras.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 38, lives in the Rio Chiquito village in the El Progresso municipality.  She has three children; ages 18, 15, and 12.  The children go to school.  Her husband, Reyes, is a farmer.  The couple has been married for 18 years.  The family depends upon the couple’s income to live.

Blanca has a grocery store where she sells a great variety of products including dairy products, grains, meat, sausages, flour, beans, bread, lard, and sweets.  Four years ago she established the grocery store because of her desire to improve herself.  She notes that there was a demand for the business because people were saying they needed a grocery store in the neighborhood. 

A previous loan helped her stock her store more.  With the current loan for 21,000 lempiras Blanca will increase her inventory by purchasing basic grains, lard, bread, soft drinks, and sweets.  She hopes to offer a good variety of products and to satisfy her customers’ needs.  She also hopes to overcome the low sales that she attributes to the heavy rains that have fallen in Honduras.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, lard, bread, soft drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Alberto es casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo, el inicio su negocio por la motivación de su esposa ya que necesitaban tener otra fuente de ingresos para la familia. Carlos sale desde muy temprano de su casa a vender su mercadería con un bolso muy grande, lo cual es muy difícil para él, porque es cansado caminar todo el día para visitar sus clientes .el objetivo de su préstamo es para invertir en mercadería como perfume cremas, jabón, colonia de bebe, ropa interior, camisas y  pantalones para la temporada navideña. Ya que quiere lograr vender su producto en esta época por lo cual les agradece su ayuda económica.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is married and has 2 minor children in his care.  He was encouraged to start up this business by his wife, since they needed another source of income for the family.  Carlos leaves his house very early in the morning to sell his merchandise, which he carries in a very large sack.  This is difficult for him, because it is tiring to walk every day to visit his customers.  He plans to use this loan to invest in merchandise such as: creams, soap, baby cologne, underwear, shirts and pants for the Christmas season.  He is grateful for your financial help, because he wants to be able to sell products in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, soap, baby cologne, underwear, shirts and pants

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
This is Maureen, 37, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, an overseas contract worker, and she is a mother to three children. She, together with her children, manages the own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maureen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maureen hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, who both attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Annet lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

Annet has operated a restaurant for 3 years, selling her products on a retail basis from home. She also has a beauty salon as her other source of income. Annet works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy beef, rice, bananas and flour for her restaurant and braids for her salon. Annet's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and hopes are to build rental houses and to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more beef, rice, bananas and flour for her restaurant and braids for her salon

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Miriam de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Emiliano de 33 años y su pequeña hija Nayeli de 08 años a quien brindan mucho amor. La actividad que realiza Miriam es enseñar a los alumnos del colegio de su localidad, durante 11 años trabaja como profesora y gracias a su trabajo llego a comprar una chacra donde pueda tener sus sembrios de cacao ya que también le gusta la parte agrícola. Miriam esta permanente enseñando a sus alumnos mientras que con la ayuda de su esposo puede ver sus cultivos y así ambos trabajan juntos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder contar el apoyo de su esposo para solventar los gastos de su hogar y considera que lo mas difícil es cuando la plaga de insectos malogran sus cultivos. Por ello acude al apoyo financiero para que pueda hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo como: desyerbar y fertilizar sus plantas para poder tener una buena producción. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará jornaleros para realizar sacar la mala hierba de sus plantas y con el resto comprará abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 years old, and is a working woman. She lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband Emiliano and her little daughter Nayeli who is 8 years old and who offers lots of love.

Miriam teaches at a school in her neighborhood. For 11 years she has been working as a teacher and thanks to her work she came to buy a farm where she can plant cocoa, and she likes farming.

Miriam is a full-time employee teaching students while with the help of her husband she can watch over their crops and also they can work together.

What she likes most about her work is being able to count on her husband to cover the household expenses and the hardest part is when insects ruin their crops. This is why she is asking for financial help so that she can care for her crop, weeding and fertilizing her plants in order to be able to have a good harvest.

This will be her eighth loan through MFP. She feels that the money from the loan will help a lot in the progress of her work. In her communal bank she is considered very dear by the other members. With the 3,000 soles she will hire laborers to weed the crops and she will buy compost and fertilizer with what is left.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad, el señor Luis Fernando se dedica al transporte de personas desde la ciudad de Medellín al Aeropuerto del municipio de Rionegro ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace siete años y gracias a esta labor puede generar los ingresos para sus padres y esposa. Debido al invierno su vehículo ha sufrido percances mecánicos, por lo cual el señor Luis Fernando requiere con urgencia arreglar el motor de su automóvil para así poder prestar un servicio con seguridad a sus clientes y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: At the age of 42, Luis Fernando provides transportation services for people from the city of Medellín to the municipal airport in Rionegro located in east Antioquia.  He’s been in this activity for seven years and thanks to this work is able to generate income for his parents and his wife.  Due to the winter, his car has suffered some mechanical problems which Luis Fernando urgently needs to repair so that he can continue to offer save customer service and to continue to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his car's engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Don Eleuterio tiene 39 años de edad, tiene una familia que está compuesta por tres hijos dependientes y su esposa, viven en una comunidad muy alejada del pueblo donde tienen que pasar tres ríos para llegar a su hogar. Desde muy pequeño se dedicó a la agricultura, ahora trabaja  en parcelas muy pequeñas donde produce papa, frejol y maní los cuales producen muy satisfactoriamente gracias al clima y a la tierra que se tienen en la zona, lo poco que produce solo le alcanza para  la alimentación de su familia y el poco excedente lo comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque (municipio ubicado en el Departamento de Cochabamba). Don Eleuterio es una persona muy respetada y querida en su comunidad, por la dedicación que pone a su trabajo y también por ser el responsable del cuidado de su familia. Don Eleuterio, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, de este modo poder aumentar más sus superficies de cultivo con la cual mejorar la calidad, aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Eleuterio is 39 years old. He has a family made up of three dependent children and his wife. They live in a community far from town and have to cross three rivers to get to their house. Since he was very small, he has worked in agriculture. Now he works in small parcels where he grows potatoes, beans, and peanuts. They grow very satisfactorily thanks to the climate and the soil in the area. What little he produces is only enough to feed his family and what little is left he sells in the town of Mizque (a town located in the Department of Cochabamba). Eleuterio is a very respected and well liked person in his community because of the dedication he puts into his work, and also because of how responsible he is while caring for his family. Eleuterio is asking for this loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers and agricultural chemicals. This way, he can increase his planting area, which will improve the quality, increase his production and thus have more income and improve his whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Kaffo

texts.en:
This is 63-year-old Kaffo. He is married and has six children, aged 38, 31, 25, 22, and 22. He has two additional dependents who live with him as his sales assistants. In 1970, Kaffo established his commercial business. He began his business just for self-empowerment. His business is located at the city centre and his main customers are men and women. He works 7 days a week and 11 hours a day. He earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Kaffo has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and he now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothes and items such as bedspreads for resale. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level, and thus his income. In the future, Kaffo plans to complete the construction of his house and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and bedspreads.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a young, kind, hard-working and enthusiastic woman. Her business began one year ago selling different types of Mexican food on the weekends. Little by little, she started to have more acceptance by the community and her clients demanded her foods for important events. However, Lilian does not have the production capacity to assist the great demand she currently has, and also her sales are limited. She is married to Carlos, who is a commercial store employer, and his income only allows them to cover the home basic necessities. However, this is not enough to cover the education expenses of their small children of 10 and 8 years old.

Lilian Requires a loan of $375 to purchase the necessary materials to increase her production capacity and to increase her food sales. With a term of 6 months she will be able to repay the loan. Lilian and her children thank you for your generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Lilian es una mujer joven, amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, comenzó su negocio hace ya más de un año vendiendo diferentes tipos de comida mexicana los fines de semana, poco a poco empezó a tener mayor aceptación y sus clientes demandaban sus comidas para eventos importantes. Sin embargo, Lilian no cuenta con la capacidad de producción para atender la gran demanda que tiene, por lo que sus ventas son limitadas. Casada con Carlos, quien trabaja como empleado de una tienda comercial, el salario de Carlos solo les permite cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar, como el alimento. Sin embargo esto no es suficiente como para la educación de sus pequeños hijos de 10 y 8 años.

Lilian Requiere de un préstamo de $375 para comprar los materiales necesarios para aumentar su capacidad de producción y poder aumentar las ventas de comidas. Lilian y sus niños agradecerán tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials

loans.name: Dansi

texts.en:
Dansi S. is 37 years old and a mother of four. For more than 10 years, she has sold store-bought fish in addition to occasionally working as a seamstress. From a poor family, the little income she brings in makes her practically the only member who can provide for its daily needs. 10 years of experience has given her many customers, but lacking sufficient working assets, she is unable to satisfy their demand.

To build up a good stock of fish, bought in bulk directly from fishermen instead of in shops, she is requesting a $850 loan to diversify and improve her business. This will allow her to have a consistent and regular form of income, and to improve her financial and social situation.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame S. Dansi est âgé de 37 ans. Elle exerce le commerce de poissons acheté en détail depuis plus de 10 ans en complément de son métier de couture qu’elle exerce de façon occasionnelle. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle est pratiquement la seule à pourvoir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille avec les maigres recettes qu’elle fait dans son activité. L’expérience de 10 ans lui a permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire faute de fond de roulement suffisant.

Pour disposer de stocks importants de poissons achetés en gros cette fois-ci directement au port, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 pour redynamiser son commerce afin d’avoir un revenu consistant et régulier et changer sa situation financière et sociale.

loans.use: Purchase of fish in bulk

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en: Semeni is married and has four children. She lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. Semeni sells fried fish near her residence. She collects fresh fish from fishermen on the Indian Ocean shores, spices them, and fries them to be ready for sale. She wants to make her  business more profitable. Proper equipment for storage and fish treatment before sale will help her improve her business. The display case and aluminium wrapping materials will even make her business attractive and therefore profitable. The increased income will enable her to save for school fees for her children. To implement her plan, she needs USD 550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is 68 years old and married with 6 grown sons. All of her sons are married with their own families except the youngest, César, who is 33 years old and still lives with Gregoria and her husband.

Gregoria makes decorative handcrafted pottery. She says that she started in this profession when she was still a young girl and learned all that she knows from her mother. She has passed all of her knowledge of ceramics to her sons, who, although they have taken up other professions, also work helping Gregoria make her products.

She is the only artesan who crafts the little clay hens known round the world. Gregoria has traveled through several countries exhibiting the decorative little pieces in international fairs. Thanks to her skills and her knowledge of art she has visited Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Brasil and a few European countries. Due to her advanced age, she can no longer make the journey to other countries. Her youngest son, however, continues representing her and bringing her work all over the world, to places as far away as China and Japan.

Gregoria remarks that she always received the support of Fundación Paraguaya when she needed money to cover the costs of her travels to other countries. She is applying for a loan since she sees a lot of demand for her products now that they are well known and available for purchase in her house. She will invest the loan in the wholesale purchase of paints and clay, the raw materials for the crafting of her decorative pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria tiene 68 años y es casada tiene 6 hijos varones ya mayores. Todos están casados y han formado sus respectivas familias a excepción del menor, César, quien tiene 33 años y aún vive con ellos.

Gregoria elabora artesanías decorativas D. barro (arcilla). Cuenta que se inició en la profesión cuando aún era niña y todo lo que sabe lo aprendió D. su madre. Ella, a su vez, fue pasando todos sus conocimientos a sus hijos que a pesar D. haber adquirido otros oficios y profesiones también trabajan apoyando a su madre en la elaboración D. sus productos.

Es la única que elabora las conocidas mundialmente “gallinitas D. barro”, que son figuras decorativas con la que Gregoria ha recorrido varios países exhibiéndolas en ferias internacionales; gracias a su habilidad y su noción del arte ha visitado países como Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Brasil y algunos países D. Europa. Cuenta que debido a su avanzada edad ya no pueD. hacer dichos viajes, no obstante su hijo menor la sigue representando, llevando todo lo que ella elabora a distintos puntos del mundo entre ellos China y Japón.

Remarcó que siempre obtuvo apoyo D. la Fundación Paraguaya que le otorgó préstamos en los casos en que necesitaba D. dinero para cubrir parte D. sus pasajes para sus viajes al exterior. Solicita un crédito ya que tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes que ya la conocen y que compran sus productos D. su casa. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. pinturas y barro (arcilla) en mayor cantidad que son materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración D. sus artículos decorativos.

loans.use: Buy paints, paint brushes and clay

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. is a young lady aged 25 and a mother of three. Her children are very young: one is in primary 1 while others are in nursery school. She is very hard working and focused. She has managed to service three loans of $85 each and is working towards getting a bigger loan of at least $200.

Janet sells doughnuts and cakes to nearby shops and schools in the neighbourhood. The demand for her doughnuts has increased. She recently received an order to supply 200 doughnuts to two schools, which will earn her $22 per day. With these earnings, she will be in a good position to pay back the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: Janet wants to buy five cartons of wheat flour, one bag of sugar, cooking oil and new baking tins.

loans.name: Pauline Yilignan

texts.fr:
Pauline Yilignan M., an office secretary by profession, was born on June 29, 1964 in Lomé. She is the single mother of one daughter and has four other people in her care. She lives in the Tokoin Gbonvié district. With no fixed employment, she does word processing at home, which is not ideal. She is very ambitious and wants to open a cyber facility, but her small savings are insufficient, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy computers and equipment for her facility. This will increase her revenue.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

M. Pauline Yilignan secrétaire bureautique de profession est née le 29 juin 1964 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec une fille et quatre (04) autres personnes en charge. Elle réside dans le quartier Tokoin Gbonvié. Ne trouvant pas d'emploi fixe elle fait des traitement de texte à domicile ce qui ne l'avantage pas. Très ambitieuse, elle veut ouvrir un cyber mais devant ses maigres économies qui sont insuffisant, elle sollicite un montant de $1000 pour l’achat des ordinateurs et des équipements pour son cyber. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d'affaire

loans.use: To buy computers for a cyber facility

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru:
Mipsharif Saloevich A. has been selling clothes on the market for 17 years. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is not employed and the clothes business is the primary source of income for the Asrarov family. At first he was purchasing clothes in credit from the wholesalers and selling them at the market. However, due to the competition on the market Mr. A. was forced to find an alternative lending source... In the beginning of 2005 he found out about the credit program "Microintrest". Mr. A. received a loan and with that money was able to purchase goods from wholesalers without credit, which resulted in lower prices. After receiving more loans he was able to import the goods himself, bypassing the wholesaler altogether. Currently Misharif A. regularly travels to Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) himself to import the clothes he will sell at the market. He also sells clothes in credit to the small merchants from kishlaks (mountain villages) which is profitable for both parties. A part of the income he uses to support his family, but majority he has dedicated to expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Асроров Миршариф Салоевич в течение 17 лет торгует на вещевом рынке. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена не работает, не имеет постоянного дохода. Торговля на рынке основной доход семьи. Впервые время он брал за безналичный расчет под реализацию товар у оптовиков и продавал. Из-за конкуренции на рынке он был вынужден искать источник финансирования... В начале 2005г он узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив, первый кредит он начал за наличные деньги покупать товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам. После получения следующих кредитов у него появилась, возможность самому привозит товар. В данное время он привозит товар сам из Бишкека (Кыргызстан) Теперь он сам дает под реализацию мелким торговцам из кишлаков, что взаимовыгодно обеим сторонам. Часть прибыли он тратит на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть направляет в свой бизнес.

loans.use: Goods' assortment increasing

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
I am Majeedan S. A.. I have lived all my life in Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight. I and my husband together manufacture cloth on our looms. I need a loan for our cloth manufacturing business. Our business generates decent profits. We plan to save money for our children’s marriage.

I have a friend in my neighborhood and I want to help her and get loan. We together assume loan responsibility for each other. Safia B. needs to buy animals for their livestock trading business.

loans.use: Expand cloth manufacturing business

loans.name: Muminchon

texts.en:
S. Muminchon is 44 years old. Together with his wife, he has raised two children. The eldest one is already married, while the youngest helps his parents in running the family business.

Muminchon and his wife (shown in the photograph) run two sales stands at the local markets. Muminchon has been in this business already for four years. He sells bread, meat products and cooked meats like sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurter, and dairy products, such as cheese and butter. This sales business is the main source of income for the family and brings in a stable profit.   

Muminchon has borrowed from IMON several times in the past, and has proved himself as a reliable and honest client. Currently, he is asking for a loan of US$700 to be repaid in 6 months. Muminchon will use the loan to purchase bread, flour, meat products, and cooked meats for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, flour, and meat products for sale

loans.name: Ernawati

texts.en: Ernawati, 31, is married to D. and has one child, age 8. D. works as a bus driver and earns $25 a week. To add to her family income, she helps her husband by selling sheets, blankets, mats, etc., on credit door-to-door, and she earns $10 a day. She is requesting a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Mr. Victor R. is 45 years old and has 2 children. He is married to Mrs. María Augusta Martínez, who is 48. Victor owns a convenience store that has been in business for 10 years and thanks to his efforts and savings he now has his own business premises in a very good location.

His wife works in Copaco, the company responsible for the telephone service in Paraguay. Thanks to her good sense of responsibility she has been promoted to Head of Administration.

Victor feels very happy and satisfied with his family and his work. He says that thanks for his good earnings he can give a good education to his children. The family is already saving for the children's university studies. One of his future projects is the set-up of a butcher shop in his convenience store, which will allow him to increase his clientele by offering a full range of basic necessities in his store.

Today Victor is requesting a loan he will invest in the purchase of a variety of merchandise for the store such as: fruit, vegetables, eggs, canned good, baked good, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Víctor R. tiene 45 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, él está casado con la señora María Augusta Martínez de 48 años de edad. Víctor es propietario de una despensa con 10 años de funcionamiento y gracias a esfuerzos y ahorros ya posee un local propio con una muy buena ubicación.

Su esposa trabaja en Copaco la entidad encargada de las líneas telefónicas de país. Gracias a su gran sentido de responsabilidad ya la han a Jefa Administrativa.

Víctor se siente muy feliz y satisfecho con su familia y trabajo, dice que gracias a sus buenos ingresos pueden dar una buena educación a sus hijos y ya están ahorrando para los estudios universitarios de ellos. Uno de los futuros proyectos que tiene es la de habilitar una carnicería en su despensa, de este modo podrá aumentar su clientela surtiendo de todo lo básico en su negocio.

Hoy Víctor solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías varias para la despensa como: frutas, vegetales, huevos, productos enlatados y de limpieza, panificados, gaseosas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, eggs, canned goods, cleaning products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Hidaya's Maua Women Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 16, 5, and 3 years old. Hidaya owns a small general store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her store. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Nuru, Aneth, Zuhura and Husina, who sell cosmetics, charcoal, and food, and have a tailor shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Saratou

texts.fr:
Miss Saratou A. was born on January 14, 1974 in Lomé. She lives in the district of Totsi in Lomé and is engaged in ambulant sales of lengths of African print cloth and costume jewelry. She covers a distance of about 12 kilometers on foot. She's a dynamic woman whose goal is to be able to set up a sales point in one of the marketplaces.

With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of US$ 725 to purchase costume jewelry and 20 lengths of cloth so as to have a more attractive inventory and make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Saratou est née le 14 janvier 1974 à Lomé. Elle habite dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé et est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes et de bijoux. Elle parcourt à pieds environs une distance de 12 km. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a un projet de s’installer dans l’un des marchés de la place. A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCA pour acheter des bijoux et 20 pièces de pagnes en vue d’avoir un stock attrayant et de mieux vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 lengths of African print cloth

Achat de 20 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina is a very cheerful woman, who is well-liked in her small home village of Santa Lucia, which she left after the birth of her children, in search of opportunities. She currently lives in the city of Juliaca, where she has a business buying and selling sheepskin, as well as fine local fibres ("Alpaca"). She then sells large quantities of these materials wholesale to a textile company in the city of Arequipa. With the profits resulting from years of hard work, this enterprising and loving mother was finally able to provide a good and safe home to her three children, who are continuing successfully with their secondary education. By increasing the level of investment in her business, Florentina expects that the quality of life for her and her family will increase.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina es una mujer muy alegre y querida en su localidad, desde que les concedió el don de vida a sus queridos hijos decidió abandonar su pueblito natal Santa Lucía, en busca de mejores oportunidades, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que vive en dicha ciudad viene dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de cuero de oveja y fibra de alpaca, luego de juntar una buena cantidad los despacha al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa. Esta emprendedora y amorosa mujer con los beneficios que logró obtener durante estos largos años de trabajo, pudo finalmente ofrecerles un techo propio y seguro a sus 3 hijos, quienes vienen siguiendo con satisfacción sus estudios secundarios; Florentina considera que aumentando su capital de inversión podrá mejorar aun más su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: To increase capital for her business.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the widow of M. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. Shamim baji is the mother of two sons, and both drive a transport truck. Shamim baji has a clothing business, and she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Kanizan baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle); and Rashida baji wants a loan to buy garments for her clothing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Delali

texts.fr: Delali E. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Delali est revendeuse de poissons et d’autres produits congelés depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est à son troisième crédit et souhaite par ce dernier augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des poissons, des croupions, des saucisses et autres.
texts.en:
Delali E. is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been a retailer of fish and other frozen foods for more than five years. This is her third loan. With it, she hopes to expand her business by buying fish, rump steaks, sausages, and other such foods.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish for retail

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El caballero Ignacio V. se dedica desde que era un niño a la actividad agropecuaria dedicándose a la producción de ganado lechero y a la producción de granos básicos y de oleaginosas. Es originario del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde habita junto con su cónyuge y con sus dos pequeños hijitos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para la siembra de ajonjolí. Por esta razón espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar con su actividad económica y continuar manteniendo a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Caballero Ignacio V. has worked since he was a boy in agriculture, in the production of cow’s milk and staple grains and oils. His is originally from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega where he lives with his partner and their two little, school-age children.

Today, he has turned to Ceprodel to get a loan that will allow him to purchase supplies for the sowing of sesame. For this reason he hopes that his is granted the loan to continue with his work and to support his family that so needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Supplies for Sowing

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Sembrar en quechua.
Rodecinda es casada, tiene 58 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 6 hijos viven con ella, Rodecinda tiene un puesto alquilado al frontis del mercado Magdalena en donD. compra tara, cochinilla, tara, D. productores que vienen D. diferentes pueblos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche. Además Rodecinda viaja a las ferias los días sábados y domingos donD. también compra los mismos productos.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara, cochinilla, cuero.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Banco Comunal Tarpuy (which means sow/plant in quechua). Rodecinda a 58-year-old married mother of 10 children, of which 6 live with her. Rodecinda has a rented space at the Magdalena market where she trades dye and leather with producers that come from different towns. She does this with the help of her daughter from 6 in the morning to 7 at night. She also travels to the Saturday and Sunday fairs where she acquires the same products. She asks for a loan to purchase dye and leather.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dye and leather

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream. Bukola is 23 years old and married with one child. Bukola has been in this business for the past 2 years. She works in her shop from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday to Sunday. Bukola hopes for a loan of N100, 000 ($850 USD) to purchase more inventory for her shop. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream for her beauty salon
